title: Retail Sales Developer Skåne
description:
Vår nuvarande Retail Sales Developer i Skåne kommer att avancera inom företaget. Därför söker vi nu en vikarie till honom – kanske är det du som tar nästa steg i din försäljningskarriär?


Vill du representera ett av Sveriges mest välkända varumärken inom fryst mat och ta nästa steg i din försäljningskarriär? Då kan detta vara din nästa utmaning!

**Om oss**


Findus är en del av **Nomad Foods**, Europas största livsmedelsföretag inom fryst mat, med starka varumärken som Birds Eye, Aunt Bessie’s och Iglo. Vi är över 8000 medarbetare i 22 länder, och våra fem största marknader är Storbritannien, Italien, Tyskland, Sverige och Frankrike.


Vår vision är tydlig: **To be the world’s frozen food champion**. Vi älskar vår mat, vi tar ansvar, vi får saker att hända tillsammans, vi är ödmjuka och ambitiösa – och vi bryr oss.

**Om rollen**


Vi söker nu en engagerad och affärsdriven **Retail Sales Developer / Fältsäljare** som vill vara med och utveckla vår och våra kunders försäljning och lönsamhet i **Skåne**. Vårt mål är att våra kunder ska se oss som en professionell samarbetspartner i butik – någon de kan få goda råd av baserade på fakta.


Du blir en nyckelperson i vårt säljteam och en viktig ambassadör för Findus – ett varumärke som står för klimatsmarta, lönsamma och högkvalitativa produkter.

**Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden**

* Utveckla butikernas fryskategori och optimera avdelningar för ökad lönsamhet och kundupplevelse.
* Skapa och vårda starka kundrelationer genom att förstå behov och erbjuda skräddarsydda lösningar.
* Driva kampanjer, lansera nyheter och genomföra säljfrämjande aktiviteter.
* Planera och strukturera dina kundbesök för att maximera värdet i varje möte.

**Vi söker dig som**

* Har 3–5 års erfarenhet av fältsälj inom dagligvaruhandeln med dokumenterat goda resultat  

*–* eller dig som idag arbetar som frysansvarig i butik och har ett naturligt säljdriv som du vill utveckla vidare.
* Är lösningsfokuserad, självgående och affärsdriven.
* Har god analytisk förmåga och kan omvandla data till insikter.
* Är en utpräglad teamspelare som gläds åt kollegors framgångar och gärna delar med dig av lärdomar.
* Har höga ambitioner och ser ditt distrikt som ditt eget företag.
* Har gärna erfarenhet av att arbeta med kundgrupperingar.


Vi strävar efter mångfald i vårt team och välkomnar sökanden med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter.

**För att lyckas i rollen behöver du**

* Flytande svenska i tal och skrift samt god förståelse för engelska
* Goda kunskaper i Officepaketet
* B-körkort

**Vi erbjuder dig**

* Ett engagerat och stöttande team med god laganda!
* En spännande roll i ett marknadsledande företag med starka varumärken.
* Möjlighet att påverka och utveckla ditt distrikt.
* En kultur som präglas av samarbete, innovation och hållbarhet.
* En arbetsplats där vi tror på att växa tillsammans – både som team och som individer.

**Om tjänsten & ansökan**


Tjänsten är ett vikariat med start så snart som möjligt och sträcker sig till februari 2027, med möjlighet till förlängning. Tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse och placeringen är i Skåne.


Vi arbetar med löpande urval, så skicka gärna in din ansökan så snart som möjligt – tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag.

**Låter det som något för dig? Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!**

title: Senior CRM-utvecklare – Microsoft Dynamics (Region Stockholm)
description:
**Din nästa utmaning väntar hos VIPAS AB!**


Föreställ dig en värld där teknologi alltid fungerar för dig – effektivt, skalbart och innovativt. På **VIPAS AB** gör vi detta möjligt. Som IT-konsult skapar vi skräddarsydda lösningar med modern teknik som **Java, Python och Dynamics CRM**. Nu söker vi en **Senior CRM-utvecklare** som vill vara med och forma framtiden tillsammans med oss i Stockholm.

#### **Om uppdraget**

##### **Vill du vara med och utveckla framtidens digitala lösningar för kollektivtrafiken i Region Stockholm? Vi söker nu en Senior CRM-utvecklare som vill bidra till samhällsnytta genom att skapa moderna, effektiva och användarvänliga system.**

##### **Du blir en nyckelperson i ett agilt team på ca 10 personer, där du arbetar med vidareutveckling och förvaltning av ett verksamhetskritiskt Microsoft Dynamics CRM On-Prem-system. Systemet är tätt integrerat med flera webbportaler och externa lösningar.**

### **️** **Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**


 1. Utveckling, anpassning och underhåll av Dynamics CRM On-Prem.


 2. Deltagande i arkitektur- och lösningsdiskussioner.


 3. Samarbeta tvärfunktionellt inom teamet och bidra till helheten – från behovsanalys till implementation.


 4. Ständigt arbeta för stabilitet, säkerhet och kvalitet i systemen.

### **Vi söker dig som har**


 5+ års erfarenhet av utveckling i **Microsoft Dynamics CRM On-Prem**.


 God förståelse för **systemintegrationer** och komplexa IT-miljöer.


 Erfarenhet av **agilt arbetssätt**.


 Mycket god kommunikativ förmåga på **svenska och engelska**.


 Förmåga att ta säkerhetsklassning.

### **Vi erbjuder**


 Ett uppdrag i **samhällsviktig verksamhet** med tydligt syfte.


 Engagerade kollegor i ett kompetent, tvärfunktionellt team.


 Möjlighet till **hybridarbete** – minst 50% på kontoret på Lindhagensgatan.


 En arbetsplats som värdesätter **öppenhet, kompetens, pålitlighet och samverkan**.


**Ansök senast:** Löpande urval – skicka din ansökan så snart som möjligt.  

**Krav:** Konsulten ska signera sekretessförbindelse innan uppdragsstart.

  



**Gör skillnad med VIPAS AB!**


Som IT-konsult hos VIPAS får du arbeta i spännande projekt som formar framtiden inom Telekom, Automotive, Retail och Banking. Vi erbjuder konkurrenskraftiga anställningspaket enligt Teknikföretagen (Almega) och en miljö där din kompetens värderas.

**Ansök idag**: swathi.hr@vipas.se

**Notera:** Endast för dig med svenskt PR/citizenship eller arbetstillstånd.

### **Hur du ansöker:**


Intresserade kandidater uppmanas att ansöka genom att skicka in sitt CV och personliga brev. Bli en del av VIPAS AB och bidra till innovation!

**Observera:** Vi erbjuder löpande rekrytering, vilket innebär att uppdrag ibland tas bort innan sista ansökningsdag. Om du är intresserad rekommenderar vi därför att du ansöker omgående.

title: Power BI Developer
description:
Vill du använda din analytiska förmåga och datadrivna insikter för att skapa verklig affärsnytta? På Advania ger vi människor kraften att skapa hållbara värden genom smart användning av teknik – och nu söker vi dig som vill vara med och vidareutveckla vår Power BI-leverans inom affärsområdet Development.


Hos oss blir du en del av ett engagerat team som arbetar nära verksamheten för att förvandla data till strategiska beslut. Du samarbetar med kollegor inom bland annat SharePoint och PowerApps, och får möjlighet att påverka både arbetssätt och tekniska lösningar.

**Power BI Developer på Advania**
---------------------------------

På vårt affärsområde Development hjälper vi våra kunder att utveckla digitala lösningar som stöttar affärsprocesser, förbättrar beslutsfattande och skapar värde genom datadrivna insikter.


I rollen som Power BI Developer -hos oss arbetar du med att förvandla komplexa datamängder till tydliga och användbara beslutsunderlag. Det innebär att du fokuserar på att:

* Utveckla och underhålla Power BI-rapporter och dashboards
* Samla in och analysera krav från verksamheten
* Säkerställa datakvalitet och struktur i underliggande datakällor
* Stötta och utbilda användare i självbetjäningslösningar i Power BI


Utöver det ovannämnda ansvarar du även för att samarbeta med olika avdelningar för att förstå affärsbehov och bidra till att skapa hållbara, långsiktiga lösningar som gör skillnad i vardagen.


Rollen är baserad i Malmö och du rapporterar till Team Manager inom affärsområdet Development. Teamet som du ingår i består av specialister inom bland annat Power BI, SharePoint, PowerApps och andra Microsoft 365-teknologier.


Det som gör rollen unik är att du får arbeta nära både teknik och verksamhet, i ett team där vi ständigt utmanar oss själva att bli bättre. Du får utrymme att påverka hur vi arbetar med data och visualisering, och samtidigt bidra till något större – att ge människor kraften att fatta bättre beslut genom smart användning av teknik.

**Vad vi söker hos dig**
------------------------

För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du är en kommunikativ och lösningsorienterad person som trivs i gränslandet mellan teknik och verksamhet. Du är pedagogisk, strukturerad och nyfiken – och gillar att hitta nya sätt att skapa värde med data.


Vi ser gärna att du har:

* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med Power BI i en professionell miljö
* God förståelse för datamodellering, DAX och ETL-processer
* Vana att arbeta med SQL och databashanteringsverktyg
* Förmåga att förklara teknisk information på ett tydligt och enkelt sätt
* En analytisk inställning med öga för förbättring och kvalitet


Meriterande:

* Erfarenhet av Azure, Data Factory, Qlik eller Tableau
* Certifiering inom Power BI eller Microsoft BI-plattformen

### **Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!**

Visa gärna ditt intresse så snart som möjligt då vi intervjuar löpande. Vi välkomnar sökanden med olika bakgrunder, erfarenheter och synsätt, eftersom vi vet att en bredare mångfald berikar var och en av oss och stärker såväl effektivitet som kreativitet i vårt arbete.


Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess genomgår våra slutkandidater en obligatorisk bakgrundskontroll, en för oss kvalitativ kontroll inför ett anställningsbeslut. Advania samarbetar även med Ljung & Sjöberg för en proaktiv arbetsplats kopplat till alkohol och droger.


Tveka inte att höra av dig om du har några frågor eller funderingar.
company_description: Advania är ett techbolag som utformar skräddarsydda lösningar och skapar hållbara värden genom smart användning av teknik.

title: Utvecklare .Net
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.

 **Din profil (Skall krav)**

* Minst 10 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av utveckling i .NET och C#


* Minst 5 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av arbete med microservices-arkitektur
* Minst 5 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av arbete med containerteknik (Docker och Kubernetes/OpenShift)


* Aktuell dokumenterad erfarenhet av att ha arbetat med och utvecklat REST API:er
* Aktuell dokumenterad erfarenhet av att ha arbetat med Git i teammiljö
* Aktuell dokumenterad erfarenhet av att ha arbetat i xUnit, NUnit eller annat ramverk för enhetstester


* Aktuell dokumenterad erfarenhet av att ha arbetat med Elasticsearch
* Aktuell dokumenterad erfarenhet av MSSQL och Oracle DB
* Aktuell dokumenterad erfarenhet av utveckling och metoder i autonoma agila utvecklingsteam (ex. Scrum)


* Aktuell dokumenterad erfarenhet av ActiveMQ eller liknande meddelandeköer
* Aktuell dokumenterad erfarenhet av att ha arbetat med DevOps-verktyg, CI/CD- pipelines, t.ex. ArgoCD, Tekton, GitOps eller motsvarande


* Aktuell dokumenterad erfarenhet av verktygen Jira och Confluence


Med aktuell dokumenterad erfarenhet avses erfarenhet inom de senaste tre (3) åren.

 **Meriterande*** Erfarenhet av att coacha och stödja juniora kollegor i team


* Erfarenhet av att stödja arkitekturella vägval och att sätta sig in i verksamhetskritiska processer
* Erfarenhet av att ha arbetat som Tech Lead
* Erfarenhet av att driva förbättringar kopplat till produkten och arbetssätt i team
* Erfarenhet av att ha arbetat med ServiceNow

 **Sista ansökningdatum:** 27-10-2025 **Om Oss**  

  

Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?

  

Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.


Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.


En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.


Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.


Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.


Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?


Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.

  

Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.


Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?  

  

*Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.*

title: Android Platform Developer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*  

  

**Your Profile (Must-have requirements)**

  

* Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Electronics, or a related field
* A minimum of 8 years of overall professional experience in software development or related technical roles
* At least 5 years of professional software development experience
* Solid skills in Kotlin and familiarity with TradeFed
* Hands-on experience with tools like Android Studio, Gerrit, Jenkins, Jira, and Artifactory
* Strong background in unit and automated integration testing
* Practical experience in agile or Scrum-based workflows

  

  

  

  

**Application deadline:** 21-10-2025  


  

**About Us**  

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.  

  

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?  

  

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.


A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.


Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.


Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.


Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?


Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.


Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.


Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Senior Frontend Developer
description:
**Would you like to make a difference by using your technical skills to create innovative payment solutions?**


TF Avarda Group is a leading provider of white-label payment and financing solutions for businesses across various industries. Focusing on simplifying the payment process and enhancing customer experience, Avarda enables 250 companies to thrive in the rapidly changing digital landscape with its advanced, true white-label offering for payments. We manage 4 million consumers annually and process millions of transactions worth over SEK 16 billion.


At Avarda, you will have the opportunity to be part of an exciting journey as we build a state-of-the-art platform that transforms how e-commerce merchants handle payments. As a Senior Frontend Engineer, you will play a key role in designing and developing our frontend solutions.  



  

**Why should you join us?**

We offer more than just a technical challenge – you will become part of a team building the future of payment solutions with modern, unified technology. With us, you can grow both technically and personally, as we shape stronger work processes and develop innovative solutions for future products. We are building a modern platform that supports current and future products, and you will help create a stronger company culture and more efficient ways of working.


Our frontend platform is based on React and Elm stack, mainly deployed in Azure.


We have a distributed tech team with employees in Borås, Stockholm, Gdansk, Malaga, and a partner in the Czech Republic. Our payment and card services are used in 13 European markets, and travel may be required.  



  

**Your responsibilities will include:**

* Designing and implementing scalable, maintainable frontend solutions using React and Elm.
* Collaborating with designers and backend developers to deliver seamless user experiences.
* Leading code reviews, mentoring junior developers, and contributing to the team’s growth.
* Optimizing application performance and ensuring cross-browser compatibility.
* Advocating for best practices in frontend development, including testing, accessibility, and security.
Keeping up to date with new technologies and suggesting innovative solutions.  
* 

  

**We believe you have:**

* At least 5 years of experience in frontend development.
* Expertise in React and experience with Elm (or a willingness to quickly learn Elm).
* Deep understanding of JavaScript/TypeScript, HTML, and CSS.
* Good understanding of UX principles.
* Proven ability to design and develop complex web applications.
* Experience with state management tools (e.g., Redux, etc.) and frontend build tools (e.g., Webpack, Vite).
* Knowledge of testing tools (e.g., Jest, Cypress).
* Excellent problem-solving skills and a focus on clean, maintainable code.
Strong communication and collaboration skills in a team environment.  
* 

  

**Preferred qualifications:**

* Knowledge of Elm.
* Experience with functional programming.
* Knowledge of backend development.
* Experience with CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices.

title: FPGA developer
description:
FPGA Engineer - Advanced Systems

Location: Uppsala Area, Sweden (Hybrid)  
Job Type: Full-Time, Contract/Permanent Options

About the Role

We're partnering with a forward-thinking tech firm at the forefront of mission-critical systems to find an FPGA specialist. Dive into designing and verifying high-reliability digital solutions for demanding environments. You'll collaborate on innovative hardware prototypes, optimize performance, and ensure seamless integration in cutting-edge applications. Perfect for those who thrive on technical challenges and real-world impact.Key Responsibilities

* Architect and implement FPGA designs using industry-standard languages and tools.
* Develop and execute verification strategies, including simulations and testing protocols.
* Optimize designs for efficiency, targeting specific constraints like power and timing.
* Integrate FPGA modules with surrounding systems and support deployment phases.
* Troubleshoot issues and contribute to design reviews for robust outcomes.
* Stay ahead of emerging tech trends to enhance project deliverables.

Qualifications

* MSc or equivalent in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or a closely aligned discipline.
* At least 5 years hands-on with FPGA development (VHDL/Verilog/SystemVerilog).
* Strong grasp of digital design principles, including state machines and interfaces.
* Experience with synthesis, place-and-route tools, and simulation environments.
* Proficient in scripting (e.g., Python/Tcl) for automation.
* Comfortable with English; Swedish a bonus for team dynamics.

Desirable Experience

* Background in high-stakes sectors like aerospace, defense, or embedded tech.
* Knowledge of radiation-hardened or fault-tolerant designs.

What We Offer

* Dynamic hybrid setup blending collaboration and flexibility.
* Exposure to groundbreaking projects with global reach.
* Solid perks including professional growth support, wellness initiatives, and competitive comp.

Job Type: Full-time

Work Location: In person

title: Junior Frontend Developer till globalt industriföretag
description:
### **Beskrivning**


Vi söker en **Junior Frontend Developer** till ett internationellt team inom tillverknings- och industrisystem. I denna roll får du arbeta i en agil miljö där du utvecklar och förbättrar webbaserade applikationer som används globalt. Uppdraget passar dig som vill växa inom frontend, trivs i ett tekniskt team och har en stark vilja att lära och ta ansvar.


Vi arbetar med löpande urval – vänta därför inte med att skicka din ansökan.

### **Arbetsuppgifter**

* Delta i utveckling och förbättring av frontend-funktioner i olika interna produkter.
* Arbeta med featureutveckling, bugghantering och tekniskt underhåll.
* Ta fram förslag på förbättringar i samråd med team och arkitekter.
* Skapa och underhålla teknisk dokumentation.
* Arbeta i ett internationellt agilt team med daglig kommunikation på engelska.

### **Kvalifikationer**

**Skall-krav:**

* Kunskap inom **HTML5, CSS och JavaScript**.
* Erfarenhet av **webbramverk**, gärna **Vue** eller liknande (t.ex. React, Angular).
* Förståelse för **responsiv design**.
* Erfarenhet av **Git** och arbete i agila utvecklingsmetoder.
* Mycket goda kunskaper i **engelska**, tal och skrift.

**Meriterande:**

* Erfarenhet av **Docker**, **CI/CD** och **Single Page Applications**.
* Förståelse för **REST API:er** och datamodellering.
* Tidigare erfarenhet av utveckling i större organisation eller produktteam.

### **Personliga egenskaper**

* Lärandeorienterad och nyfiken.
* Ansvarstagande med känsla för kvalitet och detaljer.
* Strukturerad, organiserad och kommunikativ.

### **Villkor**

* **Anställningsform:** Konsultuppdrag – du blir anställd av oss och uthyrd till kund.
* **Omfattning:** Heltid, 100%.
* **Start:** 1 november 2025 eller enligt överenskommelse.
* **Slutdatum:** 31 december 2026.
* **Plats:** På plats i Lund.

### **Ansökan**


Skicka in ditt CV där det tydligt framgår hur du uppfyller skall-kraven. Vi presenterar kandidater löpande och uppdraget kan komma att stängas innan sista ansökningsdatum.


Välkommen med din ansökan!

**Observera att vi inte tar emot ansökningar via e-post på grund av GDPR.**  

**För att din ansökan ska kunna behandlas ber vi dig därför att skicka in den via vår** **karriärsida**

title: Senior fullstack Java utvecklare – Stockholm heltid
description:
Modernera är ett modernt rekryteringsföretag. www.modernera.se
  
För en kunds räkning söker vi nu en senior fullstack Java utvecklare. Vår kund är ett marknadsledande företag inom webbaserade lösningar för lärare och skolledare och används av 2000+ skolor och över 1,1 miljon användare. Företaget har funnits sedan 2003 och har över 40 medarbetare.
  
Du kommer att jobba i trevliga lokaler i centrala Stockholm. Det finns möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån.
  
Du kommer att arbeta med företagets utvecklingsteam och produktledning för att bygga smarta lösningar för elevadministration, kommunikation, lärplattformar och schemaläggning, och på så sätt förenkla skolarbetet för lärare, elever och vårdnadshavare i hela Sverige.
  
  

**Krav:**  

Du har över fem års erfarenhet av systemutveckling från tidigare arbete
  
Goda kunskaper i Java och frontend-ramverk som React, Vue, Angular eller motsvarande
  
Du behärskar svenska och engelska i tal och skrift
  
  

**Meriterande:**  

Erfarenhet av front- och backendutveckling, gränssnittsutveckling, single-page-applications och mobila klienter ses som meriterande.
  
  

**Du får:**  

En unik och speciell arbetsplats med fantastiskt kunniga kollegor
  
Ett stimulerande och utvecklande arbete där du får vara med och påverka Sveriges utbildning och skola
  
Stora möjligheter att påverka bolagets utveckling
  
Du kommer att bli anställd hos vår kund. Heltid. Tillsvidareanställning. Fast lön, enligt överenskommelse. Tillträde: omgående.
  
Ansök genom att skicka ditt CV och personligt brev till info@modernera.se. Skriv “Senior fullstack Java utvecklare – Stockholm heltid” i ärenderaden.

title: Senior Frontend Developer (SEO & Performance)
description:
At Desenio Group, a Swedish e-commerce success story, we’re passionate about interior décor and design. Our mission is simple: on-trend, high-quality wall art should be available to everyone. Since our inception, we’ve expanded our offering and now reach customers in over 30 countries. Inspired by Scandinavian style, we provide a wide range of wall art and mounting solutions that help people create beautiful spaces.



We’re now looking for a Senior Frontend Developer (SEO & Performance) - a unique hybrid role for someone who thrives at the intersection of technical SEO leadership and hands-on web development. You’ll own backlink strategies, drive technical SEO improvements and be the one who codes and implements performance optimizations that directly impact our organic growth. You’ll also join our growing team of 7 developers, collaborating closely to shape the future of our e-commerce platform.


**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES**


**SEO Leadership**


* Develop and execute strategic link-building to boost domain authority and search rankings.
* Source and acquire premium backlink opportunities through outreach, partnerships and content-driven approaches.
* Perform comprehensive technical SEO audits, including image SEO performance, using tools like Ahrefs and Screaming Frog.
* Oversee and maintain backlink profiles, preserving strong link equity.
* Measure performance with Looker, BQ, GA4, GSC, and create actionable reporting.
* Collaborate across content, e-commerce, PR, and marketing teams to embed SEO principles in all channels.


**Web Development & Technical Execution**


* Implement SEO-driven technical improvements across site architecture, Core Web Vitals, structured data, crawlability, and indexation.
* Build, optimize, and maintain SEO-focused website features and landing pages.
* Collaborate with content and e-commerce teams to ensure site changes support organic growth.
* Proactively improve site performance (speed, mobile-first design, and accessibility).
* Work hands-on with React, TypeScript and Next.js to deliver SEO and UX enhancements.


**WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR**


* Minimum 3 years experience in an SEO role, with a clear focus on off-page and technical SEO.
* Proven success in link-building, outreach and domain authority growth.
* Strong understanding of SEO fundamentals: site speed, indexation, schema markup, crawl optimisation, and large e-commerce catalogues.
* Hands-on development skills: React, TypeScript and Next.js (plus server-side factors).
* Confidence using SEO tools (Ahrefs, Screaming Frog, GA4) and analytics (Looker/BQ).
* Excellent reporting skills, translating data into clear insights.


We're looking for you with a proactive, results-oriented mindset with strong ownership of both strategy and execution. You have a genuine interest for web development. You combine a strategic mindset with hands-on execution and thrive in a collaborative, fast-paced environment.


**IT'S A PLUS IF YOU HAVE**


* Experience with CMS platforms, Python, or large language models (LLMs).
* Knowledge of CRO, automation, or e-commerce development workflows.


**WHAT WE OFFER**



At Desenio Group you’ll be part of a young and multicultural team in the company’s beautiful office in Sockholm’s Södermalm. You’ll find the core of our brand in our office- the Art Atelier, where our in-house teams of designers, artists, and creatives develop unique art collections. With fulfillment centers in the Czech Republic and the United States, we deliver art to customers around the world. Our group consists of around 100 employees representing over 20 nationalities and together we’re solving problems every day to help the world become a more beautiful place with our affordable art.


**Start date:** As soon as possible


**Extent:** Full-time, with a 6-month probation period.


**Location:** Stockholm, Södermalm.

title: Software Developer Intern
description:
*Studies show that women and underrepresented groups often hesitate to apply unless they meet every requirement. At Stegra, we’re building an impact-driven, sustainable company - and we need a diverse, inclusive team to make it happen.*

*If you share our passion but don’t meet every qualification, we encourage you to apply anyway. You might be the perfect fit for this role, or another as we grow.*

At Stegra, we’re not just building a plant, we’re proving that sustainable industry is possible. And to do that, we need people like you.


Join a team where safety comes first. Where we support each other, learn as we go, and make space for everyone to grow and contribute. This is your chance to be part of something big - while being closer to nature and leading a balanced, purposeful life.


**What you’ll do**

Right now, we are looking for a Software Developer Intern for our Digital Steel Mill team. In this role, you will report to our Digital Domain Manager and sit within our Digital Enterprise function. The team is responsible for developing and maintaining the digital systems that power our operations.


As an intern, you’ll become an integrated part of our digital development teams, working alongside experienced engineers, designers, and product owners to help build the core digital capabilities behind Stegra’s next-generation Steel mill. Whether supporting internal tools for plant operators or backend services for data pipelines, you’ll learn through doing and contributing real code to real systems.


This is an opportunity to grow your skills and contribute to one of the world’s most ambitious digital industrial transformations. The internship runs for 9 months, with the potential for extension or full-time employment, depending on mutual interest and organizational needs. To ensure you have the best conditions for development, you’ll receive ongoing support through regular check-ins with your manager and be matched with a dedicated mentor. We’re welcoming three interns to join us, and hope this will be a valuable and inspiring first step in your journey within tech.


Specific to this role, your day-to-day tasks may include the following:

* Collaborate with developers, designers, and product teams to build and improve digital solutions
* Develop features in web frontends, backends or APIs depending on your skills and interests
* Write clean, maintainable code using modern software engineering practices
* Participate in code reviews, team stand-ups and sprint planning
* Investigate bugs and support testing and quality improvements
* Contribute to integration work with systems like MES, ERP or planning tools
* Document what you build to support maintainability and knowledge sharing

**What you’ll bring**

You’re curious and believe that real progress happens when we work together. You’re not afraid to challenge old ways of thinking - and you treat others with respect while doing it. At Stegra, we value people who take initiative, build trust, and help create a workplace where everyone can do their best.
  

  

Specific to this role, we would like to see that you can tick off a fair amount of the boxes below


* Ongoing or recently completed studies in Computer Science, Software Engineering or similar
* Some experience building digital applications — through school, side projects, bootcamps or part-time work
* Basic knowledge of at least one programming language (e.g. Java, Kotlin, Python, JavaScript, TypeScript, C#)
* Interest in backend, frontend or full-stack development
* Familiarity with Git and version control workflows
* Curiosity about digital transformation, automation, or industrial tech
* Willingness to learn, ask questions, and work as part of a team

**Bonus (but not required):**

* Experience with frameworks like React or Spring Boot
* Exposure to REST APIs, SQL, Docker, Kubernetes or CI/CD tools
* Previous internship or work in a tech team

**We are prioritizing local candidates.**  



**Benefits at Stegra**  

  

At Stegra, you’ll join a company where your work has real impact on the climate, the industry, and future generations. We’re building a culture rooted in safety, trust, and inclusion, where people feel supported to grow and thrive.


You’ll receive fair, competitive compensation aligned with collective agreements, along with benefits like up to 30 days of paid vacation, occupational pension, parental benefits, and insurance. If you need support with relocation or immigration, our relocation department will help guide you through the process, whether it’s permits, housing or other practical matters. You can also enjoy perks like subsidized gym memberships and bike leases, plus the everyday benefits of life closer to nature.


*Read more about Benefits at Stegra* here.


**This is Stegra**

Stegra is on a mission to change the global steel industry by producing green hydrogen, iron, and steel - with the goal of eliminating CO₂ emissions. Instead of coal, we use green hydrogen and fossil-free electricity, meaning our primary emissions will be water and heat.


By 2030, our ambition is to produce 5 million tonnes of green steel annually in our fully integrated, digitized, and sustainable plant in Boden, Northern Sweden - currently under construction. But this is just the beginning. Our expertise in green hydrogen will enable us to decarbonize industries beyond steel, paving the way for a cleaner future.


**Our Boden Site**


Our Boden site is located just west of Boden City, right in the heart of a growing green industrial hub in Northern Sweden. It’s where we’re building one of the world’s most modern, sustainable steel plants—designed with safety, efficiency, and people in mind. With just a 10-minute commute from town, you'll be close to both cutting-edge technology and the everyday convenience of living near nature, schools, and community life.


Boden Video

title: Sales & Business Developer - Norway
description:
**About Mynt**  

  

Mynt is an all-in-one corporate card and spend management solution, on a mission to fundamentally change business banking forever. Our digital software, coupled with corporate cards and payments infrastructure, eradicates manual administrative tasks relating to spending for businesses. Mynt is experiencing huge growth in the Nordic markets, and we have recently secured substantial funding to support our continued expansion in Sweden and internationally.  

  

Mynt is a tech-first company with a product-oriented mindset, empowering teams to create innovative solutions to complex problems. We are a licensed e-money institution, card issuer and payment processor under the supervision of the Swedish Financial Supervisory Authority. We have established key partnerships within banking, ERP, fleet and mobility - and our solutions are now live in all Nordic countries. Examples of partners include Fortnox and Nordea, with more collaborations underway.  

  

Joining Mynt means contributing to creating an exceptional product and company. We seek passionate individuals who thrive in a fast-paced environment, prioritizing customer value. With around 75+ employees (and growing fast), we plan to further expand our Platform team to support our growth.

**About the role**

**We’re growing fast – and our journey in Norway is just getting started!**

Mynt is now looking for driven and curious Sales & Business Developers to join our growing commercial team in Oslo. We’ve already built a strong local foundation with a small dedicated team on the ground, but there’s still plenty of market to conquer, and a great opportunity to come in early and make a real impact as we scale.


In this role, you’ll be part of our Norwegian sales team, helping to accelerate Mynt’s growth and strengthen our presence in the market. You’ll spend your time engaging with decision-makers like CEOs and CFOs, helping them understand how Mynt can simplify their financial processes and enable smarter growth.


You’ll manage the full commercial process – from prospecting and outreach to building strong pipelines and long-term customer relationships. Whether through cold calls, emails, LinkedIn or meetings, you’ll take initiative to open doors and lead consultative, value-driven sales conversations. Beyond the sales process, you’ll represent Mynt in the Norwegian market, acting as a trusted advisor and a true ambassador for our brand.


You’ll be based at our **Oslo office** and work closely with your local team as well as our colleagues at HQ in Stockholm. We offer a collaborative, ambitious and supportive environment where you’ll be part of an exciting phase of growth, with the chance to shape how we build and scale our Norwegian operations.


If you’re motivated by growth, enjoy a fast-moving environment and want to be part of something exciting early on, we’d love to hear from you.

**What you’ll be up to**

* Drive the full sales cycle, from prospecting and outreach to negotiation, closing, and relationship management.
* Proactively identify new business opportunities in the Norwegian market through cold calls, emails, and LinkedIn.
* Engage with C-level executives in consultative sales dialogues that create real value for customers.
* Take ownership and represent Mynt as a trusted ambassador in the Norwegian market.

**What you bring to the table**

* Proven B2B sales experience, preferably within fintech, SaaS or financial services in the Norwegian market.
* Strong customer orientation and excellent communication and negotiation skills.
* A creative, driven and results-oriented mindset, with the ability to build trust and drive business discussions at C-level.
* Experience from a startup or scale-up environment, comfortable working in a fast-paced and evolving setting.
* Fluent in Norwegian and English.

**What we can offer you**

* Be part of an amazing team in a fast-growing scale-up.
* Collaborate with fun, driven colleagues – both locally and across our Stockholm HQ.
* Enjoy a flexible work environment and a centrally located office in Norway.
* Shape your own development and responsibilities based on your passion and interest.

*The position will be filled as soon as we find a suitable candidate. Please reach out to us as soon as possible if you believe this for you!*

title: Utvecklare med inriktning mot lokaler och fastighet
description:
Ansök*Som utvecklare hos* ***Gymnasium & Arbetsmarknad påverkar du hur våra lokaler används och utvecklas – från strategiska beslut till praktiska lösningar som stärker verksamheterna. Här får du utrymme att driva utveckling, tänka nytt och bidra till miljöer där människor trivs och kan växa.***

**Rollen som utvecklare hos oss**
---------------------------------


Som utvecklare arbetar du nära ledningsgrupper, enhetschefer och rektorer, och samverkar med andra specialister för att skapa långsiktigt hållbara lösningar.


Dina huvudsakliga uppgifter är att:

* samordna och driva utvecklingsfrågor inom lokaler och fastighet
* genomföra behovsanalyser utifrån befintligt fastighetsbestånd och framtida behov
* ta fram och utveckla förvaltningens lokalplan
* förbättra interna lokalprocesser
* projektleda i verksamhetsanpassningar
* identifiera och genomföra åtgärder för ett effektivt lokalutnyttjande på en strategisk nivå


Utöver de huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifterna kommer rollen över tid att omfatta digitala verktyg för lokalplanering, hållbarhetsfrågor och samverkan med interna och externa aktörer. Med ett strategiskt tänkande driver du utvecklingsfrågor tillsammans med kollegor och hittar lösningar som är både hållbara och fungerar i vardagen för verksamhet och medarbetare.

**Din profil**
--------------


Vi söker dig som kombinerar analytisk förmåga med helhetssyn och ett genuint engagemang för samhällsutveckling. Du är tillmötesgående och lyhörd, skapar nya kontakter och underhåller befintliga arbetsrelationer. Du tar egna initiativ, ser möjligheter i förändring och bidrar med nya angreppssätt i arbetsrelaterade frågor. Du ansvarar för att driva ditt arbete framåt, leverera resultat och prioritera effektivt. Du uttrycker dig väl på svenska i både tal och skrift. Stor vikt läggs vid personlig lämplighet.


Vi söker dig som:

* högskoleexamen med relevant inriktning, alternativt motsvarande arbetserfarenhet som arbetsgivaren bedömer likvärdigt
* några års arbetserfarenhet inom fastighet- och lokalplanering
* B-körkort


Det är meriterande:

* erfarenhet från liknande arbete inom offentlig sektor
* arbetserfarenhet av att arbeta nära ledningsgrupp
* arbetserfarenhet av att analysera data och dess påverkan på verksamheten

**Läs gärna mer om oss**
------------------------


Förvaltningen för Gymnasium & Arbetsmarknad | Kungsbacka kommun

**Vårt erbjudande och övrig information**
-----------------------------------------


Vi erbjuder en tillsvidareanställning på heltid med tillsättning enligt överenskommelse.


Observera att belastningsregister kommer att behöva uppvisas i samband med anställning. Du kan beställa ett registerutdrag, här: https://polisen.se/tjanster-tillstand/belastningsregistret/skola-eller-forskola/


Bakgrundskontroller kan komma att genomföras innan anställning.


Vill du veta mer om hur det är att arbeta hos oss är du välkommen att kontakta oss eller läs mer på vår hemsida här: Att jobba hos oss | Kungsbacka kommun

**Intresserad?**
----------------


Kul! Varmt välkommen med din ansökan senast 28 oktober.


I din ansökan ska du endast bifoga ditt CV och besvara ett antal frågor som ingår i vår urvalsbedömning. För att säkerställa en rättvis och objektiv rekryteringsprocess kommer vi även att använda tester.

  

#LI-KUNGSBACKA


Inför rekryteringsarbetet har Kungsbacka kommun noggrant tagit ställning till rekryteringskanaler och marknadsföring. Vi undanber oss därför bestämt kontakt med mediesäljare, rekryteringssajter eller liknande.

title: Senior Fullstack utvecklare
description:
- **Vill du vara med på resan när vi startar upp vår Creative tech enhet i Göteborg? Vill du arbeta tillsammans med inspirerande, glada och kompetenta kollegor i ett av Göteborgs mest innovativa och centrala nav kring mjukvaruutveckling? Söker du en roll där du som konsult får vara med och skapa innovativa digitala produkter?**  



**Om rollen**  

Som fullstack-utvecklare kommer du att bidra med att bygga högkvalitativa lösningar och stabil kodbas till våra kunder som förser dem med verkligt affärsvärde. Att vara en del av ett team innebär delat ägandeskap och ansvar och vi förväntar oss att du är del av utvecklingsprocessen samtidigt som du tillför din expertis inom till exempel cloudlösningar, databas-migreringar, frontend-utveckling eller dev-ops.


***För denna roll krävs det att du är flytande i det svenska språket i tal och skrift, observera att vi endast beaktar sökande med giltigt arbetsvisum och kvalificerade arbetstillstånd.***  



**Vad förväntar vi oss av dig?**  

För att lyckas i rollen som fullstack-utvecklare tror vi att du är öppen för att möta nya idéer och är flexibel när det kommer till att möta nya utmaningar. Du njuter av samarbete och är bekväm med att dela med dig av din kunskap till kollegor och kunder. För att lyckas i rollen och på Devoteam Creative Tech tror vi även att du är ödmjuk och har en lösningsfokuserad approach.  

  




	* Teknisk expertis: Ungefär 5 års erfarenhet av fullstackutveckling
	* God vana av att skriva testbar och skalbar kod i React eller Vue, TypeScript/Javascript, Node.js
	* Erfarenhet av backend-språk och plattformar som Node.js, Go, Java eller .Net/ C#
	* Förstå värdet av kodgranskning och dess funktion i mjukvaruutveckling
	* God förståelse och erfarenhet av designa och utveckla API:er
	* Erfarenhet av arbete i agila teams
	* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med molnbaserade lösningar som AWS, GCP eller Azure
	* Relationsdatabaser och NoSQL
	* Bekväm i att hålla djupa tekniska diskussioner på Svenska och Engelska
	* Flytande svenska i tal och skrift**Även meriterande om du har erfarenhet av:**


	* Mjukvaruarkitektur (exempelvis event-baserad arkitektur)
	* CI/CD pipelines
	* Data engineering (exempelvis datamodellering, ETL, etc)**Arbetsplats**  

Arbetsplatsen för den här rollen är Göteborg med omnejd.  

  



**Om Devoteam**  

Hos oss värderar vi medarbetarnas trivsel och utveckling högt. Vi har byggt en arbetskultur där människor känner sig inspirerade, utmanade och trygga. Vi tror att när du trivs och växer, så gör även våra lösningar det.


Vi är ett ledande IT-konsultföretag med en stark förankring i Malmös och Halmstad tech-community, både som Devoteam och f.d .Jayway. Nu ska vi äntligen etablera oss i Göteborg. Vi är engagerade i att skapa långsiktiga relationer med både kunder och medarbetare. Vi drivs av en passion för teknik och innovation, och erbjuder skräddarsydda lösningar för företag inom en rad olika branscher. Bland våra initiativ kan nämnas Øredev , en av Skandinaviens största utvecklarkonferenser, som vi var med och grundade.


**Förmåner och praktisk information:**


	* Kontinuerligt lärande: Vi stöder kontinuerligt lärande med kompetensgrupper varannan vecka, deltagande på Øredev och löpande kompetensdagar för din professionella utveckling. Du har möjlighet att ta certifikat med någon av våra partners (AWS, Azure, GCP).
	* Ledighet och pension: Vi erbjuder 30 dagars semester, kompletterande föräldraledighetsersättning och tjänstepension enligt ITP1.
	* Hälsa och välbefinnande: Självklara förmåner som friskvårdsbidrag, tillgång till företagshälsovård, hälsokontroller och lunchyoga på kontoret.
	* Verktyg och utrustning: Du väljer själv de verktyg du behöver för att leverera och trivas i din arbetsmiljö.**Ansökan**  

För att ansöka, vänligen skicka din ansökan via länken nedan. Vi uppmuntrar tidiga ansökningar eftersom vi granskar dem löpande.


För eventuella frågor, kontakta Sanna Ekelöf, vår rekryterare, på sanna.ekelof@devoteam.com. Sanna kommer att vara din primära kontaktperson under hela rekryteringsprocessen.

title: Engagement - Frontend Software Engineer
description:
Our Engagement Product Development team is growing and we are now looking for a Frontend Software Engineer to join! Engagement at Betsson Group ensures our customers come back for more. It’s all about loyalty. We provide a world class customer experience beyond the game play featuring Tournaments, Dynamic personalized campaigns and much more!
 



  
 


**A taster of what you will be involved with** 

 We want to be pioneers in a highly competitive market so we continuously strive for technical and product excellence. As part of our team, you will be building new products using latest technologies; actively contributing towards our multi-brand adaptive frontend platform, which is supporting our core brands.
 



 Our Frontend stack includes Angular 16, Angular Material (Desktop), TypeScript 4, Redux Pattern for State Management, RxJS, Sass, HTML5; and the frontend consumes RESTful APIs and Web Sockets. It’s a plus if you are curious about creating reusable custom web components, utilising libraries such as StencilJS.
 



 As a Frontend Developer, you will be part of a cross functional team within our Engagement area. You will be contributing directly to the success of our products by materializing our product teams' visions into a tangible user experience. You will participate in agile rituals such as planning, estimation, development, testing, code reviews, deploying great software, implementing new features as well as maintaining and improving the existing functionality.
   

  




**You are good at** 
* TypeScript and JavaScript
* At least one JavaScript Framework (Angular 7+, AngularJS, React+Redux, or Vue.js)
* HTML, CSS, Sass or LESS
* RESTful APIs
* Understanding of micro-frontend architecture
* Unit and Integration Tests (Jasmine, Jest, Karma)
* JavaScript tooling (webpack, rollup.js)
* Scalable and performant web applications
* Agile product development



  
 


**What we offer** 


 Much like a rollercoaster, life at Betsson Group is fast-paced, full of twists and turns, and always exciting. With more than
 **2,800** 
 colleagues representing over 75 nationalities
 **across a global network of offices** 
 - including
 **1,500** 
 at our operational headquarters in Malta - every day brings new challenges and opportunities to grow. It may not be for the faint-hearted, but if you thrive on innovation, enjoy pushing boundaries and want to be part of a diverse, international team, then you’ll fit right in at Betsson.
 




  
 


 Challenge accepted?
 
***By submitting your application, you understand that your personal data will be processed as set out in our Privacy Policy***

title: Salesforce Marketing Cloud Developer
description:
Our Engagement Product Development team is growing and we are now looking for a Senior Salesforce Marketing Cloud Developer to join! Engagement at Betsson Group ensures our customers come back for more. It’s all about loyalty. We provide a world class customer experience beyond the game play featuring Tournaments, Dynamic personalized campaigns and much more!
 


**A taster of what you will be involved with** 
* Act as a consultant and technical expert on the Salesforce platform by providing support to stakeholders and users.
* Closely collaborate with experts from other areas to leverage on the Salesforce technologies through integrations with other solutions.
* Setting up new business units in SFMC that include but not limited to the configuration of the data points and FTP locations.
* Use AMP script to develop dynamic content in SFMC.
* Use SSJS to develop new custom applications in Journey Builder including leveraging the REST & SOAP APIS by creating installed packages.
* Build targeted audience segments based on email behavioral data and CRM attributes using Data Extensions and SQL Setup.
* Leveraging on the capabilities provided by Journey Builder, Automation Studio, Interaction Studio, Content Builder, Email Studio, and other solutions to deliver multi-touch communications.
* Campaigns and Triggered sends being able to oversee complex campaign workflow rules and data segmentation.
* Oversee the ETL of multiple business units that include suggesting best practices on daily automations.
* Configuring the database environment by creating the data model using data extensions and Contact Builder inside the Data Designer.
* Define data validation, cleansing, deduplication rules and processes in SFMC.
* Define data connectors for data ingestion into Salesforce across Betsson’s technical ecosystem, partnering with CRM and Data teams, as needed.
* Assist in the technical and architectural framework for the SFDC applications.
* Ensuring scalability of all the solutions developed.
* Serve as the subject matter expert for SFMC for the internal stakeholders that include managers and end-users.
* As an expert on SFMC, it is expected to gather requirements, discuss, and implement them based on best practices.
* Able to communicate technical and business solutions by developing and presenting information to multiple audiences.


**What we are looking for** 
* University degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
* Salesforce Certified Marketing Cloud Developer (or equivalent certification).
* At least 3 years of hands-on experience with Salesforce Marketing Cloud.
* Strong knowledge of Salesforce administration (minimum 1 year).
* Solid understanding of SQL, data modeling, and integration methods.
* Strong documentation and knowledge-sharing mindset.
* Ability to stay updated on industry trends, emerging technologies, and third-party solutions.
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
* Experience with JavaScript
* Experience with Salesforce Service Cloud and Sales Cloud is a plus.


**What we offer** 

 We can offer you an environment full of ambition and passion. One day is never like the other as the only constant is change, to the better, to the greater. We strive to be the best in whatever field we choose to play on, and we make sure to have fun along the way!
 


* A friendly, open and humble working environment, where you will have the chance to work alongside with colleagues from all over the world
* A chance to evolve your skills together with your colleagues with various programs and initiatives
* Personal development through courses, in-house training and external certification



 Freedom with responsibility

title: Frontend Developer
description:
**Help us redefine what it means to be a financial partner for everyday heroes**
**Sambla Group is a fintech company with a clear goal – to make personal finance better for all. We need you, your ambition and your skills on our journey. We have become the fast-growing fintech company that we are today - bridging the gap between borrowers and lenders - thanks to all the 400+ amazing people who work here.**
**With the vision to become a trusted personal finance partner, our success is the result of the commitment to deliver the best customer journey and consumer finance products in the industry. Through our well known brands such as Sambla, Advisa, Rahalaitos, Omalaina, Rahoitu and DigiFinans we support customers in consolidating and getting the best terms on their loans.**
**Right now** 
**we are looking for frontend engineers** 
 who want to be part of this journey, who care about impact, not just output. With a product mindset, you will help shape the next phase of our growth.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Build intuitive, performant, and customer-first interfaces with React (TS/JS).
* Collaborate closely with design, backend, and business colleagues to deliver seamless experiences.
* Contribute to product discovery and influence technical choices.
* Write clean, reliable code and take ownership from idea to production.
* Help evolve our frontend practices and processes as we grow.


**What We Are Looking For**
* 5+ years of frontend or fullstack experience with frequent product shipping
* Strong skills in React and modern TypeScript/JavaScript
* Experience with or curiosity for our stack: Node.js, React, TypeScript/JavaScript, Next.js, and AWS (including CDK and CloudFormation)
* Solid experience building frontend systems that balance usability with performance, maintainability, and scalability.
* Bonus: React Native, app-first mindset, AI-driven workflows.
* Above all: a product mindset, you want to understand why we build things and you see impact as important as delivery.


**Why this role?**
* Shape the experience: Play a key role in how customers interact with our products and bring design ideas to life.
* Build for impact: Create intuitive and accessible interfaces that thousands of people rely on every day.
* Grow and explore: Join at a stage where team missions and ventures expand, giving you the chance to explore different problem spaces over time.
* Work with purpose: What you design and build directly empowers everyday people to take control of their finances and improve their lives.


**What We Offer**
* Business in mind & people at heart – we deliver results together and celebrate achievements.
* A varied and challenging role in a multinational and highly innovative company, where we value the development of our employees.
* A workplace where people genuinely enjoy coming to work.
* A friendly culture with openness and respect for one another, with the possibility to influence and make a difference on society and people’s everyday lives.


**Please note**
 As part of our efforts to foster an unbiased recruitment process, we kindly encourage you not to include picture, gender, ethnicity, religion, disability, sexual orientation or age in your CV.

title: Frontend Developer with focus on UX/UI
description:
At Evolution AB / Nolimit City, we're building cutting-edge gaming products that redefine how players experience online entertainment. As we continue to grow, we're looking for a Frontend Developer with a strong UX/UI focus, or a UX/UI Designer with frontend development chops, to join one of our expanding engineering teams.
 



  





 You'll play a key role in shaping the look, feel, and interactivity of products that reach a global audience—contributing not only to how things work but also how they feel. At Evolution, design and development are not siloed; you'll be an essential part of product decisions from day one, working in highly collaborative, autonomous teams.
 



  





**What You'll Do** 



* Design and build intuitive, responsive, and beautiful interfaces with React (Next.js) and TypeScript.
* Bring UX and UI designs to life—from wireframes to pixel-perfect implementation.
* Collaborate closely with product owners and engineers to craft seamless user experiences.
* Own the frontend from concept to production, including performance optimization, accessibility, and maintainability.
* Contribute to our design system and help shape a consistent visual language across products.
* Continuously experiment, iterate, and improve based on real user feedback and data.
* Be part of a team that values learning through iteration, experimentation, and shared responsibility.



  





**You Might Be a Great Fit If You** 



* Have solid experience with React, TypeScript, and modern CSS techniques.
* Possess a keen eye for design details, and care deeply about creating delightful user experiences.
* Enjoy bridging the gap between design and development.
* Are comfortable building advanced components.
* Believe in clean, maintainable code and smooth user flows.
* Have good communication skills in English and love working in a collaborative environment.



  





**Bonus Points** 



* Experience with Next.js, Redux Toolkit, or Headless CMSs like Strapi.
* Understanding of accessibility and web performance best practices.
* Familiarity with UI/UX testing tools or user research methods.
* An interest in gaming or digital entertainment interfaces.



  





**Technologies You'll Touch** 



* React / Next.js
* TypeScript / JavaScript
* Redux Toolkit
* CSS / Tailwind CSS
* Strapi (Headless CMS)
* Git (GitHub Actions)



  





**Who we are** 




 We care more about your potential than checking every box. If you're excited about building exceptional interfaces and love working in small, empowered teams, we want to hear from you.
 



  





 Join one of Sweden's fastest-growing tech companies and help us craft experiences that players around the world love.
 



  





 Nolimit City, Stockholm based development team. We provide you with your choice of OS and IDE.
 



  





 Apply on LinkedIn, or send your application to hr-sweden@nolimitcity.com
 



  





 http://www.nolimitcity.com

title: Backend Developer Intern  [Remote]
description:
**About XR Solutions** 




 XR Solutions is a technology-driven company pioneering
 **machine learning-powered augmented reality solutions** 
 for industrial clients.
 



 Our mission is to revolutionize how machines are operated, maintained, and optimized — enabling workflows and innovations that were once impossible. We combine research-based optimizations with cutting-edge AR technology to create
 **practical, reliable, and high-performance solutions** 
 that reshape industries.
 



 This internship offers a rare opportunity to
 **build backend systems that directly power advanced AR applications** 
 used in real-world industrial environments.
 



  





**Role Overview:** 




 We’re looking for a
 **passionate, detail-oriented Backend Developer Intern** 
 with a strong interest in
 **API development, system integration, and backend architecture** 
 .
 



 This is a
 **remote, hands-on role** 
 where you will work closely with experienced developers to design, implement, and maintain backend services that support our AR platforms.
 



 While this is initially
 **unpaid** 
 , exceptional performance may lead to a
 **paid position** 
 after the internship.
 



  





**What You’ll Do:** 



* **Develop APIs** 
 : Build and maintain high-performance REST APIs using
 **Node.js** 
 and
 **Express.js** 
 .
* **Database Management** 
 : Work with
 **PostgreSQL** 
 and ORM tools (Sequelize) to design and optimize database schemas.
* **System Integrations** 
 : Assist in integrating backend services with AR platforms and machine learning pipelines.
* **Testing & Quality Assurance** 
 : Write and run
 **unit and integration tests** 
 to ensure stability and performance.
* **DevOps Support** 
 : Learn to work with
 **AWS cloud infrastructure** 
 and contribute to maintaining scalable, secure environments.
* **Troubleshooting & Maintenance** 
 : Help debug, patch, and optimize backend systems to improve reliability.
* **Code Reviews** 
 : Participate in peer reviews to maintain code quality and follow industry best practices.



  





**Required Skills:** 



* Proficiency in
 **Node.js** 
 and
 **Express.js**
* Solid
 **JavaScript** 
 &
 **TypeScript** 
 skills
* Experience with
 **PostgreSQL** 
 (basic to intermediate)
* Familiarity with
 **AWS services** 
 (some training provided)
* Understanding of
 **Git** 
 (we use Bitbucket)
* Basic knowledge of
 **CI/CD pipelines**
* Awareness of
 **IT security fundamentals**
* (Bonus) Experience with
 **Sequelize ORM**



  





**What You’ll Gain:** 



* Hands-on experience building backend systems for
 **real-world AR applications**
* Exposure to
 **AWS-based scalable architectures**
* Experience with
 **industrial-grade API design, testing, and security**
* Involvement in a
 **live product launch**



  





 If you’re excited about this opportunity and eager to learn, please send your resume outlining your interest in the position. We look forward to helping you grow your skills and advance your career in backend development.

title: Software Engineer
description:
**About us** 




 Irori is a company with a startup culture on a mission to make integration easy. As the world moves towards data, AI and constant connectivity, we build systems and infrastructure that turns data into a competitive advantage. We work with trusted Swedish companies in finance, retail, transportation, medtech and government sectors where we provide specialist skills.
 



  





**What will you do** 




 As a member of Irori, you will work with application development, integration design, devops tooling and infrastructure as code. In addition to helping clients build successful digital products we invest in applied learning together. We run sandbox environments on GCP where we evaluate new technologies. Expect working with colleagues known for their technical excellence and dependable support.
 



  





 As a junior software engineer we will make a customized plan to enable your long term growth together with a designated mentor. Initially you will focus on the basics of high quality systems design and development. From there you can specialize in one or more of our core areas to become an expert. During these phases you will gain valuable experience from client work as well as our internal competence development. We believe in compounding growth for both individuals and the team, and we support a healthy work-life balance for long-term determination.
 



  





**Who you are** 



* You like exploring new technologies and learning continuously
* You enjoy a culture built on a high level of trust
* You have a work ethic and the courage to step out of your comfort occasionally



  





**Qualifications** 



* Bachelor or higher degree in Computer Science or Engineering
* 1-2+ years of experience working with systems development and/or cloud infrastructure
* You are fluent in Swedish and English



  





  





**Application** 




 We look forward to your resume and cover letter. We will review applications and book interviews with qualified candidates.

title: Senior Frontend Developer
description:
**Would you like to make a difference by using your technical skills to create innovative payment solutions?**
 TF Avarda Group is a leading provider of white-label payment and financing solutions for businesses across various industries. Focusing on simplifying the payment process and enhancing customer experience, Avarda enables 250 companies to thrive in the rapidly changing digital landscape with its advanced, true white-label offering for payments. We manage 4 million consumers annually and process millions of transactions worth over SEK 16 billion.
   

  

 At Avarda, you will have the opportunity to be part of an exciting journey as we build a state-of-the-art platform that transforms how e-commerce merchants handle payments. As a Senior Frontend Engineer, you will play a key role in designing and developing our frontend solutions.
   

  

**Why should you join us?**
 We offer more than just a technical challenge – you will become part of a team building the future of payment solutions with modern, unified technology. With us, you can grow both technically and personally, as we shape stronger work processes and develop innovative solutions for future products. We are building a modern platform that supports current and future products, and you will help create a stronger company culture and more efficient ways of working.
   

  

 Our frontend platform is based on React and Elm stack, mainly deployed in Azure.
   

  

 We have a distributed tech team with employees in Borås, Stockholm, Gdansk, Malaga, and a partner in the Czech Republic. Our payment and card services are used in 13 European markets, and travel may be required.
   

  

**Your responsibilities will include:**
* Designing and implementing scalable, maintainable frontend solutions using React and Elm.
* Collaborating with designers and backend developers to deliver seamless user experiences.
* Leading code reviews, mentoring junior developers, and contributing to the team’s growth.
* Optimizing application performance and ensuring cross-browser compatibility.
* Advocating for best practices in frontend development, including testing, accessibility, and security.
* Keeping up to date with new technologies and suggesting innovative solutions.


**We believe you have:**
* At least 5 years of experience in frontend development.
* Expertise in React and experience with Elm (or a willingness to quickly learn Elm).
* Deep understanding of JavaScript/TypeScript, HTML, and CSS.
* Good understanding of UX principles.
* Proven ability to design and develop complex web applications.
* Experience with state management tools (e.g., Redux, etc.) and frontend build tools (e.g., Webpack, Vite).
* Knowledge of testing tools (e.g., Jest, Cypress).
* Excellent problem-solving skills and a focus on clean, maintainable code.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills in a team environment.


**Preferred qualifications:**
* Knowledge of Elm.
* Experience with functional programming.
* Knowledge of backend development.
* Experience with CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices.

title: Senior Java Gameplay Engineer
description:
*Mojang Studios is best known as the creators of Minecraft, but we’re also on a mission* 
*–* 
*to build a better world through the power of play.*
*Why play? Well, play is at the heart of everything we do. It’s the blocky backbone of our games, the core of our development philosophy, and even the origin of our name. From the relentless experimentation of our endlessly inspiring community to the classrooms where Minecraft has become an essential teaching tool, play is the bedrock of our existence.*
 We enable millions to create and play together, connect people across the globe, and foster a community that is among the most active and passionate in the world. Our community is global and incredibly diverse. When we are developing anything within our franchise, we keep this in mind. We want everyone to not only feel included in Minecraft, but also to see themselves in what we make. Our goal is for the Mojang Studios team to be as diverse as our community. Minecraft is a sandbox game that should be around for a lifetime. Minecraft runs on two platforms today, the Java platform and the Bedrock platform.
   

  

**What you’ll get**
 You'll join a cross-functional team and work closely with the other engineers, designers, artists, all working together on a game enjoyed by over 100,000,000 players worldwide. We have big dreams for the future of Minecraft and need you to help make them happen.
   

  

 By joining the gameplay team, you will find an environment that enables you to leverage your knowledge and values to maintain and evolve a healthy and collaborative culture as we grow.
   

  

  

  

**As a Senior Game Engineer in the Minecraft team you will:**
* Drive technical solutions discussions, implement, test and iterate on new as well as existing Gameplay systems and features for upcoming Minecraft updates.
* Be involved in design discussions related to the core Minecraft experience and helping to define the direction of future updates
* With the team, own the quality and help to refine the quality process
* Be a part of a highly collaborative cross-functional team consisting of Java and C++ engineers, game designers, QA and artists.
* Support the team by ensuring sustainable development processes and workflows
* Lead by example and mentor other engineers, fostering a collaborative and high-performing team environment
* Provide technical leadership during code reviews across teams, understand the root cause of the issues, and find ways to resolve them


**We believe you are someone that has:**
* Excellent teamwork skills and an eagerness to reach goals in a collaborative manner
* Solid experience with Java programming or Java game development
* Experience in modern C++
* Experience and a strong drive in helping to design gameplay and its underlying systems and implementing quality-focused technical solutions to make those systems work
* Solid knowledge of engineering practices
* The ability to work with large cross-platform codebases and legacy code
* Passion for learning and sharing knowledge with your team and the organisation
* Strong communication and leadership skills
* You are knowledgeable and passionate about games


 For this role, we will consider fit for the team and company holistically. Meaning that we'll put a great emphasis on your interpersonal skills.
   

  

**About this role:**
 This is a full-time role based in Stockholm with a hybrid remote working model. You'll collaborate with our studio colleagues in Redmond, USA, and across various disciplines. This position sometimes has off hour meetings mainly with West coast USA representatives. Please note that we are only able to consider applications from candidates currently residing within Sweden.
   

  

**Mojang Studios**
*Mojang Studios is a Microsoft-owned game developer. The company was founded in Stockholm, Sweden and has offices around the world, including Stockholm, Redmond, Tokyo, London, and Shanghai. We’re always working on new and exciting ways to expand the Minecraft universe.*
*Our community is global and incredibly diverse. We keep this in mind when developing anything, as we want people to feel included in Minecraft. And in recruiting, our goal is to make Mojang Studios as diverse as our community.*
*We got started as a tiny indie developer, and part of our culture still reflects that heritage. But we’re also proud to belong to Xbox Game Studios, which creates unique opportunities to grow and develop.*
*To help us achieve amazing things, we have built an equally amazing studio space. Situated right on the water by Söder Mälarstrand, it’s filled to the brim with all the tools, toys and caffeine required to create world-class entertainment.*
*But in the end, it’s the people of Mojang Studios that make this place truly special. When you join, you’ll find yourself in the company of incredibly bright, warm, and creative individuals – all united and working toward a single goal. Come help us reach it!*
***Important note on resumes**
 Please make sure that
 **all** 
 the information in your resume is accurate because we will conduct a thorough background check. Any discrepancies will lower your chances of getting to the next interview stage and we’d hate to miss out on an awesome candidate! Double check that any gap years are reflected in your history, and that your education and work experience are completely accurate. Good luck!*

title: Back End Developer
description:
*Do you want to play a key role in building the digital backbone of the Nordics? At GlobalConnect, we are looking for a Backend Developer to join our Content Delivery Network team in Stockholm. You will be part of a dedicated group that delivers video and content distribution services to millions of people across Denmark, Norway, Finland, and Sweden.* 




  





**About The Role** 




 As a Backend Developer in our Video Streaming & Content Delivery team, you will design, develop, and implement solutions that support large-scale video and radio distribution. You will work in an agile team with experienced colleagues, close to stakeholders across development, operations, and customer support. The role combines technical depth with real customer impact, ensuring reliability, scalability, and efficiency in systems that matter.
 



  





 While our focus is on Content Delivery Network and video streaming technologies, you do not need previous experience in this field. If you bring solid backend development skills and curiosity, we will help you grow into the domain.
 



  





**Why this matters?** 




 GlobalConnect is the digital backbone of society in the Nordics and northern Germany. Our CDN & Origin services enable leading broadcasters, media houses, and partners to distribute content on a scale. By joining us, you will help safeguard connectivity and deliver streaming experiences that millions of people rely on every day.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 



* Develop and maintain backend systems for video and radio encoding, packaging, and distribution
* Contribute to the design and scaling of GlobalConnect’s CDN and origin services
* Collaborate closely with other development teams, network and datacenter colleagues, and support functions
* Troubleshoot, optimize, and maintain services in production
* Work in an agile setup with freedom under responsibility



  





**What You Need To Succeed** 



* Minimum 3 years of experience as a backend developer (Java preferred)
* Knowledge of distributed systems and network protocols (TCP/IP, HTTP)
* Skills in at least one systems-oriented programming language (C, C++)
* Solid knowledge of GNU/Linux, including configuration and troubleshooting



  





**Good to have** 



* Experience with big data (Hadoop ecosystem or similar), SQL/NoSQL databases, streaming protocols (HLS, DASH, SRT/MPEG-TS, RTMP), CI/CD, load testing, Elasticsearch, RabbitMQ, or automation tools such as Ansible, Puppet, or Chef.
* Swedish language skills are a plus.



  





**The team and why GlobalConnect** 




 You will join a team of 16 specialists, including five developers, who have worked together for many years. The team values collaboration, autonomy, and close customer relationships. We are proud to serve more than 120 customers, including some of the most recognized media companies in the Nordics. At Globalconnect, you will experience a culture of trust, learning, and proactivity.
 



  





**Process** 




 We review applications continuously. A CV is enough; a cover letter is not required unless you want to highlight something not covered in your CV or LinkedIn.
 



  





**Join us** 




 If you want to help shape the digital backbone of the Nordics and work with systems that truly matter, we look forward to your application.
 



  





**About Us** 




 GlobalConnect is one of the leading connectivity providers in Northern Europe. We’re 2000 passionate and talented individuals who want to make a difference, turning our customers’ visions into reality through connectivity. Our goal is to create the best possible conditions for engaged employees, a place where you can develop and grow, and create unforgettable memories and enjoyable experiences.
 



  





 We have helped develop and digitize societies across the Nordics for more than two decades. Our purpose is what drives us to continue - turning visions into reality by empowering society with connectivity.

title: Senior .Net Fullstack Developer
description:
At NOBA, we’re all about collaboration, curiosity, and tackling tech challenges together. As part of our skilled dev team, you’ll dive into both backend and frontend work, solving problems with people who genuinely enjoy building great things.
   

  

 We’re forming a brand-new development team in Stockholm and are looking for two
 **Senior .Net Fullstack Developers** 
 to join us. We aim to bring together people with varied backgrounds and experiences, united by a passion for solving tech challenges and building great digital solutions!
   

  

**About The Role**
 You’ll have the chance to work across the full stack, developing new web services, improving system usability, and maintaining existing solutions. You will be trusted in designing, building and implementing modern web services for internal and external users.
   

  

 We’re big on continuous learning and knowledge-sharing - plus, we believe in a healthy work-life balance, giving you time to recharge and pursue your passions outside of work. Join a team of friendly and highly skilled developers, based in the central of Stockholm.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Develop web applications with a focus on great user experiences
* Build internal tools that make life easier for your colleagues
* Lead the full lifecycle of projects, from concept to delivery
* Integrate third-party solutions
* Collaborate closely with fellow developers in an Agile environment.


**We Are Looking For You Who**
 Are a problem solver who’s not afraid to push beyond the comfort zone and try new things. Strong communication and teamwork are essential, and we’re after someone who isn’t shy about sharing their ideas. You’ll need:
   

  

* 5+ years of software development experience
* 3+ years in web development with C#/.Net/.NetCore
* 3+ years working with React or similar JavaScript frameworks
