title: Influencer Manager
description:
**Metapic**
 Att jobba hos
 **Metapic** 
 är stimulerande, utvecklande och roligt. Du kommer vara en del av en startup inom en större organisation. På Metapic har du möjligheten att påverka och du kommer lära dig bygga framtiden av digital marknadsföring tillsammans med influencers.
   

  

 Tillsammans med Tradedoubler är vi ett internationellt företag med kontor i nio europeiska länder och med planer att expandera till andra marknader under kommande år. Våra anställda kommer från hela världen, vilket skapar en kulturell mångfald där kreativitet, kommunikation och idéer är högt värdesatt.
   

  

 Vad väntar du på? Ansök nu!
   

  

**Role Overview**
 Du är en driven person som har lika lätt för att bygga nya relationer såsom att stärka befintliga. Vi ser gärna att du är en social person som vill vara med och driva Metapic framåt.
   

  

 Du ska kunna vara flexibel och jobba proaktivt i vår fartfyllda och roliga miljö.
   

  

 Att vara analytisk och datadriven är viktigt för att kunna leverera strategiska resultat.
   

  

 Du ska ha en passion för influencer marketing och sociala medier med ett kreativt öga samtidigt som du kan prioritera och hantera flera projekt på samma gång!
   

  

**Main Responsibilities**
* Rekrytera, bygga och bibehålla goda relationer med influencers.
* Administrativt arbete i våra interna verktyg och program.
* Sätta upp kampanjer och produktseeding till våra influencers.
* Hantera budgetar och strategiskt allokera dessa.
* Ha daglig kontakt och kommunikation med influencers och hjälpa dem med deras olika ärenden, i olika kanaler.
* Utveckla och driva innovativa idéer för kampanjer och projekt.
* Dagligen följa upp, analysera och optimera trafik och siffror.
* Projektleda events och workshops för influencers.
* Bidra till Metapics positiva och drivande kultur.


**Your profile**
* Du har ett genuint intresse för och erfarenhet av sociala medier/influencers/digital marknadsföring.
* Du förstår styrkan av influencer marketing och konsumerar sociala kanaler (såsom Instagram och TikTok) och följer dess trender.
* Högskoleutbildning inom Digital Marknadsföring är ett plus.
* Du har +3 års relevant arbetslivserfarenhet
* Du är kreativ och har ett öga för detaljer.
* Arbetar proaktivt och är flexibel för förändringar och nya processer.
* Självgående team player.
* Service-minded och strukturerad.
* Resultatdriven och analytisk.
* Vill ha roligt på jobbet!


**Why us?**
* Möjligheten att jobba i en startup-miljö inom en större organisation.
* Konkurrenskraftig lön, premiumsjukvårdsförsäkring, pensionssparande och friskvårdsbidrag.
* 6 veckor betald semester varje år.
* MacBook
* Möjlighet till resor.


**About Us**
 Tradedoubler is a global partner marketing network that has been facilitating connections between result-driven brands and publishers worldwide for more than 25 years. We operate in 90+ markets across the globe and house over 2,000 brands and 180,000 publishers in our network. Our awesome teams are located across our 15 offices in Europe and Australia.
   

  

 In addition to Tradedoubler's core Partner Marketing business, we offer digital marketing solutions across the entire customer journey, including App marketing (Appiness), influencer marketing (Metapic), lead generation campaigns (Leadslab), & SaaS solutions (Grow by Tradedoubler).
   

  

 Tradedoubler was founded in 1999 in Stockholm, Sweden by Martin Lorentzon & Felix Hägnö, and has been listed on the Stockholm Stock Exchange since 2005.
   

  

 One of our strong beliefs at Tradedoubler is that our success stems from adhering to our core values: Make it Happen, Stay Curious, & Achieve Together.

title: Sales Specialist, ChromeOS (Nordic, English)
description:
Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following:
 **Stockholm, Sweden; Copenhagen, Denmark; Helsinki, Finland; Oslo, Norway** 
 .
 **Minimum qualifications:**
* Bachelor's degree in Business, or related field, or equivalent practical experience.
* 4 years of experience working in a company that develops enterprise computing solutions, or in a similar role.
* Ability to communicate in English to support client relationship management in this region.


**Preferred qualifications:**
* Experience working with End User Computing vendors.
* Experience working with partners on sales and demand generation.
* Experience selling software and hardware to large enterprises.
* Experience in a technical field, such as IT infrastructure (e.g., End User Computing, Enterprise OS, Browser solutions), application delivery (e.g., virtualization, web application, delivery, applications), enterprise architecture, project management, SAS and Cloud Computing.
* Ability to quickly learn, understand, and work with new emerging technologies, methodologies, and solutions in the Cloud/IT technology space.
* Ability to communicate in one of Nordic languages (Swedish, Norwegian, Danish, Finnish) fluently, to support client relationship management in this region.


**About The Job**
 As a ChromeOS Enterprise Sales Specialist for the Nordics (Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Finland), you will join a small team working with leading companies and government agencies to ease their transition to the cloud, with the world's most advanced OS. You will work closely with regional customers, partners and computer manufacturers to show how our solution can make businesses more productive, innovative and collaborative. Your relationships with customers will be crucial in helping Google grow its Enterprise business and bringing our product portfolio into companies both big and small.
   

  

 Alongside ChromeOS, you will sell new products in our portfolio such as Cameyo and Chrome Enterprise Premium which together constitute Google's end user computing offering to enterprises.
   

  

 We are looking for a Solution Sales Specialist who will drive customer engagement in a proactive manner.
   

  

 Chrome OS delivers quality computing at scale to provide universal and unfettered access to information, entertainment, and tools. Our mission is to empower anyone to create and access information freely through fast, secure, simple, and intelligent computing.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Introduce ChromeOS and the Chrome Browser to enterprises. Help prospective customers to understand the power of ChromeOS, explain its benefits, features, and problem-solve key client issues.
* Identify and qualify business opportunities, identify key customer objections and develop the strategy to close business transactions. Liaise with the Product Management, Marketing, and Engineering teams to stay on top of industry trend.
* Take responsibility for all business aspects such as preparing and delivering product and solution messaging, support bid responses, product and solution briefings, presenting, attending events in the region, proof-of-concept and pilot management.
* Work with the Chrome team and your dedicated technical engineer to demonstrate and prototype integrations in customer/partner environments.
* Travel to customer sites, key events and conferences as needed.


 Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

title: Acne Studios Office Support Coordinator
description:
Acne Studios is a progressive luxury house and through collaboration and curiosity, we set high aspirations and strive for excellence. We value everyone's contribution and embrace feedback to develop ourselves and others. We aim to minimise our environmental impact across all our operations and to address societal challenges in the way we conduct our business.
   

  

 As Office Support Coordinator at our Stockholm Head Office, you will deliver exceptional service across various areas to both colleagues and external visitors, ensuring a professional and welcoming experience at all times. With a curious, service-minded and inclusive approach, you will handle a wide variety of requests and tasks related to the front desk and office area. As our new Office Support Coordinator you will be the heart of the office & a valued member of our fantastic Office Support team of five - the team behind the scenes making sure everything runs smoothly every day.
   

  

 This is a temporary position starting no later than January 1, 2026, and running through to August, 2026 - with the possibility of extension.
   

  

 CULTURE OF COLLABORATION
   

  

 We firmly believe that when you feel supported, included, and trusted, it enables you to enjoy your work and thrive in it. You will be a part of a team of colleagues with diverse roles and backgrounds, each with their unique skills and experiences.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
 As Office Support Coordinator your main contribution will be to represent the brand and welcoming external guests to our Head Office, as well handle and coordinate all incoming requests and guide our colleagues accordingly. You will play a vital role in ensuring a professional, inclusive and service-focused experience in every interaction by:
   

  

* Welcome and take care of external visitors and guide them appropriately
* Provide right service and support colleagues with Office related requests
* Answering and directing all incoming calls professionally
* Issuing key tags for the alarm system
* Make sure front desk and lobby area meets expectations
* Manage conference room bookings efficiently


**Who You Are**
 You have high aspirations and focus on details that create substantial impact. You enjoy working as a team and you embrace feedback to develop yourself and others. You are curious and thrive in a dynamic environment. Cooperation, respect, and clear communication are important, along with your ambition to learn and grow. If these qualities speak to you, we would love to have you on our Office Support team.
   

  

**Specific Personal Qualities For This Role**
* Service-minded
* Curious & inclusive approach
* A team player that highly values team collaboration
* Organized & structured
* Interest in fashion, art & creativity


**Specific Experience And Knowledge For This Role**
* A few years in the service-field
* Experience in reception or similar role is meriting
* Experience working in a creative, agency or design-driven environment is a plus
* Strong Microsoft skills (Outlook, Word, Teams)
* Fluent in English, both verbally and in writing


 What matters most to us is not whether you master all the listed knowledge and skills. We are dedicated to recognising the potential in each individual. We embrace diversity of people as well as ideas and viewpoints and encourage everyone's individual expression of their own identity.
   

  

 We are reviewing applications on a rolling basis, so seize the opportunity to join us by submitting your application today!

title: Spontanansökan – IT-infrastrukturkonsult till Nexer Infrastructure
description:
Detta gäller inte ett specifikt uppdrag, utan framtida möjligheter vid rätt matchning.
   

  

 Är du nyfiken på nästa steg inom IT-infrastruktur?
   

  

 Vi på Nexer Infrastructure söker löpande kontakt med skickliga och engagerade personer inom IT-infrastruktur – även om vi just nu inte har ett aktivt uppdrag att tillsätta. Vi vet ännu inte exakt vilka uppdrag som kommer in i höst – men genom att skicka in en spontanansökan finns du med i våra tankar när vi söker rätt kompetens för framtida uppdrag. Så kikar du runt efter nya utmaningar och är intresserad av Nexer - skicka gärna in din ansökan!
   

  

 Vi är särskilt intresserade av dig som har erfarenhet inom något/några av områdena nedan:
   

  

* Drift, övervakning och förvaltning av IT-miljöer
* Nätverk, brandväggar och säkerhetslösningar
* Linux (Automatisering i Ansible eller Bash)
* Microsoftmiljöer (AD, Exchange, M365, Windows Server)
* Virtualisering (VMware, Hyper-V)
* Molntjänster (Azure, AWS, Google Cloud)
* ITIL och arbete med ärendehanteringssystem


 Vem är du?
   

  

 Du har flera års erfarenhet inom IT-infrastruktur och är van att arbeta både självständigt och i team. Du har ett konsultmässigt förhållningssätt, kommunicerar tydligt och gillar problemlösning.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du har:
   

  

* Förmåga att snabbt sätta dig in i nya miljöer
* God problemlösningsförmåga och vana att arbeta proaktivt
* Obehindrade kunskaper i svenska, både i tal och skrift


 Vad kan vi erbjuda?
   

  

 Hos oss blir du en del av ett bolag med passion, framtidstro och teknik i fokus. När rätt uppdrag dyker upp matchar vi dig med det – och stöttar dig hela vägen, både inför och under uppdraget.
   

  

 Du får ett starkt nätverk av kollegor, en engagerad konsultchef och chansen att göra skillnad ute hos våra kunder.
   

  

 Låter det intressant?
   

  

 Skicka in ditt CV och några rader om din kompetens, tillgänglighet och vilken typ av uppdrag du är intresserad av. Vi återkommer efter semestrarna om vi får in ett uppdrag som matchar din profil.

title: Allocation Manager
description:
Tata consultancy Services is an IT services, consulting and business solutions organization that has been partnering with many of the world’s largest businesses for the past 50 years. We believe innovation and collective knowledge can transform all our futures with greater purpose. We help companies across industries achieve their strategic goals and lead their digital transformation programs. With 600,000 experts globally and 18,000+ consultants working for leading Nordic Customers, we have a strong sense of purpose for the ecosystem around us – our employees, partners, customers and society.
 



  





 We are happy to invite applications for exciting internship opportunities at TCS. The internship allows you to gain unique and real-life perspectives in solving challenges for TCS and its Customers.
 



  





**Must-Have:** 



* Business Process Lead with Strong process knowledge and experience in planning & conducting process workshops and do FIT/GAP analysis in allocation management & Replenishment process for Fashion
* Minimum of 12+ years of experience in SAP Retail – Allocation & Replenishment processes (SAP UDF, SAP Allocation management – Push and Pull)
* SAP AMR implementation experience is must
* SAP UDF process knowledge and replenishment process knowledge is required
* Hand-On with Process modelling tools Signavio preferred, other process modelling tools
* Experience on
* Represent in Process Board & Solution Design authority board on critical Process GAPs / Architecture solution review and decision documentation.
* Ensure Fit to Standard and govern clean core principles with technical architects
* Business process design documentation and coordinate with Process owners for review & ensure Sign-off
* Strong Knowledge on SAP allocation management suite on CAR / Cloud with allocation strategy setup and configuration, In-season replenishment, Integrated Promotions push and buy process
* Knowledge on integrated processes with SAP UDF Forecasting tools or other forecast tools
* Global retailer with multiple markets and multiple channels, segmentation concept understating in S4 preferred
* Work with Business and Change management lead to draw out Change Impacts list
* Understanding of LTMC and Data Migration capabilities to coordinate with data management team
* Understanding of role-based process design and Fiori role design coordination with Roles & Authorization team is required
* Hands on experience on Configuration in system is an advantage
* Functional design ownership on solution fitment meets process design and business requirement
* Good communication skills, problem solving mindset and cross functional coordination skills required



  





**Good-to-have:** 



* Strong implementation Experience in SAP S/4 SCM
* Knowledge in Retail business



  





**Responsibility-of-Role:** 



* Should be able to analyze the critical issue and resolve in time
* Willingness to accept development challenges and work towards resolving them
* Should be a good team player and should be able to lead the team
* Should be willing to work in shifts
* Should be focused in on-time delivery



  





**Does that sound interesting?** 




  





 You are welcome to submit your application consisting of your CV, personal letter, relevant degrees or certifications details, professional references, etc. We work with ongoing recruitment so send in your application as soon as possible.
 



  





 We look forward to receiving your application via LinkedIn or mail to
 **pallavi.malhotra@tcs.com**

title: Förvaltningsledare för nytt avvikelsehanteringssystem
description:
Vill du vara med och utveckla verksamheter inom Region Stockholm och Region Gotland? Vi bygger nu ett team som ska leda arbetet med vårt nya regiongemensamma systemstöd för avvikelsehantering och förbättringsarbete inom hälso- och sjukvården.
   

  

 Ansök idag och bli en del av vårt engagerade team!
   

  

**Du erbjuds**
* ett viktigt uppdrag i en verksamhet med höga kvalitetskrav och samhällsnytta
* att vara en nyckelperson i utvecklingen och förvaltningen av ett strategiskt viktigt system för Region Stockholm och Region Gotland
* möjligheten att påverka och förbättra processer som skapar tryggare och mer effektiva verksamheter
* ett arbete i en dynamisk och utvecklingsinriktad organisation med starkt regionalt samarbete.


 Självklart får du också ta del av våra generella förmåner som Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset erbjuder dig.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset har uppdrag att förvalta och utveckla Region Stockholms och Region Gotlands nya gemensamma systemstöd för avvikelser (exempelvis avvikelser inom vård, arbetsmiljö, miljö, laboratorieverksamhet och omvårdnad). Systemstödet hanterar även patienters/medborgares synpunkter och förbättringsförslag.
   

  

 Just nu pågår arbete med införande och att etablera en förvaltningsorganisation. Som förvaltningsledare blir du en nyckelperson i detta arbete, där du ansvarar för att bygga upp och leda en mindre central förvaltning samt samordna samarbetet med lokala systemförvaltare, processägare och andra intressenter.
   

  

 I rollen är ditt huvudfokus att leda förvaltningsarbetet och skapa tydligt värde för verksamheten. Du säkerställer att systemstödet effektivt stödjer verksamhetens processer, uppfyller användarnas behov och fungerar stabilt och säkert.
   

  

**I Rollen Kommer Du Bland Annat**
* agera brygga mellan verksamhet och teknik. Du samlar in behov och omsätter dem till konkreta planer
* prioritera större utvecklingsbehov baserat på värde, kvalité, tid, resurser, övergripande mål och verksamhetensbehov i samråd med förvaltning, referensgrupper, systemägare och verksamhet
* samordna styrning och kommunicerar med nyttjande verksamheter och andra intressenter
* leda arbetet inom den centrala förvaltningen, inklusive avtalshantering, arbetsfördelning, budgetkontroll
* säkerställa att leveranser sker enligt plan och med hög kvalitet
* identifiera potentiella risker och proaktivt undanröja hinder för att säkerställa en smidig verksamhet.


**Vi söker dig som**
* har en god kommunikationsförmåga och kan arbeta självständigt såväl som i team
* har ett starkt driv genom att du ser vad som behöver göras och driver det framåt, även i en föränderlig miljö
* är noggrann och tar stort ansvar för hög kvalitet på teamets leverans
* är strukturerad och trivs i samarbete med både teknik- och verksamhetsrepresentanter.


 Vi lägger stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet för tjänsten.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
**Krav**
* Akademisk examen inom relevant område eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet
* Minst 3-5 års erfarenhet av förvaltningsledning eller motsvarande
* Erfarenhet av förvaltningsarbete enligt ITIL eller liknande ramverk
* God förmåga att utrycka dig i tal och skrift på svenska


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av IT-stöd inom avvikelsehantering eller ärendehantering
* God förståelse för relevanta standarder och regelverk som exempelvis Patientsäkerhetslagen, Patientdatalagen, GDPR, Arbetsmiljölagen och AFS
* Erfarenhet av arbete med IT-miljö inom offentlig verksamhet, särskilt meriterande med erfarenhet från inom hälso- och sjukvård eller Region Stockholm.


**Om rekryteringsprocessen**
 Urval och intervjuer kan komma att ske löpande under ansökningstiden.
   

  

 I samband med din ansökan behöver du bifoga CV. Istället för ett personligt brev ber vi dig besvara urvalsfrågor samt kort motivera varför du passar för rollen. Att besvara frågorna är en förutsättning för att din ansökan ska anses komplett.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan - Tillsammans är vi Karolinska!
   

  

 Inför tillsättning av befattning som innefattar vård av barn och ungdom, kontrolleras den som erbjuds tjänsten mot misstanke- och belastningsregistret. Här kan du läsa mer om rekryteringsprocessen och om vilka kontroller som utförs på Karolinska.
   

  

 Som anställd på Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset kan du komma att krigsplaceras. Läs mer om vad det innebär här.
   

  

 Om du är eller tidigare har varit anställd i Region Stockholm kommer vi att ta interna referenser från din nuvarande eller tidigare chef, om du blir aktuell för anställning.
   

  

 För tillsvidaretjänster kan provanställning komma att tillämpas.
   

  

**Om Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset**
 Vi på Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset är stolta över att vi är ett av världens främsta universitetssjukhus. Förutom vårt särskilda ansvar för den högspecialiserade vården i Stockholmsregionen är huvuduppdraget att tillsammans med Karolinska Institutet utbilda framtidens vårdanställda och bedriva världsledande forskning samtidigt som vi fortsätter vårt arbete med att utveckla vården för patientens bästa. Vi arbetar inom en rad olika områden och professioner.
   

  

 Vår vision - Vi ska bota och lindra imorgon det ingen kan bota och lindra idag.
   

  

 Läs gärna mer om oss på karolinska.se och följ oss på sociala medier!
   

  

**Att söka jobb i Region Stockholm**
 Vi eftersträvar jämställdhet och jämlikhet på vår arbetsplats och ser gärna sökande med olika bakgrund och förutsättningar.
   

  

 Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via detta system. Ansök genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök”. Ansökningar per brev eller e-post beaktas inte. Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser.
   

  

 Vårt rekryteringssystem kan inte hantera anonyma ansökningar eller sökande med skyddade personuppgifter. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ber vi dig att kontakta den kontaktpersonen som finns angiven i annonsen. Din ansökan kommer då att hanteras utanför rekryteringssystemet. Du bör även vara försiktig med vilken information du lämnar i din ansökan och endast ta med information som är relevant för den aktuella befattningen.
   

  

 Region Stockholm ansvarar för hälso- och sjukvård, kollektivtrafik, regional utveckling och bidrar till kulturlivet. Varje dag, dygnet runt. I landets snabbaste växande region. Tillsammans skapar vi Europas attraktivaste storstadsregion.
   

  

 Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss i Region Stockholm
   

  

 Fackliga representanter
   

  

 Namn
   

  

 SACO
   

  

 Telefon
   

  

 saco.karolinska.karolinska@regionstockholm.se
   

  

 Namn
   

  

 Vision
   

  

 Telefon
   

  

 vision.karolinska@regionstockholm.se
   

  

 Namn
   

  

 Vårdförbundet
   

  

 Telefon
   

  

 johan.flodin@regionstockholm.se

title: Head of TR and People Analytics
description:
**Join our Team**
**About This Opportunity**
 We are recruiting a Head of Total Rewards and People Analytics for Group Function Global Operations (GFGO). This pivotal leadership role sits at the intersection of reward strategy and people analytics – shaping how we attract, retain, and grow talent while ensuring decisions are grounded in data-driven insights. You will set the vision and lead the design of innovative, business-aligned reward frameworks and analytics capabilities that strengthen both the employee experience and business performance.
   

  

 The role can be based in any global location, but preference will be given to candidates located in EMEA or India due to time zone alignment.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Partner with executive business leaders and People partners to align Total Rewards, People Analytics, and Workforce Planning with organizational priorities, ensuring solutions are impactful, future-focused, and scalable.
* Design and evolve reward frameworks that are competitive, fair, and engaging, strengthening our ability to attract, retain, and motivate talent while enhancing the employee experience.
* Lead the People Analytics agenda, using tools such as Power BI and SuccessFactors to provide proactive insights and guidance that shape fact-based decision-making at all levels.
* Drive Workforce Planning by analyzing data, anticipating talent needs, identifying risks, and turning insights into clear recommendations for leadership.
* Embed governance, compliance, and risk management across all reward and analytics practices, ensuring alignment with global standards and data privacy requirements.
* Manage budgets and resources for compensation and analytics functions, balancing efficiency with high-quality, impactful outcomes.
* Foster collaboration across functions and geographies, building a culture where rewards, analytics, and workforce planning reinforce business performance and employee engagement.


**What You Will Bring**
* 15+ years of progressive HR experience, with demonstrated expertise in both Total Rewards and People Analytics (candidates must have demonstratable experience in both areas to be considered).
* Proven success in shaping and delivering compensation and benefits frameworks within complex, global organizations.
* Experience leveraging analytics tools (e.g., Power BI, SuccessFactors) to provide insights that drive fact-based decisions.
* Strong business acumen with the ability to connect people strategies to organizational priorities.
* Demonstrated capability to influence senior stakeholders, lead large-scale initiatives, and manage budgets effectively.
* Solid understanding of compliance, governance, and risk management in the HR domain.
* Inclusive, collaborative leadership style with excellent communication skills and the ability to operate across cultures and geographies.


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 India (IN) || Gurgaon
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 774557

title: Account Executive
description:
**Join Our Scaleup Journey & Fuel Your Curiosity!**
 At Lime Go, a thriving scaleup under Lime Technologies Sweden AB (publ), you’ll be part of a fast-moving, entrepreneurial team with the backing of a successful, publicly listed company. It's the best of both worlds – the agility of a startup and the stability of an industry leader with a proven track record of success.
   

  

**Who We’re Looking For**
* A curiosity-driven, growth-oriented mindset ready to scale with us
* Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills
* Sharp problem-solving abilities


**Your Role in Our Team**
* Own the entire sales process, from prospecting to closing and handover
* Target ideal customers across industries and regions
* Get creative with omnichannel outreach and inbound leads to build your pipeline
* Tailor our Data-driven Sales CRM to fit each customer’s needs – demo both online and in-person
* Negotiate to win larger deals faster, smashing your sales goals in the process


**The Product**
 Lime Go is a Data-Enriched Sales CRM built for SMBs in the Nordics. You’ll be selling to sales teams who understand the value of what we offer. With over 1,000 customers in Sweden, Norway, and Denmark, our aim is to become the top choice for ambitious companies across Europe.
   

  

 We’ve just completed a full product revamp, making Lime Go a fresh, modern, and powerful tool for your customers.
   

  

**The Lime Go Team**
 We’re a close-knit, ambitious team of 24 with bold growth goals for the coming years. We’re looking for a cornerstone player like you to help make it happen.
   

  

**Requirements**
**Skills & Requirements** 
**Requirements**
* B2B sales experience, preferably 2+ years of selling complex products/services (bonus if SaaS!)
* Bachelor’s degree
* Driver's license
* Willing to work from our office in Stockholm
* Fluent in Swedish and English
* A proven track record of sales excellence


 You’ll report to Jonas (Sales Manager) and have weekly 1-on-1s, plus collaborate with our 11-member Revenue Operations team (Sales, CS, Product - all in Stockholm!).
   

  

**Perks & Benefits**
* Competitive base salary with performance-based commissions (with kicker levels!)
* 6 weeks of vacation, company conferences and parties, wellness allowance, pension, and more
* A fun, collaborative environment with regular team activities and laughs


**The Application Process**
* Screening call with the team
* Interview
* Case assignment to pitch our product
* In-depth interview(s) with team members
* Reference check
* Agreement walkthrough
* Final interview with Lime Group’s CEO (Nils)


 Don’t wait – apply now and start your journey with us. Europe is ready for Lime Go. Are you?
   

  

 Let’s Go! 🚀

title: Management Consultant - Graduate/Young Professional to frog Sweden (Stockholm & Gothenburg)
description:
**frog** 
 is seeking
 **creative and driven graduates and young professionals** 
 to join our community in
 **Stockholm & Gothenburg.** 
 We're looking for talents who truly care about their work and the people they work with.
 



  





  





**YOUR ROLE** 




 As a consultant at frog, a part of Capgemini Invent, you’ll work in multidisciplinary teams to solve real business challenges for leading organizations. You’ll help develop strategies, design new business models, and implement solutions that deliver measurable impact and long-term growth. Working at the intersection for creativity, strategy and technology, you’ll bring bold ideas to life – from concept to execution. At frog, you’ll be a part of a collaborative and vibrant community where design, data and business insight come together to reimagine customer experiences and drive lasting transformation.
 



  





  





**YOUR PROFILE** 



* **Educational background:** 
 You hold a master’s degree with strong academic results.
* **Recent graduate:** 
 You are graduating in 2026 or have recently graduated, with 0–1 year of relevant work experience since completing your degree.
* **Skills and mindset:** 
 You’re curious, analytical, and thrive in fast-paced environments. You enjoy solving complex challenges and are eager to learn and grow - both independently and as part of a team.
* **Language skills:** 
 You have excellent communication skills in both Swedish and English.
* **Additional merits:** 
 International and professional experiences, as well as involvement in extracurricular activities, are considered valuable assets.



  





**As a frog, you should also have:** 



* Strong presentation, storytelling and social skills
* Affinity with frog’s values Human, Curious, Brave, Collaborative, Genuine and Spirited, and a passion for creating products, services and experiences that meet people's functional and emotional needs
* Eagerness to learn and grow



  





  





**WHAT YOU’LL LOVE ABOUT WORKING HERE?** 



* **Diverse environment:** 
 Collaborative with market-leading clients and experienced consultants in Sweden, Denmark, Finland & globally.
* **Career development:** 
 Experience a well-defined career path with support to develop into a successful consultant, including training and mentoring programs.
* **Collaborative culture:** 
 Benefit from our supportive teams, knowledge sharing and comprehensive end-to-end capabilities.
* **Engaging workplace:** 
 Embrace a culture where employees shape their own future and enjoy a welcoming, social workplace with many exciting events and activities.



  





  





**Why frog?** 




 The frog ‘pond’ is a global network of studios, each with a thriving in-person and vibrant virtual culture. With a strong foundation in frog’s iconic heritage, we draw on our global reach and local knowledge to solve complex problems and create innovative, sustainable solutions that touch hearts and move markets. We fluently combine strategy, design, brand activation, and customer transformation as well as analytics, operational processes and beyond.
 



 frogs are curious, collaborative and courageous, united by our passion for improving human experience. We are home to rebels, visionaries, and dreamers that disrupt the status quo. Our culture is open, flexible, inclusive, and engaging, and frogs prize humor, positivity, and community just as highly as performance and outcomes. We value diversity, transparency and sustainability and our aim is to become a net-zero company by 2030 – while today, we already strive to shape a regenerative, sustainable and inclusive future for businesses, people, and the planet alike.
 



  





  





  





**NEED TO KNOW** 





 Start date and location
 




 As a recent graduate, you’ll join our Stockholm or Gothenburg office in Fall 2026, with readiness to travel and work on projects at our client sites.
 



  






 Application process
 




 Applications are reviewed continuously—apply early to secure your spot. Submit your
 **CV in English** 
 and your official
 **high school** 
 &
 **university transcripts** 
 (uploaded under “
 
 Cover Letter
 
 ” when you apply through the system). There is only one field available for uploading your grades. Therefore, we kindly ask you to
 **merge your high school, bachelor's, and master's transcripts** 
 into a single document before uploading. Clearly state your expected graduation date and preferred office location(s). Incomplete applications will not be considered.
 



  





 Please note: Candidates must present a valid ID during the first interview for verification.
 



  






 Next steps
 




 Our selection process includes several steps to ensure a fair and thorough evaluation:
 



 - CV & grade screening
 



 - Phone interview
 



 - Video interview (including a case)
 



 - On-site case
 



 - Final interview
 



 - Offer
 



  





  





**ABOUT CAPGEMINI INVENT** 




 Capgemini (traded as CAP on the Euronext Paris) is a leading strategic partner to companies around the world. We have leveraged technology to enable business transformation since our inception in Paris, more than 50 years ago. As the advisory and digital strategy, transformation, innovation, and creative brand of the Capgemini Group, Capgemini Invent enables CxOs to envision and shape the future of their businesses. Located in nearly 40 studios and more than 60 offices around the world, it comprises a 12,000+ strong team of strategists, data scientists, product and experience designers, brand experts and technologists who develop new digital services, products, experiences and business models for sustainable growth.
 



  





*#LI-DNI*

title: Senior Testare – Testautomatisering
description:
Uppdraget avser projektet Omställningsstudiestöd där du ingår i ett eller flera utvecklingsteam. Fokus ligger på testautomatisering i backend, men även traditionella funktionella tester och GUI-testning ingår. Du agerar kravställare för automatiserade tester, planerar och genomför tester, skapar testfall, hanterar testmiljöer och testdata, samt underhåller testdokumentation. Arbetet sker i verktyget Xray och inkluderar integrationstester mot tredje part.
   

  

 Du ska även vara mentor och stöd inom testområdet, särskilt testautomatisering, och bidra till kompetensöverföring till CSN:s personal.
   

  

 Arbetet sker enligt Scrum och skalad Scrum, med flera parallella team och beroenden.
   

  

**Ska-krav**
* Ha minst 7 års erfarenhet av test inom systemutveckling eller systemförvaltning de senaste 10 åren, med djup förståelse för testplanering, testfall och komplexa systemsamband
* Ha minst 5 års erfarenhet av testautomatisering de senaste 7 åren, inklusive scriptframtagning
* Ha erfarenhet av integrationstester mellan olika organisationers IT-miljöer
* Ha arbetat med test i miljöer som kör Camunda
* Ha mångårig erfarenhet av testautomatisering i projekt med flera parallella team med beroenden
* Ha god kunskap om databaser och SQL för avstämning och stickprov
* Ha djup förståelse för att skapa och preparera avancerad testdata i databaser
* Ha minst 5 års erfarenhet av test inom IT-organisationer med minst 100 anställda
* Ha erfarenhet av test i ekonomiska system (t.ex. bank, finans, reskontra, bokföring, ränteberäkning)
* Ha mångårig erfarenhet som stöd och mentor till andra testare och systemutvecklare inom testautomatisering
* Ha arbetat agilt
* Ha utbildning i testmetodik
* Kunna skriva och tala flytande svenska


**Mervärdeskrav**
* Ha mångårig erfarenhet av test och kvalitetssäkring inom offentlig sektor
* Ha arbetat med test i händelsebaserad microservices-arkitektur
* Ha arbetat med Camunda Cockpit
* Ha arbetat med Rabbit MQ
* Ha arbetat i RedHat OpenShift-miljö
* Ha arbetat med Jenkins för testautomatisering och byggprocess
* Ha arbetat med Git (Git bash) och Bitbucket
* Ha erfarenhet av Angular-baserade front-endapplikationer
* Ha arbetat med API-verktyg som Bruno, SoapUI eller motsvarande
* Ha arbetat med Swagger
* Ha arbetat med QMF eller IBM Datastudio
* Ha arbetat med Mocha eller motsvarande
* Ha erfarenhet av loggkontroll i Splunk kopplat till test
* Ha arbetat som testledare eller motsvarande
* Ha arbetat i uppdrag där Scrum varit fastställt arbetssätt
* Ha arbetat med Xray för test management
* Ha arbetat med Jira och Confluence

title: Join Scatterin as a Business Development Intern / Part-Time Role!
description:
**About Us** 




 Scatterin is a KTH spin-off driving a paradigm shift in materials analysis to accelerate sustainable materials and process developments.
 



 Our data analysis platform and services make synchrotron and neutron X-ray facilities — the world’s most powerful microscopes — accessible for industrial R&D.
 



 Our technology enables companies to analyze real materials and components significantly faster and at higher resolution than conventional lab tools, cutting R&D time and cost while accelerating innovation in materials, energy, and manufacturing.
 



 We collaborate with global industry leaders and bridge cutting-edge science with industrial impact.
 



  





**Your role** 




 We are looking for a
 **proactive and motivated intern** 
 to support our business development activities.
 



 You will work closely with our leadership team to expand our market presence, strengthen partnerships, and drive new opportunities across Europe and beyond.
 



 It is a part-time position with 20-50% involvement, starting at your earliest convenience, as mutually agreed upon.
 



**Your main tasks:** 



* Prospect and identify potential customers and partners in Europe and beyond
* Support market research
* Assist in developing strategic partnerships and collaborations
* Engage in customer outreach and relationship management
* Contribute to social media, marketing, and communication campaigns
* Support strategic planning for entry into new market segments
* Support communication and documentation across ongoing business activities



  





**Who You Are** 



* Bachelor’s or Master’s student in Engineering, Business, or related field.
* Preferably 3
 rd 
 - 5
 th 
 year student.
* Excellent written and spoken English (Swedish and/or additional language is a plus)
* Strong communication, coordination, and execution skills.
* Analytical mindset with interest in technology, science, and business.
* Curious, self-driven, and eager to learn in an international environment.
* Previous experience in similar activities (e.g. business development, market analysis, or communication) is a strong plus.
* Have valid Swedish working permit.



  





**What We Offer** 



* Experience in a deep-tech startup shaping the future of industrial materials innovation
* Direct exposure to international business development and high-tech commercialization
* Opportunity to work closely with founders and industry leaders
* Flexible work schedule, hybrid possibility, and office at KTH Campus
* Dynamic, supportive, and innovative team culture
* Compensation: hourly-basis part-time working
* Strong candidates will have the opportunity to join Scatterin as permanent team members, helping shape the future of materials analysis at a fast-growing deeptech startup.



  





**Join Our Journey** 




 If you are passionate about bridging cutting-edge technology with industry needs, driving innovation, and help industry shaping the future - Scatterin is the place for you.
 



 We believe in diversity and therefore welcome candidates of all backgrounds.
 



  
 



 To apply or inquire, contact:
 



 Ahmet Bahadir Yildiz, CEO – ahmet@scatterin.com
 



 Markus Holmström, Head of Business Development – markus@scatterin.com
 



 with your CV and short text expressing your interest and relevance with the position.
 



  





 Deadline: 15 November 2025.
 



 Interviews are conducted on a rolling basis, and the position will be filled as soon as the right candidate is found. We therefore encourage you to submit your application as soon as possible, as the position may be closed earlier.

title: Global Product Manager - Communication Software
description:
**Why Join Us?**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.
   

  

 To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our solutions.
   

  

 Are you passionate about shaping the future of software products that connect people and drive meaningful outcomes? We are seeking a strategic and visionary
 **Global Product Manager** 
 to lead one or more products within our Communication Software portfolio. In this role, you will be responsible for setting the long-term vision and strategy, driving product discovery, and ensuring commercial success through market insights, innovation, and cross-functional collaboration. You will work closely with Tech, Design, and Product Managers in other teams and with multiple internal groups.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
**Vision, Strategy & Roadmapping**
* Define the long-term product vision and strategy.
* Set product roadmaps aligned with portfolio strategy and business objectives.
* Convert user and customer insights into actionable requirements and roadmap items.


**Discovery, Research & Validation**
* Drive discovery and rapid experimentation.
* Conduct market research and competitor analysis to identify innovation opportunities and growth drivers.
* Analyze financial feasibility and growth potential for product initiatives.
* Build and maintain relationships with key stakeholders and partners to gather insights and test assumptions.


**Product Lifecycle Management**
* Launch new products and manage end-of-life plans for sunset-stage products.


**Collaboration & Communication**
* Collaborate closely with Design, Engineering, Market Units, and other Product Managers to ensure alignment and data-driven decisions.
* Communicate product vision and outcomes clearly across internal and external teams.
* Represent and advocate for the product publicly as a strong voice and ambassador.


**Minimum Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s degree in business or technology.
* 5+ years of experience in software product management and SaaS.
* Data-informed decision-maker, with experience in using data to inform product strategy and measure performance.
* Proven success in developing go-to-market strategies for new and emerging segments.
* Strong commercial and business acumen.
* Excellent collaboration and communication skills, with the ability to work across teams and stakeholders.
* Strong internal drive and motivation to challenge the status quo.
* Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to gather teams around common objectives.
* Thorough understanding of great product experiences.


**Preferred Certifications**
* Certification in product management methodologies
* Training or certification in customer-centric design or technology product design
* Professional development in scaled agile frameworks or enterprise product management


**Work Environment**
* Hybrid work environment
* Occasional international travel required to engage with global teams, customers, and markets.


**Our Values:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, our mission guides what we do, and our values guide us in how we do it. Across the organization, we are committed to being Collaborative, Considerate, Curious and Courageous. We build a trusting environment where every team member prioritizes our customers with empathy and insight. Bold ideas and learning lead to impactful solutions. Driven by curiosity, we continuously challenge the status quo to create meaningful, customer-focused solutions for our customers.
   

  

**What We Offer:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we believe in empowering individuals – including our employees - to reach their full potential. Here’s what makes us unique:
   

  

* Purpose-Driven Work: Join a company that transforms lives by giving a voice to those with communication challenges. Every day, your work makes a meaningful and concrete impact.
* “Yes, and...” Flexibility: Build a rewarding career AND enjoy time with loved ones. We offer flexible work options so you don’t have to choose between personal and professional goals.
* Growth and Development: Whether you’re advancing your skills or growing your career, we invest in your future with training, learning opportunities, and internal growth paths.
* Inclusive and Supportive Culture: Work in a collaborative, caring environment where diversity and individuality are valued. You’ll feel connected to both your team and our global community.
* A Global Leader with Heart: Be part of an innovative, forward-thinking company that combines experience and cutting-edge solutions with a mission to change lives.

title: Configuration Manager
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Vi söker en Configuration Manager eller någon med liknande profilering som har kunskap och intresse för teknik och gillar att kombinera detta med processhantering och administration. Är du till profilen inte en renodlad Configuration Manager ser vi att du t.ex. har en bakgrund inom utveckling och är numera intresserad av att arbeta med övergripande hantering av just konfigurering och datainnehåll inom utpekade utvecklingsverktyg, versions- och patchhanteringsprocesser av mjukvaror och CI/CD-processer.
   

  

 Du blir en del av en större leverans av utvecklings- och förvaltningstjänster åt en kund inom den finansiella sektorn. I dagsläget är vi flera medarbetare som jobbar i olika team, där vi arbetar nära och stöttar varandra i ett mycket fint samspel med kunden. Här kommer du att ingå i ett stödteam med olika kompetenser i CGI:s befintliga leverans.
   

  

 Rollen är ny och man ges därför möjlighet att vara med och påverka i uppbyggnaden av bra processer, administrativ hantering och områden som är föremål för hantering. Vi på CGI tror på tanken att vi når längre om vi trivs ihop och jobbar tillsammans. Hos oss får du stöd av erfarna kollegor, möjlighet till kompetensutveckling och chansen att påverka processerna från start. Varje dag bygger vi varandra, våra kunder och vår verksamhet.
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 I rollen som Configuration Manager ansvarar du specifikt för att stötta alla de andra teamen med övergripande områden såsom främst versions- och patchhantering av mjukvaror, men även omvärldsbevakning av versioner av mjukvaror, verktyg, licenser etc. Ytterligare en viktig del i arbetsuppgifterna kommer att vara att medverka i förvaltning av och bistå webbutvecklare med stöd inom CI/CD-processer, samt att styra och medverka i förvaltning av konfigurering och datainnehåll i våra utvecklingsverktyg.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 Vi förutsätter att du har ett gediget intresse för teknik och att du har en ”detektiv-mentalitet” där gräva fram information många gånger kan behövas. Du har öga för såväl helheten som detaljer, ser behoven och säkerställer att allt kommer på plats på ett strukturerat och ansvarsfullt sätt. Upprättande och löpande revidering av listor/administration av listade områden är en viktig del av arbetet. Du har lätt för att samarbeta med kollegor, kund och tredjepartsleverantörer och är till naturen en koordinativ, kommunikativ och drivande person som gillar att vara spindeln i nätet. Vi lägger stor vikt vid rätt inställning till att arbeta med listade områden!
   

  

 Tekniker/områden/verktyg/programvara du med fördel har erfarenhet av (viktigast är dock att du lätt kan ta till dig information inom teknikerna nedan, härrörande mjukvaror och byggprocesserna):
   

  

* Vana att arbeta i Windows och miljöer med applikationer som bygger på:
* .NET Framework/.NET
* Visual Studio
* Angular
* NodeJS
* SPA (Single Page Application)
* Windows Powershell
* CI/CD-processer och pipelines
* Patch- och versionshantering
* Omvärldsbevakning av mjukvaror
* Gitlab eller motsvarande byggverktyg
* Docker / Linux
* Licensfrågor
* Verktygsfrågor


 Övrigt
   

  

 Kommunikationen i vårt kunduppdrag sker i huvudsak på svenska vilket gör att vi kräver god kunskap i svenska språket.
   

  

 En säkerhetsprövning kommer att behöva genomföras inför anställning.
   

  

 Kandidater kommer att utvärderas löpande.
   

  

 Vad kan vi på CGI erbjuda dig?
   

  

 Flexibla arbetstider och placering ger dig möjlighet till balans mellan privatliv och arbete, oavsett var i livet just du befinner dig. Du kommer att anställas med kollektivavtal, försäkringar, möjlighet till delägarskap samt även andra förmåner.
   

  

 Vill du veta mer?
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig! Ansökningarna kommer hanteras löpande. Om det fortfarande finns något du undrar över, skicka gärna dina funderingar till per.bingefors@cgi.com.
   

  

 Om CGI
   

  

 CGI leder digitaliseringen av Sverige och är världsledande på att omvandla innovation, information och teknologi. Genom djup branschkunskap och en förståelse för kundens utmaningar, bidrar vi med insikter för att skapa hållbara resultat. Vi finns i 40 länder med 90 000 medarbetare globalt. I Sverige är vi ca 4000 anställda på 30 orter med huvudkontor i Stockholm. Läs mer om CGI på vår hemsida: www.cgi.se
   

  

 Läs mer om CGI på vår hemsida: www.cgi.se
   

  

**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Operations Manager
description:
At Legora, we’re on a mission to transform the way lawyers work. Our AI native platform lets legal professionals enhance their productivity and automate complex workflows. We collaborate closely with our clients and iterate at a market-leading pace. In a year, we have gone from an early MVP to tools used daily by thousands of lawyers, and are now scaling rapidly. We are here to win together with our team and clients, and carry the belief that life is too short not to accomplish something truly special.
   

  

 You are joining an early-stage scale-up with exceptional product market fit, trusted by global leaders like Cleary Gottlieb, Goodwin and Bird & Bird. Backed by over $110M in funding from top investors including ICONIQ, General Catalyst, Benchmark, Redpoint, and Y Combinator. And a world-class team from Google, Klarna, Spotify, Slack, and top tier consulting and law firms with infinite room to grow professionally.
   

  

**The Role**
 Legora’s Operations team sits at the heart of the company, making sure everything runs, scales, and evolves at the same incredible pace as our product and clients. We’re now looking for an Operations Associate to join this small but mighty team and accelerate our global growth.
   

  

 This is the perfect role for someone who thrives in a fast-moving environment, wants to help shape how a company operates, and enjoys working cross functionally to make big things happen. You’ll work closely with our leadership team on a wide range of projects across operations, GTM, legal, product, and recruiting, helping the company stay one step ahead as we scale.
   

  

 Think of it as part operator, part project manager, part Chief of Staff. A role where you’ll take ownership, bring structure to complexity, and have an outsized impact on how the company runs day to day.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
**Work cross-functionally** 
 with operations, GTM, legal, management, and engineering on a wide variety of strategic and operational projects.
   

  

**Translate priorities into execution** 
 - breaking down goals, tracking progress, and keeping the organisation moving fast and aligned.
   

  

**Take ownership** 
 of company wide initiatives, ensuring clarity, follow-up, and results.
   

  

**Identify and fix bottlenecks** 
 - spotting operational challenges before they become problems.
   

  

**Help build systems and processes** 
 that enable scale, without slowing the team down.
   

  

**Play a key role in shaping the company** 
 as it grows, contributing to decisions that define how we work, communicate, and operate.
   

  

**Be challenged and grow quickly** 
 - this is a role with steep learning curves and real impact.
   

  

**Who You Are**
**Innovative:** 
 You thrive in a dynamic startup environment where problems don’t always have obvious or easy answers.
   

  

**Autonomous:** 
 You take initiative, lead with ownership, and value feedback, you’d rather move fast and learn than play it safe. You’re getting things done.
   

  

**Entrepreneurial:** 
 You’re energized by building, not maintaining — and you’re comfortable adapting as responsibilities evolve.
   

  

**Collaborative:** 
 You enjoy working with others and believe that great outcomes are built together.
   

  

**Structured:** 
 You bring clarity to ambiguity and know how to turn messy problems into actionable plans.
   

  

**No Ego:** 
 We put the company first. We take pride in delivering outcomes, sometimes this means getting your hands dirty.
   

  

**Preferred Qualifications**
* 2–4 years of experience in MBB, operations, business management, or a fast growing startup.
* Proven ability to lead and execute complex, cross-functional projects.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills in English (Swedish a plus).
* Experience working directly with senior leaders or founders.


**Why This Role Matters**
 This is a chance to help build the engine behind one of the most exciting companies in legal tech. You’ll work on high leverage projects, collaborate closely with leadership, and play a key role in shaping how Legora scales globally.
   

  

 If you’re excited by the idea of combining strategy, operations, and execution, and want to be part of a world class team redefining an industry. We’d love to meet you.
   

  

 We founded Legora to empower lawyers with the tools they truly deserve. We’re not building for the way law is practiced today - we’re reimagining how it will be practiced tomorrow.

title: Client Services Manager
description:
*Are you driven by developing and leading technical and competent colleagues? At Lumera, we are now looking for a Client Services Manager who, with commitment and coaching, will lead application consultants and solution architects. You will have a central role in developing the services business and enabling team members to grow with Lumera.*
**What you will contribute** 
**with**
 We continue to grow and are now looking our team with a Client Services Manager within Global Services. You will have personnel responsibility for 15-20 Application Consultants and Solution Architects, staffing responsibility, conduct development dialogues, recruitment, onboard new employees, and much more. One of your most important goals is to enable employees to deliver and grow within Lumera with the right skills and commitment. You will be part of the management team for Client Services and are expected to contribute to the development of our services business.
   

  

 Client Services is part of Lumera's delivery- and customer organization Global Services, which works with the implementation and management of our product and delivers services related to customers' business and business development. The work takes place in implementation projects and customer teams where specialists support the organization and customers broadly. Everyone works closely with our customers, as well as other internal divisions.
   

  

 You report to Gitte Belander, Head of Client Services within Global Services.
   

  

**Who are you?**
* You have documented experience as a manager with personnel and staffing responsibility, preferably from consulting or product companies.
* Experience working as a consultant within IT
* Experience from the Life and Pension industry, product companies, and agile organizations is highly meritorious
* You have an academic degree.
* You are fluent in Swedish and English, both spoken and written
* You are a natural leader with great commitment and drive who inspires others. Additionally, you are a humble team player who loves to solve problems.


**What** 
**we offer you**
* Wonderful and genuinely committed colleagues who always support each other
* Varied and fun work with a complex and socially important product
* Development opportunities internally: with us, you get the chance to develop, grow, and take responsibility early
* Central (and brand new!) office at Regeringsgatan with the possibility of hybrid work two days a week
* Focus on employee well-being: feel free to ask us about our benefits package!
* Be part of a company that is now scaling up and investing internationally


**Does it sound good? Then we want to** 
**get in touch with you!**
 Apply with a CV or LinkedIn profile. We encourage you not to wait too long to apply as we conduct interviews continuously. The start date for the position is by agreement. A background check will be conducted before a hiring decision is made.
   

  

 Questions? Contact the recruiting manager Gitte Belander gitte.belander@lumera.com.
   

  

 We look forward to your application!
   

  

**About Lumera**
 Lumera is dedicated to the digital transformation of the European Life and Pensions industry. As insurtech innovators, we provide future-proof core technology for policy administration.
   

  

 The Prudent Revolution is our mission – bridging technology and partnership to navigate the fastest, safest path through complex change for L&P providers.
   

  

 We combine tech and industry expertise with relevant market experience to offer a broad range of consultancy and data services – from managing faultless legacy system migration to facilitating compelling end-user experiences.
   

  

 Based in Stockholm, Lumera has significant presence with offices in the United Kingdom, the Netherlands, Norway, Sweden, India and Vietnam.
   

  

 Lumera is majority owned by Monterro, a leading Nordic software investor.
   

  

 www.lumera.com
   

  

 Follow us on LinkedIn and Facebook.
   

  

 We are Lumera - pioneering the digital transformation of the Life and Pensions industry. With strategic partnerships and advanced automation, we streamline policy administration, making complex processes simpler. Our mission, The Prudent Revolution, guides L&P providers through change, ensuring a smooth transition. Trusted for migrations and armed with deep domain expertise and innovative AI solutions, Lumera shapes the future. Join us on this innovative journey!

title: Creative Technologist, Kyndryl Vital, Nordics & Baltics
description:
**Who We Are**
 At Kyndryl, we design, build, manage and modernize the mission-critical technology systems that the world depends on every day. So why work at Kyndryl? We are always moving forward – always pushing ourselves to go further in our efforts to build a more equitable, inclusive world for our employees, our customers and our communities.
   

  

**The Role**
 The Role
   

  

 A Creative Technologist is a cross-disciplinary person that bridge between a design vision and engineering execution, using experimentation to solve problems in new and novel ways. They Combines technical expertise with human-centered design to prototype and implement innovative solutions. Creative technologists blend expertise in code, hardware, and emerging technologies to bring ideas to life.
   

  

 As a Creative Technologist at Kyndryl Vital Nordics and Baltics, you will:
   

  

* Collaborate with designers, engineers, and stakeholders to shape technical concepts aligned to human-centered design.
* Rapidly prototype interactive, testable experiences to drive alignment, learning, and value.
* Apply emerging technologies to business challenges, including AI/ML/GenAI, IoT, and immersive interfaces.
* Lead feasibility analysis and ethical review of technology choices.


 Required Technical and Professional Expertise
   

  

* Human-Centered Design: You have a deep understanding of human-centered design methods and mindset.
* Cross-disciplinary Collaboration: You excel at uniting design and engineering.
* Innovation: You can apply new applications for emerging tech.
* Rapid Prototyping: You can create context-appropriate, low- to high-fidelity digital and physical prototypes.
* Feasibility Analysis: You can assess design’s technical feasibility, system integration, and implementation pathways.
* Storytelling: You can translate prototypes and technical insights into compelling narratives.
* AI and Data Ethics: You leverage AI tools and data strategies with awareness of equity, bias, and transparency.


**Who You Are**
 Preferred Professional and Technical Expertise
   

  

* 3 plus years of relevant experience (dependent on level)
* Vertical domain experience (e.g., finance, retail, healthcare, industrial)
* Experience in both enterprise and agency worlds
* Knowledge and experience in IT infrastructure, architecture, and platform capabilities
* Background in behavioral science, change management, or design research
* Applied or academic experience with data science, AI/ML, or HCI


 You may specialize more deeply in:
   

  

* AI/ML/GenAI
* Phygital / Immersive Design
* IoT / Connected Product Design
* Mobile and Web Front-End Engineering


 Required Education
   

  

* Bachelor’s Degree in a relevant field (or equivalent demonstrable portfolio of work).


**Preferred Education**
* Advanced degree or certification in design, HCI, computer science, or related (e.g., MDM, MDes, MFA, d.MBA or equivalent) is a plus.


**Being You**
 Diversity is a whole lot more than what we look like or where we come from, it’s how we think and who we are. We welcome people of all cultures, backgrounds, and experiences. But we’re not doing it single-handily: Our Kyndryl Inclusion Networks are only one of many ways we create a workplace where all Kyndryls can find and provide support and advice. This dedication to welcoming everyone into our company means that Kyndryl gives you – and everyone next to you – the ability to bring your whole self to work, individually and collectively, and support the activation of our equitable culture. That’s the Kyndryl Way.
   

  

**What You Can Expect**
 With state-of-the-art resources and Fortune 100 clients, every day is an opportunity to innovate, build new capabilities, new relationships, new processes, and new value. Kyndryl cares about your well-being and prides itself on offering benefits that give you choice, reflect the diversity of our employees and support you and your family through the moments that matter – wherever you are in your life journey. Our employee learning programs give you access to the best learning in the industry to receive certifications, including Microsoft, Google, Amazon, Skillsoft, and many more. Through our company-wide volunteering and giving platform, you can donate, start fundraisers, volunteer, and search over 2 million non-profit organizations. At Kyndryl, we invest heavily in you, we want you to succeed so that together, we will all succeed.
   

  

**Get Referred!**
 If you know someone that works at Kyndryl, when asked ‘How Did You Hear About Us’ during the application process, select ‘Employee Referral’ and enter your contact's Kyndryl email address.

title: Machine Learning Engineer - Forecasting
description:
Do you want to be part of facilitating the green transition? Do you thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment where your actions drive meaningful change? Do you enjoy solving hard problems together with ambitious people? If this sounds like you, this could be a perfect match.
 



  





**Join us to facilitate the green transition** 




 Ingrid Capacity was born out of necessity. The old energy system is broken, and we’re here to rewrite the rules. We are a pioneering energy tech company on a mission to shape the future of energy by advancing power grid flexibility and optimization. By using the latest technologies in energy infrastructure and software development, we are building an intelligent, resilient, and sustainable energy system designed for the future.
 



  





**What we do** 




 We develop, own, and optimize grid-scale battery energy storage and flexible assets across Europe. Using advanced grid analytics, we strategically position our assets where they can support the electricity grid the most. With AI and data algorithmic solutions, combined with large-scale energy storage, we enable a faster and safer integration of renewable energy while eliminating grid challenges.
 



  





 Since our founding in early 2022, we have emerged as the Nordic leader in enhancing energy system flexibility. We are currently driving an unprecedented expansion, deploying 400 MW of energy storage capacity across 20+ sites in Sweden by 2025 and building innovative software solutions that enhances grid flexibility. At the same time, we are leading our expansion across Europe, starting with Finland, Germany and other key European regions.
 



  





**About the role** 




 In this role, you will play a key part in a variety of modeling and software development projects focused on forecasting. Forecasting models are central to our trading operations, providing essential inputs for our optimization algorithms. By improving the accuracy and performance of these models, you will directly enhance trading decisions, increase flexibility for grid operators, and contribute to measurable business outcomes – making your work highly valuable to the organization.
 



  





**Key tasks and responsibilities** 



* **Model Development:** 
 Design, build, test, and deploy advanced forecasting models to predict critical variables like prices and power system conditions.
* **Collaboration** 
 : Collaborate with data engineers and domain experts to ensure reliable data pipelines and robust model performance.
* **Monitoring:** 
 Track and refine forecasting algorithms to adapt to changing market conditions and improve accuracy over time.
* **Insight** 
 Generation: Translate complex model outputs into actionable insights for trading, operations, and strategy teams.
* **System Integration:** 
 Integrate forecasting modules into larger optimization and trading systems, ensuring seamless data flow and decision support.



  





**Who you are** 



* **Theoretical Skills** 
 : Knowledge of machine learning, statistics, optimization and experience working with modeling. Experience working with advanced forecasting techniques, ideally within energy.
* **Practical Skills:** 
 Experience in software engineering, Python, machine learning libraries (e.g. PyTorch), cloud computing (GCP with Vertex AI is a bonus!), containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes), and CI/CD pipelines.
* **Results-Oriented Mindset:** 
 Takes ownership, makes sound decisions, and enjoys seeing projects through to completion.
* **Collaborative:** 
 We value individuals who thrive in a collaborative environment.
* **Learning Agility:** 
 Stays up to date with evolving ML technologies and embraces new methods and tools.



  





 A degree in applied mathematics, physics, computer science, or a related field is a plus, but not mandatory for highly experienced candidates. We are more interested in your passion, skills, and drive to make a difference!
 



  





**What we offer** 




 At Ingrid Capacity, we are not just employees; we are pioneers, visionaries, and catalysts for change. We are at the forefront of the global energy transition, dedicated to shaping the future of power generation. Our company is more than a workplace; it is a platform for innovation, where we dare to push boundaries and turn bold ideas into reality.
 



  





 We firmly believe that the foundation of any successful company lies in its culture. At Ingrid Capacity, we understand that building a thriving organization demands more than just technology and innovation; it requires a company culture firmly rooted in trust, growth, and the ability to learn from mistakes. We believe that skills can be nurtured in a variety of contexts, starting from within oneself and growing together with people we trust. We are also serious about the wellbeing of our colleagues and having fun together, and with regularly hosted social activities and group training classes, we create a workplace where we can truly thrive.
 



  





**Application** 




 Sounds like a match? Welcome to apply! We’ll make selections on an ongoing basis and finalize the recruitment as soon as we’ve found the perfect match. Having said that, please don’t wait to submit your application.
 



  





 We look forward to hearing from you!
 



 /Team Ingrid Capacity

title: Senior Information Security Analyst
description:
**About Gelato** 




  





 Gelato has created the world’s largest global network for on-demand production of custom products – from t-shirts and mugs to books and wall art. We empower a new generation of ecommerce entrepreneurs to share their creativity worldwide while embracing local, sustainable production. By producing locally and perfectly matching supply with demand, we eliminate waste and reduce carbon emissions.
 



  





 At Gelato, we don’t own production facilities – we build the software that connects them. With over 140 production partners in 32 countries, our network can deliver custom products to five billion people in just 72 hours. It’s smarter, faster, and greener.
 



  





 With GelatoConnect, our SaaS platform, we’re driving innovation in print production. GelatoConnect simplifies operations for print producers by automating procurement, workflows, and logistics into one seamless system. By boosting efficiency and cutting costs, it helps businesses scale to meet market demands. With GelatoConnect, we’re reshaping the print industry to be more efficient, sustainable, and profitable.
 



  





**The position** 




  





 Following our global expansion, we are looking for a passionate Senior Information Security Analyst to join our effort of protecting Gelato and, most importantly, our customer's data.
 



 We are looking for a person who wants to make the Gelato platform safer for millions of users around the world. We’d love to talk to you if you’re a talented individual who is passionate about finding security weaknesses and crafting scalable and usable solutions. We are enablers who make it easier for engineers to create secure-by-design services, not blockers.
 



 Reporting directly to the VP of Information Security, you will work closely with Product Managers and Tech Engineers.
 



  





**What you'll be doing** 




  




* Collaborate closely with Product Design and Software Engineering to align with security features, roadmaps and ensure timely delivery.
* Identify vulnerabilities and develop innovative, scalable solutions to enhance our defense-in-depth strategy. This involves conducting vulnerability scans and penetration testing.
* Promote a security-conscious culture by educating all Gelato employees on security best practices.
* Monitor and respond to security incidents, including the regular analysis of potential threats.
* Identify, document and measure security risk, effectively communicate these risks to senior leadership, and influence remediation plans.
* Participate in an on-call rotation to provide timely response and escalation for security incidents outside of business hours, ensuring continuous protection and monitoring coverage.
* Develop, tune, and maintain security monitoring and detection systems (IAM, SIEM, SOAR, WAF, EDR) to identify suspicious activity, anomalies, and potential threats.
* Manage the full vulnerability management lifecycle, including identification, prioritisation, remediation tracking, and verification of closure.
* Contribute to security architecture reviews and the design, deployment, and hardening of security controls across infrastructure, cloud, and applications.
* Introduce automation and orchestration to streamline detection, response, and compliance activities through scripting (Python, PowerShell, Bash).
* Support governance and compliance activities such as audit preparation, evidence collection, and control testing against frameworks like ISO27001, SOC 2, NIST CSF, and CIS Controls.
* Hands-on experience designing and implementing secure AWS cloud architectures.
* Integrate AI and LLM technologies into daily security workflows to automate repetitive analysis, improve threat detection, and support rapid incident response.



  





**Who you are** 




  




* A degree (Master’s is a plus) in Computer Science, a similar technical field of study, or equivalent practical experience
* Broader certification coverage, including CISSP, CISM, GIAC (GCIH, GCIA, GCFA), CCSP, or equivalent advanced credentials.
* 7+ years of experience in cybersecurity, with at least 3 years in hands-on incident response, detection, or vulnerability management roles.
* Proven experience with SIEM, WAF, IAM, SOAR, EDR, and vulnerability management tools.
* Cloud security specialisation, ideally with certifications such as AWS Security Specialty
* Demonstrated expertise in incident response, including investigation, containment, and coordination across cross-functional teams.
* Embraces an AI-first mindset, leveraging AI and LLM tools to drive efficiency and innovation in daily work.
* Strong crisis management and communication skills, able to remain composed under pressure and communicate clearly with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Good understanding of implementation requirements for ISO27001 and/or SOC2.
* Strong practical automation and scripting capabilities using Python, PowerShell, or Bash to enhance detection and response efficiency.
* Experience designing and implementing production services, APIs, or security-specific libraries.
* Familiarity with cloud solutions, including AWS and GCP, and prior experience with tools like Cloudflare, ELK stack, and Burpsuite Professional, as well as scripting and programming skills, are required.
* Strong strategic thinking, planning, and organisational skills.
* Fluency in English with excellent verbal and written communication abilities is a mandatory requirement.



  





 To be successful in this role, you will need to have a start-up mentality. You are committed to excelling with energy, ownership, and endurance, understanding that building a secure global platform is challenging but deeply rewarding work. You are naturally curious and forward thinking, embracing an AI-first mindset and leveraging AI and LLM tools to enhance decision making and innovation in your work. You have superior communication and interpersonal skills, high integrity, and strong attention to detail. You are a confident and collaborative leader who thrives in complex environments, capable of making sound decisions under pressure while maintaining a calm and structured approach.
 



  





 You are passionate about technology, curious by nature, and motivated by the constant evolution of cybersecurity. You enjoy solving complex problems, automating solutions, and continuously improving processes to stay ahead of emerging threats.
