 Our clients include the world’s most successful hedge funds, banks, and government agencies. As we continue to grow, we're looking for passionate, technically skilled professionals to join our Search Team.
 



  





**Join RavenPack:** 




 At RavenPack, we are scaling new heights with our search technologies. We have a strong foundation and a talented team dedicated to solving complex challenges in information retrieval for the world's top financial professionals. Our mission is to architect and build the most sophisticated, scalable, and intelligent search engine in the market, powering
 
 Bigdata.com
 
 .
 



 To accelerate our innovation and redefine the standards of excellence in our industry, we are looking for a Senior Search Engineer to join our Search Team. This is a strategic role where you will act as a force multiplier, bringing specialized expertise in search systems to enhance our team's capabilities. We are looking for a hands-on engineer who is passionate about building production systems and thrives on optimizing every layer of the search stack—from low-level infrastructure to advanced ML-driven relevance.
 



 If you are driven to build world-class systems and are excited by the opportunity to elevate a strong platform to its full potential, this is your chance to make a definitive impact.
 



***European legal working status is required.***




  





**What You'll Be Doing** 



* Own the Search Infrastructure: Architect and develop our next-generation search infrastructure. Become a to-go expert for all things search-related.
* Build for Speed & Scale: Design, build, and maintain high-throughput, low-latency APIs for search, retrieval and query processing. Your work will directly impact the performance and reliability of our products.
* Productionize ML for search: In close partnership with our ML engineers and data scientists, implement and productionize state-of-the-art query understanding and ranking models. Optimize pipelines for generating and serving semantic embeddings at scale, leveraging vector search and modern language models.
* Drive Engineering & Experimentation Velocity: Establish best practices for search development and testing. Build tools and processes that empower the team to experiment and innovate rapidly and safely.
* Performance Tuning & Optimization: Profile and optimize every component of the search stack, from indexing and query processing to model inference, ensuring maximum efficiency and cost-effectiveness.
* Collaborate and Mentor: Work closely with product managers, engineers and data scientists to translate business needs into technical reality. Mentor team members, elevating their understanding of search systems and engineering best practices.
* Stay Ahead of the Curve: Actively evaluate emerging trends in ML, NLP, and Information Retrieval, prototyping new ideas to maintain our competitive edge.



  





**What We're Looking For** 



* 5+ years of hands-on professional experience building and scaling production systems, with a deep focus on information retrieval.
* Deep, practical experience with modern search technologies. Hands-on experience working with and scaling vector databases
 *(Vespa is preferred).*
* Strong programming skills in
 **Python.** 
 Practical experience with
 **Java** 
 is a strong plus.
* Solid understanding of machine learning concepts applied to search (learning-to-rank, embeddings, language model quantization…).
* Experience in environments where search quality is measured through offline evaluation, human-in-the-loop systems, or content-based heuristics.
* Exceptional quantitative and analytical skills. You can break down complex, ambiguous problems into concrete, actionable steps.
* Clear, concise, and effective communication skills in English. You can articulate complex technical ideas to both technical and non-technical audiences.



  





**Bonus Points:** 



* Direct, in-depth experience building and operating systems on Vespa.
* Experience in the financial data domain.
* Experience with MLOps tools and CI/CD pipelines in a cloud environment.



  





**What's in it for you?** 



* Growth Opportunity: Join a rapidly growing company with 180+ team members with offices in New York, Madrid, and Marbella, building AI that truly matters for business and finance.
* International Culture: Be part of a diverse, global organization with a truly international culture.
* Team of Superstars: Work alongside a talented team of professionals, including Silicon Valley executives and Wall Street veterans.
* Competitive Compensation: We offer a highly competitive salary package and performance-based bonuses.
* Full Remote
* Relocation Assistance: Comprehensive relocation support is available to help you and your family move to the beautiful Costa del Sol, if you are willing to relocate
* Work-Life Balance: Enjoy paid vacation, flexible time-off, and a flexible work policy.
* Continuous learning: We provide the support needed to grow within the team.

title: Data Analytics Lead, Consumer Pricing
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Consumer Pricing Analytics focuses on driving efficient top-line growth in a capital-efficient manner. We tackle affordability challenges, measure the effectiveness of incentive programs, and optimize fee and incentive structures through rigorous experimentation. Partnering closely with Product, Finance, and Strategy & Operations, we provide the analytical backbone that guides measurement, strategic bets, and day-to-day decisions.
   

  

 At Wolt’s scale, marketing and growth decisions involve complex trade-offs and exciting opportunities to influence business outcomes. Our team brings together top talent in Data Science and Analytics Engineering to solve these challenges and shape the future of pricing and incentives at Wolt. As we grow to the next level of maturity, you will help expand our analytical capabilities across different business domains and drive real business impact.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We’re looking for an awesome specialist to join Wolt as a
 **Data Analytics Lead** 
 in
 **Finland, Sweden, or Germany** 
 . As a Data Analytics Lead at Wolt, you are essential in revolutionizing our pricing and incentive strategies. Positioned at the forefront, this lead will steer pricing operations, develop comprehensive strategies, and ensure alignment with the company's overarching objectives. Acting as a critical partner to senior business and product leaders, this role will drive the Pricing & Incentives domain forward, shaping the future of our initiatives.
   

  

 Key responsibilities include defining and monitoring key performance indicators to gauge the effectiveness of incentive programs and pricing components. The role offers an exciting opportunity to brainstorm 0-to-1 growth investment opportunities and establish the foundation for our investment efficiency measurements. Additionally, this leader will take on the exciting responsibility of leading and growing a dynamic team of go-getters to achieve tangible business impact.
   

  

 Success in this role requires exceptional leadership and project management skills, along with strong communication and interpersonal abilities. Collaborating effectively with cross-functional teams will be crucial in fostering a culture of shared success and innovation. This position offers a thrilling opportunity to shape the future of growth at Wolt!
   

  

 Our offering to you
   

  

* The online delivery platform that Wolt is building will offer you interesting and complex challenges together with the opportunities to create a big impact with your skills. Lots of geolocational and temporal data in real-time combined with differences in the economics and dynamics of the cities we operate in make Wolt both a challenging and so interesting company to practice analytics!
* You would get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, we think big but stay humble, do right by people, we treat others kindly and justly, recognize that if we don’t learn, we won’t stay still but fall behind and keep in mind that Luke was Yoda’s greatest achievement.


 Our humble expectations
   

  

* 7+ years of experience in a Data Analytics or Data Science position, with 3+ years of leadership experience.
* Track record of hiring, mentoring, and growing high-performing data science teams.
* Expertise with SQL and statistical analysis using Python, R, or equivalent.
* Strong know-how on experimentation techniques (A/B testing and causal inference) and hypothesis testing.
* Clear and concise communication with strong cross-functional partnership experience.
* Relentless pursuit of new ideas and data sources, and have the ability to systematically tackle ambiguous problems with a data-driven, hypothesis-based approach.
* Ability to work and communicate effectively in English.
* Bonus: Familiarity with multi-sided marketplaces and price optimization.


 Next steps
   

  

 The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!
   

  

 The compensation will be a combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie!
   

  

 For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Talent Acquisition Partner - Zhanna Filintseva
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Global Prescription Leader - Data Center 80-100%
description:
**Together with our customers, we combine the real and digital worlds**
 With technology, software and services for smart buildings, we transform the everyday for everyone. By combining the real and digital worlds, we empower our customers to reach their decarbonization goals, lower their operating costs and create world-class occupant experiences for their people. It’s not just about improving buildings – it’s about creating efficient, safe, adaptable and sustainable environments, which improve the way the world lives and works.
   

  

 The digital transformation of buildings is a fast-changing, dynamic sector, and it needs more than just great technology - it needs great people, too. We know a business only thrives if its people are thriving, so at Siemens we put our people first.
   

  

**We are looking for a new colleague with a comprehensive understanding of overall data center solutions to join our Global Datacenter Application Hub.** 
 In this role, you will support external consultants and planners in designing tailored specifications for data centers in the field of liquid cooling, simulations, automation, security, fire and power monitoring. You will develop a standard reference prescription to position Siemens as the trusted advisor for data center solutions. You will collaborate with cross-Business Unit professionals, partners and the sales teams in our focus countries to drive specifications and promote our portfolio.
   

  

 Within our buildings business, our distributed team will support you through your career and challenge you to grow in new and exciting ways, as we transform the world’s infrastructure.
 **Our shared journey could take you anywhere … where would you like to go?**
**Your New Responsibilities**
* Identify and engage with existing and potential partners and customers, understanding their needs to bring value propositions that differentiate Siemens in the data center market
* Collaborate with consultants in the data center market to specify Siemens products and solutions, ensuring alignment with industry standards and client requirements
* Partner with cross-BU Siemens sales teams to drive specifications and promote products, solutions, and services to customers in the data center vertical
* Engage with business decision-makers at all organizational levels to identify requirements and new market opportunities
* Monitor industry trends and competitors’ activities to develop standardized design and identify innovation opportunities
* Work closely with marketing refine Siemens’ value proposition for consultants and technical decision-makers
* Deliver internal training sessions, visit client sites, and consistently exceed KPIs based on sales and engagement metrics
* Provide strategic insights to management regarding industry trends, regulatory changes, and competitive positioning to continuously improve Siemens’ data center designs and offerings


**Your Skills And Experience**
* Bachelor's degree in engineering or an equivalent; an MBA or relevant graduate degree is beneficial
* Proven experience in technical sales or vertical markets, with a strong focus on data centers
* In-depth understanding of data center technologies and solutions, including Integrated Data Center Management Suite, liquid cooling systems, and Data Center Infrastructure Management (DCIM) software
* Broad knowledge of regulatory, legislative, business, and technology trends across multiple markets
* Knowledge of medium voltage products and systems, protection systems, and energy automation solutions
* Excellent planning, communication, writing, and facilitation skills
* Ability to quickly adjust strategies and approaches as conditions change
* Possesses a rigorous and analytical attitude to overcome challenges and solve problems effectively
* Excellent communication and presentation abilities in English. German and any additional European language would be beneficial


**Location** 
 : qualified candidates need a valid work permit for the respective country. Relocation to another country is not planned
   

  

**Employee benefits:** 
 local benefits apply
   

  

**What it’s like working for us** 
 We place significant emphasis on fostering an inclusive and flexible working culture that encourages everyone to be their authentic selves. Equal opportunities and diversity are important to us and contribute to an enriching culture. We actively embrace mobile working to provide every colleague with more autonomy and the chance to achieve a good work-life balance. Learn more here
   

  

**Frequently asked questions and contact information** 
 Here you will find a collection of frequently asked questions and a way to contact us directly.
   

  

 Information for recruitment agencies: Siemens is not accepting applications from recruitment agencies for this position. Thank you for your understanding.

title: Master thesis: Sustainability impact of enhanced ICT resilience
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity:**
 The Sustainability team within the Research Area Consumer & IndustryLab—an agile and diverse organization within Ericsson Research. We are driven by curiosity and a passion for shaping a sustainable, resilient and connected future by better understanding the needs and challenges amongst consumers, industries and society. Our research focuses on environmental impact assessment and the societal impact of Information and Communication Technologies (ICT).
   

  

 As digital infrastructure including supporting infrastructure that the IT resources are dependent on to be operational becomes increasingly critical to society, there is an urgent need to ensure its resilience without exacerbating its environmental impact.
   

  

 We are looking for 1 student for this position based in Stockholm.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Investigate trade-offs between redundancy for resilience and resource efficiency.
* Conduct literature reviews, and/or interviews with industry experts to gather insights and data.
* Investigate the role of AI and predictive analytics in optimizing both robustness and sustainability. The physical location of cloud services and AI resources as well as the demand of regional self-dependencies are also to be considered.
* The approach could be either to assess a “best case scenario” or a range between a technological “good enough” level and full access with no constraints.
* Based on the chosen scenario, identify important key elements, pain points, or factors to focus on going forward.
* Propose strategies for enhancing the resilience of ICT infrastructure that are aligned with efforts to reduce its environmental footprint.


**The skills you will bring:**
* Background in engineering with a focus on environmental sustainability.
* A strong interest in sustainability, digital infrastructure, and systems thinking.
* Familiarity with ICT systems and AI, data analytics, or predictive modeling.
* Strong analytical mindset.
* Fluency in English, both written and spoken.
* Self-driven and organized, with the ability to work independently and collaboratively.


**Application:**
 Please submit your application with a resume and academic transcripts from both your BSc and your MSc.
   

  

**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 773625

title: Senior Search ML Engineer - NLP
description:
**About us** 




 RavenPack is the leading big data analytics provider for financial services. Financial professionals and organizations rely on RavenPack for its speed and accuracy in analyzing large amounts of unstructured content. Our products help clients enhance their decision-making by quantifying the impact of media sentiment and attention.
 



  





 Our clients include the world’s most successful hedge funds, banks, and government agencies. As we continue to grow, we're looking for passionate, technically skilled professionals to join our Search Team.
 



  





**Join RavenPack:** 




 At RavenPack, our search engine is the gateway through which financial professionals access critical information. Our mission is to architect and build the most sophisticated, scalable, and intelligent search engine in the market, powering Bigdata.com.
 



 To make this gateway truly intelligent, we are looking for an insightful and experienced Senior Search Machine Learning Engineer - NLP to join our Search Team. This is a strategic role designed for a scientist who is driven to understand the "why" behind every search, defining and building our relevance systems from the ground up. In an environment where user privacy is paramount, the intelligence of our search engine must come from a profound, first-principles understanding of our content.
 



 You will own the full analytical and modeling lifecycle, from analyzing content and building gold-standard benchmarks, to developing the next generation of our relevance, ranking, and query understanding models.
 



 This role is for a natural problem-solver who combines scientific rigor with product intuition, and who is passionate about seeing their insights directly translate into a smarter, more intuitive search experience.
 



  





**European legal working status is required. Remote option available** 




  





**What You'll Be Doing** 



* Become an Expert on Content: Dive deep into our vast corpus of documents, understanding its intrinsic properties. Build and maintain benchmark datasets, to serve as the core for all our improvements and initiatives.
* Translate Query Intent into Search intelligence: Work on the development of our query understanding capabilities. Develop and fine-tune a range of efficient Language Models for specialized tasks related to content enrichment and query understanding, such as Named Entity Recognition or topic classification.
* Build Advanced Relevance Features: Architect the features and models that power our core ranking and re-ranking systems, using insights derived from deep content and query analysis.
* Own the Science of Search Evaluation: Champion a culture of data-driven decision-making. You will design and analyze offline experiments and tests to prove the impact of our work and guide the product roadmap.
* Collaborate on Product Strategy: Act as a strategic partner to Product Managers and Engineers. Gather and analyse user feedback, identifying their information needs. Your analysis and insights will be critical in identifying new opportunities and shaping the future direction of our search and discovery products.



  





**What We're Looking For** 



* A Master’s or PhD in a quantitative field (e.g., Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics) and 4+ years of professional experience in data science with a focus on Search or Recommender Systems.
* A proven track record of working on search relevance, ranking, query understanding or solving closely-related NLP problems.
* Demonstrable, hands-on experience building, fine-tuning, and evaluating a range of language models for specific tasks like classification, NER, and semantic similarity.
* Experience in experimental design and statistical analysis. Expertise in creating evaluation datasets and developing relevance guidelines. You know how to ask the right questions and how to design experiments that provide clear, statistically significant answers.
* A talent for structuring ambiguous problems and applying logical reasoning, translating complex challenges into clear, actionable plans.
* High proficiency in Python and data science libraries (e.g., Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, PyTorch/TensorFlow, Hugging Face) and familiarity with SQL or other query languages.
* The ability to distill complex findings into clear, concise insights for diverse audiences, from engineers to executives. You are a collaborator by nature.



  





**Bonus Points:** 



* Direct experience in the financial services or financial data industry.
* Experience with knowledge graph construction.
* Experience analyzing data from search platforms like Vespa.



  





**What's in it for you?** 



* Growth Opportunity: Join a rapidly growing company with 180+ team members with offices in New York, Madrid, and Marbella, building AI that truly matters for business and finance.
* International Culture: Be part of a diverse, global organization with a truly international culture.
* Team of Superstars: Work alongside a talented team of professionals, including Silicon Valley executives and Wall Street veterans.
* Competitive Compensation: We offer a highly competitive salary package and performance-based bonuses.
* Relocation Assistance: Comprehensive relocation support is available to help you and your family move to the beautiful Costa del Sol.
* Work-Life Balance: Enjoy paid vacation, flexible time-off, and a flexible work policy.
* Continuous learning: We provide the support needed to grow within the team.

title: MAX are looking for new co-workers!
description:
*MAX is not only Sweden’s favourite burger restaurant chain, it is also one of the first. Back in 1968 the founders of MAX, Curt Bergfors and Britta Andersson, opened their first restaurant in Gällivare, high up in the northern parts of Sweden. Today we are more than 5000 employees in several countries and we are constantly growing.*
 Aiming for a career within the fast food business? Looking for additional income during your studies? Either way we might have the right opportunity for you!
   

  

 All people are equal! To us that means equal opportunities, rights and obligations no matter who you are. The only limit is your own goals and results. We will guide you through with a clear plan, internal training and great opportunities to grow and develop with Sweden’s tastiest burger chain.
   

  

 Your job at the restaurant will include to serve our guests, prepare the food and make sure the restaurant is clean and tidy at all times. The main goal is to provide Sweden’s tastiest burgers, every day. The working hours will vary from daytime, evenings to nights and weekends. To make sure you get familiar with all aspects of the job you will be guided by your manager through digital and on-the-job training. Almost all of our managers have started their career in this very position.
   

  

**Who are you?**
 In order to fancy this job you need to love service and enjoy fast pace. You like to work in a team and are most effective when you get to be a part of a group. Quality is key to us so you need to be very orderly but at the same time keep up with the guest’s expectations on fast delivery.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
 A fast paced fun job where everyone works closely together as well as great opportunities to grow and develop along with us. Terms and conditions are according to our collective agreement and we also offer health benefits to all employees.
   

  

 We welcome your application as soon as possible! Please note that the selection process will start immediately and that the position might be filled before the application deadline.

title: Senior Analyst in Exchange Services
description:
A superb opportunity to join NASDAQ a constantly growing and innovative Fin-Tech company where finance and technology meet, building one of the most low-latency, impactful and data-intensive systems in the world.
   

  

 As part of the team, we provide trading and technical service to our sophisticated worldwide members and vendors of the Nordic and Baltic exchanges. More specifically, we work with order and trading related queries, analysis and handling of cases, incident management, testing and supporting our market participants. Also supporting regulatory frameworks for exchange activities and operations. We are working in a dynamic environment where colleagues are available in person as well as virtual. You will have a chance to create an excellent network of contacts and opportunities of partnership and personal growth. Are you the person we are looking for?
   

  

**What will you be doing?**
* Order and trade management for our exchange members on our Nordic and Baltic equity, Fixed Income and derivative markets.
* Address our members in trading or technical issues related to the trading systems or auxiliary systems.
* Market data queries for our vendors and members.
* Collaborating in a cross-team environment to resolve client cases, incident handling and project work.
* Assist internal and external stakeholders in testing new functionality for our trading systems and also work on improvements for our operational processes.
* Working with regulatory frameworks such as MIFID II.


**Who are we looking for?**
* Preferably university studies/degree in engineering or business.
* This is a junior role so if you have some work experience (1-3years) that is beneficial.
* Demonstrates good social skills and strong communicative ability in English, both verbally and in writing.
* Proactive mentality with the ability to quickly learn and adapt to new technology, as well as strong work ethics.
* Interest in financial markets and trading concepts would be seen as a merit.


**What will it be like working here?**
 Nasdaq is a vibrant and entrepreneurial company where everyone is encouraged to take initiative, challenge the status quo and take intelligent risks. We want everyone to feel welcome and bring their authentic self to work. Every day, we are building a culture where we all feel connected, supported and empowered.
   

  

**What do we offer you?**
 We recognize that our employees work tremendously hard; in exchange, we compensate well, offering, bonuses and equity grants and comprehensive health and wellness programs. We also provide our employees with the resources and opportunities they need to chart a career of achievement, growth and endless possibilities.
   

  

**We Offer:**
* Annual monetary bonus
* Employee Stock Purchase Program - Nasdaq stocks with a discount
* Unlimited access to e-learning platforms (Udemy Business, financial e-trainings, mentorship programs, and so on)
* Flex day program (up to 6 days a year)
* Additional benefits such as private medical insurance and sport activities
* Internal mentorship program – get a mentor or become one


**What happens now?**
 If you think you would thrive in this role, then we would love to hear from you! Follow the link to apply, and one of our team members be in touch.
   

  

 This is a
 **fixed term role until end of June 2026.** 
 The position located in Stockholm. As the selection and interview process is ongoing, please submit your application in
 **English** 
 as soon as possible.
   

  

 A valid working permit for the EU is mandatory.
   

  

**Come as You Are**
**Nasdaq is an equal opportunity employer. We positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of age, color, disability, national origin, ancestry, race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable law.**
**We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.**

title: Customer Service Representative Norwegian Speaker
description:
**Goodyear is hiring an experienced Customer Service Representative for Norway** 




**Location: Stockholm Office** 




 At Goodyear, our Customer Service team provides support to clients across Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Finland. As a Customer Service Representative, you will be part of a dedicated team working with retailers and car channel.
 



**Your responsibilities will include:** 



* Providing information, guidance, and product recommendations by phone, tailored to customer needs.
* Managing a variety of tasks such as handling orders, processing complaints, coordinating logistics, and supporting planning activities.
* Delivering professional customer support while solving problems efficiently and ensuring high levels of satisfaction.



 You will start your role with a comprehensive introduction program, designed to equip you with the knowledge and tools necessary to deliver outstanding service and exceed customer expectations.
 



**What we are looking for:** 



* Previous experience in customer service and a strong ability to manage phone-based customer interactions.
* Proficiency in Excel; knowledge of SAP is an advantage.
* Strong analytical and organizational skills.
* A proactive, flexible, and independent approach, with the ability to perform well under pressure.
* **Fluency in Norwegian Swedish and English, both spoken and written (required).**
* Knowledge of an additional Nordic language is considered a strong plus.



 If this role sounds like the right fit for you, don’t wait—submit your application today! We review applications and conduct interviews on an ongoing basis.
 



  





  





  





**Goodyear söker erfaren Kundtjänstmedarbetare för Norge** 




**Placering: Stockholmskontoret** 




 På Goodyear arbetar vår kundtjänstavdelning med att ge service och support till kunder i Sverige, Norge, Danmark, Finland. Som kundtjänstmedarbetare blir du en del av ett engagerat team som samarbetar med återförsäljare.
 



**Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer att omfatta:** 



* Att via telefon informera, vägleda och rekommendera Goodyears produkter utifrån kundernas behov.
* Att hantera varierande arbetsuppgifter som orderläggning, reklamationer, logistik, planering och annan problemlösning.
* Att ge professionell kundservice, lösa problem effektivt och säkerställa hög kundnöjdhet.



 Du inleder tjänsten med ett gediget introduktionsprogram som ger dig de bästa förutsättningarna att leverera service i toppklass och överträffa kundernas förväntningar.
 



**Vi söker dig som har:** 



* Tidigare erfarenhet av kundservice och vana att hantera kundkontakter via telefon.
* Goda kunskaper i Excel; erfarenhet av SAP är meriterande.
* En analytisk och strukturerad arbetförmåga.
* En energisk, flexibel och självständig personlighet, med förmåga att arbeta effektivt även under press.
* **Mycket goda kunskaper i norska, svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift (krav).**
* Kunskaper i ytterligare nordiskt språk är starkt meriterande.



 Låter detta som rätt tjänst för dig? Skicka gärna in din ansökan redan idag! Vi arbetar med löpande urval och intervjuer.
 



 För frågor om tjänsten, vänligen kontakta:
 



 Anne Öhlander, Customer Service Manager Nordic
 



 📧 anne\_ohlander@goodyear.com
 



  





  





 #LI-CD2
 



  





  





 Goodyear is one of the world's largest tire companies. It employs about 68,000 people and manufactures its products in 53 facilities in 20 countries around the world. Its two Innovation Centers in Akron, Ohio, and Colmar-Berg, Luxembourg, strive to develop state-of-the-art products and services that set the technology and performance standard for the industry. For more information about Goodyear and its products, go to www.goodyear.com/corporate.

title: AWS Public Sector Cloud Architect - Cloud Infrastructure
description:
**Description**
 The Amazon Web Services Professional Services (ProServe) team is seeking a skilled Delivery Consultant to join our team at Amazon Web Services (AWS). In this role, you'll work closely with customers to design, implement, and manage AWS solutions that meet their technical requirements and business objectives. You'll be a key player in driving customer success through their cloud journey, providing technical expertise and best practices throughout the project lifecycle.
   

  

 Possessing a deep understanding of AWS products and services, as a Delivery Consultant you will be proficient in architecting complex, scalable, and secure solutions tailored to meet the specific needs of each customer. You’ll work closely with stakeholders to gather requirements, assess current infrastructure, and propose effective migration strategies to AWS. As trusted advisors to our customers, providing guidance on industry trends, emerging technologies, and innovative solutions, you will be responsible for leading the implementation process, ensuring adherence to best practices, optimizing performance, and managing risks throughout the project.
   

  

 The AWS Professional Services organization is a global team of experts that help customers realize their desired business outcomes when using the AWS Cloud. We work together with customer teams and the AWS Partner Network (APN) to execute enterprise cloud computing initiatives. Our team provides assistance through a collection of offerings which help customers achieve specific outcomes related to enterprise cloud adoption. We also deliver focused guidance through our global specialty practices, which cover a variety of solutions, technologies, and industries.
   

  

**Eligibility Requirement**
* This role requires you to be a Swedish National and have business level proficiency in the Swedish language


 Key job responsibilities
   

  

* Designing and implementing complex, scalable, and secure AWS solutions tailored to customer needs
* Providing technical guidance and troubleshooting support throughout project delivery
* Collaborating with stakeholders to gather requirements and propose effective migration strategies
* Acting as a trusted advisor to customers on industry trends and emerging technologies
* Sharing knowledge within the organization through mentoring, training, and creating reusable artifacts


 A day in the life
   

  

 The AWS Professional Services organization is a global team of experts that help customers realize their desired business outcomes when using the AWS Cloud. We work together with customer teams and the AWS Partner Network (APN) to execute enterprise cloud computing initiatives. Our team provides assistance through a collection of offerings which help customers achieve specific outcomes related to enterprise cloud adoption. We also deliver focused guidance through our global specialty practices, which cover a variety of solutions, technologies, and industries.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* 5+ years of experience in hands-on cloud enterprise architecture design, storage and networking solutions
* 3+ years of experience in consulting and working with enterprise customers
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, related field, or equivalent experience
* 3+ years of experience in working with enterprise customers in building, migrating and modernizing enterprise applications
* 3+ years of experience with customer cloud transformation activities to ensure successful delivery of solutions


**Preferred Qualifications**
* AWS Professional level certifications (e.g., Solutions Architect Professional, DevOps Engineer Professional) preferred and experience with automation and scripting (e.g., Terraform, Python, CDK, shell, Ruby, Powershell)
* Knowledge of security and compliance standards (e.g., HIPAA, GDPR)
* Strong communication skills with the ability to explain technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences
* Experience with AWS services (e.g. AWS Application Migration Service (MGN), Cloud Migration Factory, Portfolio analysis tooling) and managing large scale data center to data center and/or data center to cloud migrations; data center operations (e.g. data assurance, monitoring, alerting and notifications)
* Experience integrating AWS AI/ML services (SageMaker, Bedrock, Amazon Q); understanding of AI/ML governance and responsible AI practices


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch) - G54
   

  

 Job ID: A3070745

title: Senior Specialist, Product Management – Emerging Payment Methods
description:
**Our Purpose**
*Mastercard powers economies and empowers people in 200+ countries and territories worldwide. Together with our customers, we’re helping build a sustainable economy where everyone can prosper. We support a wide range of digital payments choices, making transactions secure, simple, smart and accessible. Our technology and innovation, partnerships and networks combine to deliver a unique set of products and services that help people, businesses and governments realize their greatest potential.*
**Title And Summary**
 Senior Specialist, Product Management – Emerging Payment Methods
   

  

**Overview**
 The Senior Product Specialist will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of consumer core payments in Europe. This role focuses on emerging payment innovations, including Alternative Payment Methods (APMs), Stablecoins, and Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDCs). The ideal candidate will combine product execution skills with strategic curiosity, helping translate complex market dynamics into actionable product initiatives. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to define, build, and optimize next-generation payment solutions that meet evolving consumer needs.
   

  

**Role**
* Key Responsibilities
* Support the development and execution of product strategies for APMs, stablecoins, and CBDCs across European markets
* Collaborate with global and regional product teams to ensure alignment, scalability, and regulatory compliance
* Translate emerging trends and regulatory developments into product requirements and business opportunities
* Partner with internal stakeholders (e.g., Engineering, Compliance, Risk, Sales) and external entities (e.g., fintechs, financial institutions, regulators,) to drive product commercialization
* Monitor performance metrics and customer feedback to inform continuous product improvement


 Job Requirements
   

  

* Consolidate experience in product management, strategy, or fintech roles, ideally within payments or digital assets
* Solid understanding of the European payments landscape, including APMs, blockchain-based assets, and CBDCs
* Familiarity with relevant regulatory frameworks (e.g., PSD2, MiCA, ECB Digital Euro initiatives)
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to navigate ambiguity and complexity
* Experience working in cross-functional teams and agile environments
* Excellent communication and stakeholder engagement skills
* Fluent in English; additional European languages are a plus
* Willingness to travel across Europe as needed


**Corporate Security Responsibility**
 All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:
   

  

* Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
* Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
* Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
* Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.

title: Senior Global PV Compliance Manager & Deputy EU/UK QPPV
description:
Vantive is a vital organ therapy company on a mission to extend lives and expand possibilities for patients and care teams everywhere. For 70 years, our team has driven meaningful innovations in kidney care. As we build on our legacy, we are deepening our commitment to elevating the dialysis experience through digital solutions and advanced services, while looking beyond kidney care and investing in transforming vital organ therapies. Greater flexibility and efficiency in therapy administration for care teams, and longer, fuller lives for patients— that is what Vantive aspires to deliver.
   

  

 We believe Vantive will not only build our leadership in the kidney care space, it will also offer meaningful work to those who join us. At Vantive, you will become part of a community of people who are focused, courageous and don’t settle for the mediocre. Each of us is driven to help improve patients’ lives worldwide. Join us in advancing our mission to extend lives and expand possibilities.
   

  

**Your future role at Vantive**
 As
 **Senior Global PV Compliance Manager & Deputy EU/UK QPPV,** 
 you will be responsible for global PV Compliance, supporting the development and maintenance of GPS Quality Management System, with oversight of GPS training strategy. A crucial part of the position will be leading and facilitating GvP audit and inspection activities, as well as supporting management of GPS global PV agreements.
   

  

 Moreover, you will be serving as the Deputy Qualified Person for Pharmacovigilance for the European Union (EU QPPV) and UK QPPV working closely with the EU/UK QPPV.
   

  

 Reporting to the EU/UK QPPV and Head of Benefit Risk & Global PV Compliance, within the wider Global Patient Safety team, you will be managing a close team of experts based in the EU. Occasional international travel on an ad-hoc basis is to be expected.
   

  

 We are open to applicants from all EU countries.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
* Lead preparation and conduct of PV audits and inspections, ensuring that all stakeholders are properly trained in compliance and inspection readiness needs.
* Responsible for managing and facilitating audits and inspections, providing adequate CAPA handling of the observations available in audit reports.
* Accountable for the proper management of GPS QMS documents and has oversight responsibility for GPS Pharmacovigilance global processes.
* Manages the GPS training process.
* Supervises and manages the GPS global PV agreement process
* Acts as the contact person for the Competent Authorities for medical safety requests/questions. regarding a medicinal product licensed in the EU/UK in the absence of the QPPV. Together with QPPV acts as a single contact point for the Competent Authorities on a 24-hour basis.
* Overviews safety profiles, knowledge of any emerging safety concerns and any other information relating to evaluation of the risk-benefits of the medicinal products for which Vantive holds authorizations in the EU/UK.
* Maintaining access to a medical doctor for the assessment of medical emergencies, case evaluations, safety signal proportionality or benefit-risk assessments.
* Review and support PV benefit-risk content sections of drug therapeutic product labeling.


**What You’ll Bring**
* Bachelor´s degree minimum in a medical or scientific field, with proven experience in Global Pharmacovigilance, specifically compliance, working in a global-regional-local patient safety model where two-way direct communication has been required to ensure functional alignment globally.
* Excellent leadership and interpersonal skills demonstrated through successfully leading and driving PV audits and inspection processes, in particular Regulatory Authority Inspections (i.e EMA, MHRA, FDA, Chinese HA, PMDA and TGA).
* Successfully demonstrated people management experience as well as ability to motivate, lead and develop a multicultural team
* Outstanding analytical and problem-solving skills proven through experience with CAPA writing and handling of the audit report observations.
* Strong communication and presentation skills in English leading to effective communication with Health Authorities and Health Care Professionals
* Prior experience as deputy EU and UK QPPV is a plus.


**Reasonable Accommodation**
 Vantive is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities globally. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or interview process, please click on the link here and let us know the nature of your request along with your contact information. Form Link
   

  

**Recruitment Fraud Notice**
 Vantive has discovered incidents of employment scams, where fraudulent parties pose as Vantive employees, recruiters, or other agents, and engage with online job seekers in an attempt to steal personal and/or financial information. To learn how you can protect yourself, review our Recruitment Fraud Notice.

title: Master Thesis: Low power RTL design methodologies
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity:**
 The growing demand for energy-efficient digital systems — from smartphones to IoT edge devices — has pushed designers to rethink how hardware description languages are used in practice. This thesis explores low-power RTL design methodologies with a focus on power profiling and optimization techniques in VHDL and SystemVerilog.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Conduct a comparative study of RTL blocks written in both VHDL and SystemVerilog.
* Measure switching activity and energy consumption of different RTL blocks and environments.
* Apply optimization strategies such as clock gating, operand isolation, and coding style adjustments.
* Develop and present a practical framework demonstrating how RTL-level design choices affect power, performance, and efficiency in modern hardware systems.
* Gain hands-on experience with EDA tools for power estimation and analysis, strengthening skills in design and power management for future roles in semiconductor design and low-power systems.


**The skills you bring:**
* Currently pursuing a Master´s degree in Electrical/Computer Engineering, Embedded Systems, or similar.
* Knowledge of ASIC design and development through coursework.
* Proficiency in VHDL and SystemVerilog is required.


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 773613

title: Kubernetes/DevOps Engineer
description:
**Beskrivning av tjänsten** 




  





 Vår konsultorganisation behöver förstärka med fler duktiga DevOps-tekniker som är redo att ta sig an uppdrag för våra kunder.
 



 Vi söker dig som vill följa med på en spännande resa framåt och få möjligheten att växa med ett globalt företag som är marknadsledande inom den svenska IT-marknaden. Hos oss får du arbeta i spännande projekt och uppdrag, vi utlovar inspirerande arbetsuppgifter och utveckling.
 



 Du kommer vara en del av en konsultgrupp med olika specialiteter för att kunna ge våra kunder den bästa leveransen och bred service. Du kommer att få delta i spännande och stimulerande samarbeten med kollegor på CGI och medarbetare hos våra kunder.
 



  





**Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter** 




  





 I denna roll arbetar du som konsult för våra kunder som behöver din expertis inom DevOps Våra kunder är stora företag eller organisationer inom offentlig sekor. Arbetsuppgifterna är varierande, men sträcker sig från nyutveckling till förvaltning. Du förväntas arbeta både hands-on och praktiskt, men även med analys, planering och strategi.
 



 Arbetet kan utföras hos kund, på något av CGI´s kontor i Stockholm eller på distans från hemmet, det beror på kundens önskemål och krav. De flesta av våra konsulter har en hybridlösning, där man varierar.
 



  





**Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll** 




  





 För att lyckas i rollen söker vi dig som har en vilja att utvecklas och ta till dig nya kunskaper. Du ser möjligheter till lösningar hellre än problem. Vi ser gärna att du tycker om att samarbeta och att dela med dig av dina kunskaper men att du även har ett driv att själv utvecklas och växa både som individ och tillsammans med andra. Som konsult är det viktigt att man är flexibel och inte rädd för att möta och samarbeta med nya personer.
 



  





**Erfarenhet och kunskap** 




  




* Du har erfarenhet av DevOps antingen genom dina eftergymnasiala IT-utbildning alternativt har du förskaffat dig erfarenheten genom din arbetslivserfarenhet.
* Kubernetes och Docker
* AWS, Azure eller Google Cloud Plattform
* Linux
* CI/CD



  





 Vi kommer att lägga stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper där vi gärna ser att du är nyfiken, engagerad och har en kreativ problemlösningsförmåga, en positiv inställning samt trivs med att arbeta med stort kundfokus. Du behärskar både svenska och engelska flytande, både i tal och skrift
 



 Vill du veta mer?
 



  





 Har du frågor om jobbet kontakta rekryterande ledare Marcus Gridange, marcus.grindange@cgi.com. Vi tillämpar löpande urval skicka därför in din ansökan så snart som möjligt.
 



  





**Som anställd erbjuds du nedan förmåner:** 




  




* Föräldralön: Vi betalar upp till cirka 90% av din lön under den första tiden hemma.
* Aktieprogram och delägarskap: Som delägare har du möjlighet att påverka och i vårt aktieprogram matchar CGI ditt bidrag, krona för krona upp till 3% av din månadslön.
* Friskvårdsbidrag: Vi erbjuder ett årligt friskvårdsbidrag på 4 000 kr.
* Trygg anställning: Våra medlemmar anställs med kollektivavtal och försäkringar.
* Pensionslösningar: Vi erbjuder attraktiva och förmånliga pensionslösningar.
* Personalbil: Personalbilen används som en privatbil men leasas av CGI.



  





**Övrigt** 




  





 Bakgrundskontroller och registerkontroll kan komma att genomföras om uppdraget kräver det.
 



 Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.
 



 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
 



 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
 



  





 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
 



 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
 



 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Underwriter Cyber
description:
**Job Description**
**JOB DESCRIPTION**
 Chubb is a world leader in insurance. With operations in 54 countries and territories, Chubb provides commercial and personal property and casualty insurance, personal accident and supplemental health insurance, reinsurance and life insurance to a diverse group of clients. As an underwriting company, we assess, assume and manage risk with insight and discipline. We service and pay our claims fairly and promptly. The company is also defined by its extensive product and service offerings, broad distribution capabilities, exceptional financial strength and local operations globally. Parent company Chubb Limited is listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE: CB) and is a component of the S&P 500 index. Chubb maintains executive offices in Zurich, New York, London, Paris and other locations, and employs approximately 40,000 people worldwide. Additional information can be found at: www.chubb.com .
   

  

*In the Nordics we are an organization of 140 employees.*
**Purpose Of The Role**
 Chubb is growing and we are looking for a passionate Cyber Underwriter to join our team in the Nordics. In the role as Underwriter, you will focus specifically on Cyber risks.
   

  

 Are you ready for the next step in your career and would you prefer to take it in a fun and professional team at an international, renowned insurer? Then you are in the right place.
   

  

 This exciting role can suit an Underwriter who is hungry, motivated, inquisitive and in need of a new challenge. We will consider a similar minded hardworking person who feels ready to take the next step in the career.
   

  

 We require someone to develop and assist in underwriting Contractors All Risks and Power Generation risks associated with Natural Resources. Maintaining and building relationships with our Nordic brokers community with an ambition to write additional new business, which will be key to the success of this role, as well as growing the existing portfolio in line with our agreed growth targets, pricing, and retention budget.
   

  

 You make an impact and strengthen our market position by:
   

  

* Building and maintaining good relationships with brokers.
* Promoting our capabilities and building of a profitable Cyber portfolio.
* Strong commercial drive, always looking for new opportunities and value service and quality.
* Ensuring quality control by means of including underwriting and peer reviews.
* Representing and promoting Chubb to brokers and clients.
* Delivering strong service to brokers and clients, responding to cross-sell and new business opportunities and monitoring retention.
* Meeting the portfolio product line objectives for each underwriting year.


**Qualifications**
**QUALIFICATIONS**
* Fundamental understanding of and experience from underwriting processes preferably within cyber, the insurance market, and competitors.
* A strong commercial drive and very customer-oriented approach.
* Experience from client servicing preferably from the insurance industry.
* Demonstrated skills in building and maintaining client relationships preferably from the insurance industry.
* Results driven, disciplined and ambitious with ability to work on own initiative.
* Good communicator and fluent in Swedish and high level of English written as well as spoken.


**Why You Want To Work At Chubb**
* We offer a high-performance work environment in which appreciation and inclusiveness are of paramount importance.
* As an underwriter at Chubb, no two days are the same. You interact with various stakeholders and actively pursue opportunities. Where you do that? From our office in Stockholm, on location during meetings with clients/brokers or from your home office.
* At Chubb, the customer experience is key. With us, insurance is not a static product, but is continuously adapted to the needs of the market.
* As a Chubb employee, you are part of the world's largest publicly traded property and casualty insurance company, providing solutions to businesses of all sizes.
* At Chubb, we operate on the basis of trust. You have a high degree of autonomy, flexibility and also access to a multitude of training and development opportunities.


 If you have any questions, please feel free to contact
 **Anna Källs,** 
 Country Manager Sweden. No agencies please. anna.källs@chubb.com
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Tender Manager – Infrastructure
description:
**Työpaikan kuvaus**
 Do you have a business-oriented mindset and passion for driving tendering projects? Do you have the experience of managing large- and medium sized opportunities and leading tender teams? Do you know the Swedish infrastructure market and its key players?
   

  

 We are looking for a tender manager to drive key proposals in a professional, structured, and efficient manner, primarily within our infrastructure portfolio. You will be part of a central team within Ramboll in Sweden working with our prioritised opportunities.
   

  

 If this sounds like you, or you’re curious to learn more, then this role could be the perfect opportunity. Join our Client & Sales team as our new Tender Manager and work with us to close the gap to a sustainable future.
   

  

**Your new role**
 As Tender Manager, you will be responsible for the preparation, development and submission of pre-qualifications and tender proposals in close cooperation with different subject matter experts and client managers in our organisation.
   

  

**Your key responsibilities will be:**
* Responsible for leading tender processes for medium- and large opportunities
* Responsible for facilitating the process through decision gates and ensuring a high quality of proposals with attractive wording and design, submitted in a timely manner
* Ensures that the proposal and process for preparing it complies with Ramboll’s internal processes
* Communicates and collaborates with tender team and other involved stakeholders (legal, finance etc)
* Responsible for high quality in proposal presentations and hand over to project manager
* Drive proposal consistency and learnings across tenders
* Fluent in speaking and writing in Swedish and English


**About You**
* Bachelor’s Degree, or equivalent, in related field or applicable disciplines (e.g., Business Administration, Business Communication, Engineering), or equivalent relevant experience
* Relevant experience in proposal or tender management
* Experienced team player with strong project management skills who is comfortable to work independently with minimal supervision
* Customer-focused approach as well as solution-oriented and structured way of working
* Familiar with public / private procurement processes and with commercial, contractual and execution models
* Knowledge of the infrastructure market in Sweden and curios about learning more about our different clients and client types
* Experience in tools as PowerPoint and InDesign (an advantage)
* Experience in leading virtual teams


**What We Can Offer You**
* Flexible work environment
* Commitment to your development
* Leaders guided by our Leadership Principles
* A culture that welcomes you as the unique person you are
* Inspiration from colleagues, clients, and projects
* The long-term thinking of a foundation-owned company


**Ready to join us?**
 Please submit your application with your up-to-date CV. We invite diversity in all its forms and encourage applicants from all groups to apply.
   

  

 Thank you for taking the time to apply! We look forward to receiving your application.
   

  

**Work at the heart of sustainable change with Ramboll in Sweden**
 Ramboll is a global architecture, engineering, and consultancy company. As a foundation-owned people company, founded in Denmark, we believe that the purpose of sustainable change is to create a thriving world for both nature and people. So, that’s where we start – and how we work. Our history is rooted in a clear vision of how a responsible company should act and being open and curious is a cornerstone of our culture. Ramboll in Sweden has about 2,000 employees across 30 offices. Ramboll experts deliver innovative solutions across Buildings, Transport, Energy, Water, Environment & Health, Landscape & Architecture, and Management Consulting.
   

  

**Equality, Diversity, and Inclusion**
 Equality, diversity, and inclusion are at the heart of what we do. At Ramboll, we believe that diversity is a strength and that different experiences and perspectives are essential to creating truly sustainable societies. We are committed to providing an inclusive and supportive work environment where everyone is able to flourish and reach their potential. We also know how important it is to achieve the right balance of where, when, and how much you work. At Ramboll, we offer flexibility as part of our positive and inclusive approach to work. We invite applications from candidates of all backgrounds and characteristics. Please let us know if there are any changes, we could make to the application process to make it more comfortable for you. You can contact us at job.advert.accessibility@ramboll.com with such requests.

title: Chief Financial Officer to Kronans Apotek
description:
We are looking for a hands-on and forward-thinking CFO to join our management team. This key role is focused on ensuring that the company’s financial operations run efficiently and reliably, while supporting the business with accurate reporting, robust processes, and a high-performing finance team. The ideal candidate thrives in operational work and is eager to make a real impact across the entire business.
   

  

 As CFO, you’ll collaborate closely with all departments and play a central role in driving our growth. You will be expected to maintain a deep understanding of the company’s finances and take a hands-on role in daily operations, including accounting, audits, financial controlling, budgeting, forecasting, and cash flow management. You will ensure accurate and timely financial reporting while supporting decision-making with detailed analysis.
   

  

 The role also includes building and developing the finance team, implementing robust processes and controls, and leading change initiatives, including transformation projects.
   

  

 This position is ideal for a professional who thrives on operational excellence, enjoys working closely with their team, and is committed to making a tangible impact on the organization’s financial performance and stability.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Lead and develop financial work together with the management team
* Report to and have close dialog with owners and management, regarding financial performance and insights
* Oversee and continuously improve financial processes, routines, and controls
* Drive the budgeting process, financial forecasting, and follow-up
* Manage accounting, payments, and audits
* Conduct financial analyses to support data-driven decision making
* Oversee procurement and cash flow management
* Maintain relationships with banks, auditors, and authorities
* Manage treasury operations and ensure sound financial risk management


 We offer a permanent position. Desired start date to be agreed upon. You will report to our CEO and be welcomed to our office in Stadshagen, Kungsholmen.
   

  

**Your profile**
 Our ideal candidate is a strong leader who will serve as a role model, consistently demonstrating Kronans Apotek’s values and policies. This is a key role within our organization, so we are seeking a CFO who is visible, engaged, and actively involved throughout the company, with a genuine understanding of all its parts. To ensure we remain relevant and forward-looking, it is important that you are attuned to external trends and changes that may impact the business.
   

  

 We are looking for someone who is proactive, hands-on, and results-driven, yet able to see the bigger picture and connect financial performance with priorities. You thrive in dynamic, complex organizations, and are ready to lead your team, build robust processes, and manage change initiatives, while fostering collaboration across the company.
   

  

**To succeed in this role, you should have:**
* Several years of finance experience in larger and dynamic organizations, with a proven track record as a leader, managing multiple stakeholders, and fostering collaboration.
* Proven experience managing finance in high-volume, customer-focused businesses, ideally in retail or similar sectors.
* Hands-on operational finance experience, including accounting, audits, financial controlling, cash flow, and day-to-day financial operations
* Experience building and developing finance teams, implementing process and controls, and leading change initiative and transformation projects.
* Experience with joint ventures is an advantage.
* A collaborative and engaging leadership style, with a focus on team development and effective cross-functional cooperation ensuring efficiency and compliance.
* Fluent in both English and Swedish.


**Our Recruitment Process**
 We’re excited that you’re considering a role with us! We know job searching can be challenging, especially when competition is high. To ensure a fair and transparent process, we assess each application holistically. We look at your CV, your answers to our screening questions, and, if applicable, your results from personality and logic assessments. These help us understand how well your profile matches the role and the current needs of our team.
   

  

**Your Application**
 Please submit your CV along with detailed answers to the screening questions. If your profile matches our criteria, you’ll be invited to complete two assessments: one for personality and one for logical reasoning.
   

  

 For final candidates, we conduct a background check before making an offer. We’ll share more details about this step later in the process.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!
   

  

*Kärnan inom Kronans Apotek handlar om att vi ska må bra tillsammans. När vi har meningsfulla uppgifter, omfamnar varandras olikheter och delar många skrattar kan vi göra stor skillnad tillsammans. Strävan om att må bra är något vi delar med våra fackliga parter och tillsammans arbetar vi för en värld som mår bra. För att komma i kontakt med facklig representant Gunilla Andersson, maila gunilla.andersson@kronansapotek.se alternativt Verdi Sawma, maila Verdi.Sawma@kronansapotek.se samt facklig representant Aisha Karimi från Sveriges Farmaceuter, maila af.kronan@sverigesfarmaceuter.se.*

title: Senior Software Engineer - Play & Control
description:
**About Us**
 Soundtrack is a B2B scale-up company providing music streaming services for businesses. We serve small customers like the café around the corner, and much bigger brands like Joe & the Juice, Toni & Guy and TAG Heuer. On the inside, we're a bunch of talented, motivated and humble designers, engineers and music experts. We believe in product-led growth, where the product is the primary driver of customer acquisition, conversion and expansion.
   

  

**The Role**
 We are looking for an experienced backend engineer with a strong background in functional programming, for our Play & Control team.
   

  

 You will play a key part in evolving and deploying our next-generation playback system, the backbone that ensures music plays seamlessly across platforms, devices, and integrations.
   

  

 The team owns the playback experience across all of our platforms. We make the music flow, from the cloud to speakers, through our apps and partner integrations. Our technology powers playback for mobile and desktop clients, our own hardware, and various connected devices through SDKs and APIs. Everyone in the team works across the stack, to ensure a smooth and stable music experience everywhere.
   

  

 You will be joining at an exciting time, our new playback architecture is being rolled out, and you’ll play a central role in shaping how it operates across all platforms.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 In this role, you will:
   

  

* Design, build, and refine backend services that power music playback across diverse clients and environments
* Contribute to the rollout of our next-generation playback control architecture
* Collaborate with our partners (e.g., Sonos and other integrations)
* Develop our cloud-based audio streaming platform
* Ensure scalability, reliability, and performance in a distributed environment
* Influence a technical direction for systems written in Scala, Go, Rust, and C++


**About You**
 Just like us, you love music. You're driven and entrepreneurial, but you know how to be a team player too. Regardless of roles, we're always looking to work with people who can adapt to constant change, prioritise what's important, stay humble, open, curious and with a passion for details.
   

  

**Requirements**
* 5+ year of professional experience
* Solid experience with functional programming principles (preferably with Scala)
* Ability to design and implement scalable, cloud-native applications
* Professional experience with one or more of the following: Scala, Go, Rust, C++
* Experience deploying and managing applications in Kubernetes (preferably on Google Cloud, but not the main focus)
* A minset to care about deployment, monitoring, and operational stability of your services


**Beneficial**
* Experience in audio streaming, IoT, or hardware-integrated products
* Interest in music technology and playback systems


**Employee Benefits**
* We offer a flexible workplace with the possibility to work remotely
* Generous pension plan
* Yearly budget for health, wellness and personal development
* Laptop and mobile phone of your choice with included cellular subscription
* Regular social activities such as team events, meet ups, after works and off-sites
* Daily breakfast served at the office


 At Soundtrack, we believe that diversity fuels creativity and innovation. We're committed to building a team that reflects a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences. We welcome applications from individuals of all races, ethnicities, genders, ages, abilities, religions, sexual orientations, and identities.
   

  

 We reserve the right to close this vacancy early if we identify a suitable candidate before the application deadline. To ensure consideration, we encourage you to submit your application as soon as possible.
   

  

 If you have any questions about the position or need to reach out, get in touch with Oskar Thorin at oskar@soundtrack.io. Please note that we only accept applications submitted via our career page and do not accept applications by e-mail.

title: Service Maintenance Marketing Manager
description:
**Elekta - Hope for everyone dealing with cancer** 

 In our world, billions of people, millions of cancers diagnosed each year. For everyone, it’s personal. Behind every treatment lies a story, a family, a future.
   

  

 Behind every patient, clinic, and care provider, are real complexities, real needs, and a united purpose. We’re not intimidated, we’re inspired, because every difference – from the smallest tumor change to the greatest clinical challenge is a chance to innovate together and advance care. That’s why we’re here. With you. To set the new standard of care, making a meaningful impact on lives, for a world of difference.
   

  

**Provide exceptional service and seamless execution across the customer journey**
 Step into a role where your work directly enhances patient care and clinical excellence. At Elekta, our Services team is driving value in radiation oncology through Elekta Care— the most comprehensive and data-driven service offering in radiation oncology delivered in a personal way. From proactive maintenance and lifecycle upgrades to expert implementation and peer-to-peer training. Elekta Care ensures minimized clinical downtime and maximized patient throughput. Join us and be part of a team that empowers healthcare providers with the tools, support, and insights they need to deliver life-changing treatments.
   

  

**We're looking for a Service Maintenance Marketing Manager** 
 to lead the global marketing strategy for our maintenance service portfolio - including our flagship Elekta Care Service Agreements. This role is not just about managing services—it’s about transforming how we deliver value to our customers at every stage of their journey.
   

  

**What you’ll do at Elekta** 

 This role is responsible for designing and executing marketing strategies that drive customer engagement, satisfaction, and revenue across the maintenance service portfolio. It blends strategic product marketing with operational excellence, ensuring the maintenance portfolio is positioned for success. Acting as a bridge between product/service development and market adoption, the Service Maintenance Marketing Manager ensures every stage of the customer journey—from onboarding to renewal—is optimized for value delivery, customer retention, and business growth.
   

  

 Your role will include (but not limited to):
   

  

**New Service Introductions:**
* Conduct market research and trend analysis to inform strategic decisions on new maintenance service concepts.
* Identify and develop offerings that drive business growth and deliver customer value, including business case creation, opportunity assessment, and customer needs evaluation.
* Lead go-to-market planning, execution, and strategy for new service introductions, including global launch plan, messaging, and sales enablement.


**Maintenance Service Portfolio:**
* Define a compelling vision for the global maintenance service portfolio.
* Oversee all entitlements (e.g., uptime, spare parts, support, remote) that are included in the maintenance offering—from launch to renewal and retention—ensuring consistent value delivery.
* Manage positioning and pricing strategies, adapting to diverse markets and customer segments.
