 Den här rekryteringen hanteras av
 **Graftus** 
 , Sveriges största plattform för säljrekrytering.

title: Working Student (f/m/d) Enterprise Sales, Nordics - Fully Remote
description:
**Deine Aufgaben**
**Your Role**
 This is an ideal role for
 **students with experience in B2B within the Nordics market** 
 (or comparable regions such as the Netherlands, UK, or Switzerland). As a working student in our Enterprise Sales team, you will support our Sales team by identifying and engaging with new customer leads in the
 **Nordic markets (Sweden, Norway, Denmark, and Finland)** 
 – from initial research to first outreach.
   

  

 Your tasks will include:
   

  

* Identifying potential target companies and decision-makers (data research)
* Outreach via email, LinkedIn, and phone (including cold calling and follow-ups)
* Maintaining and updating our CRM system
* Supporting the development of additional lead generation channels (e.g., events, social selling)
* Collaborating closely with our Enterprise Sales team to continuously improve processes


**Dein Profil**
**Your Profile**
* You are currently enrolled in a university program (ideally in business, communications, or a related field)
* You have initial experience with Nordic business culture or are familiar with the local market
* You are communicative, outgoing, and bring a positive presence to the table
* You have excellent English skills (C1–C2)
* You’re interested in B2B sales, startups, and digital solutions
* You work in a structured, independent, and reliable way
* Local language skills (e.g., Swedish, Norwegian, Danish, or Finnish) are a plus
* You are able to work remotely in a quiet environment with a stable internet connection
* You are based in the Nordics, Germany, or a European time zone country


**Warum wir?**
**Why Join Us?**
* First-hand experience in B2B Enterprise SaaS sales – with real clients and responsibilities
* 100% remote work – from home or on the road
* Regular team offsites and workations (e.g. Lisbon)
* A motivated, fun, and collaborative team with flat hierarchies and room to grow


**Apply now**
 If this sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you. Apply directly here or reach out to us via LinkedIn.
   

  

**Über uns**
 Unser Unternehmen wurde 2019 von einem Team bei Axel Springer gegründet, um das Vorstandsbüro zu digitalisieren, später entwickelte sich hieraus eine eigene Firma, die nun von einem erfahrenen Gründerteam mit extensiver Erfahrung geführt wird. Mit unserer Enterprise Software erreichen wir derzeit bereits viele namhafte Unternehmen, sogar über 10% der DAX-Unternehmen setzen bereits auf unsere Lösung. Unser Unternehmen ist schnell-wachsend und bietet ständig neue Herausforderungen und damit auch die Möglichkeit, schnell viel Erfahrung in bestimmten Bereichen zu sammeln.

title: Director, Strategic Engagements – EMEA North
description:
**Company Description**
 It all started in sunny San Diego, California in 2004 when a visionary engineer, Fred Luddy, saw the potential to transform how we work. Fast forward to today — ServiceNow stands as a global market leader, bringing innovative AI-enhanced technology to over 8,100 customers, including 85% of the Fortune 500®. Our intelligent cloud-based platform seamlessly connects people, systems, and processes to empower organizations to find smarter, faster, and better ways to work. But this is just the beginning of our journey. Join us as we pursue our purpose to make the world work better for everyone.
   

  

**Job Description**
**Director, Strategic Engagements – EMEA North**
*Reporting to the GVP, EMEA North*
 The
 **Director of Strategic Engagements** 
 plays a pivotal role in designing and executing the
 **EMEA North Customer Engagement Program** 
 . As a key member of the GVP’s office, you will lead the orchestration of high-impact executive engagements, ensuring every interaction with our top 50 enterprise customers is strategic, insightful, and flawlessly executed.
   

  

****Key Responsibilities:****
* Executive Engagement Leadership: Drive and manage all executive-level engagements across the top 50 enterprise accounts in EMEA North, including meetings with CEOs, CIOs, CDOs, and other C-suite stakeholders.
* Governance Cadence: Establish and maintain a structured cadence of executive governance for strategic customers, ensuring consistent and value-driven interactions.
* Meeting Preparation & Delivery: Own the end-to-end process for C-suite meetings—developing agendas, crafting business propositions, conducting customer business analysis, creating content, and driving execution of outcomes.
* Customer Intimacy & Strategic Partnership: Deepen relationships with key C-suite personas, positioning ServiceNow as a strategic partner and contributing to the region’s growth strategy.
* Cross-Functional Orchestration: Act as a connector across functions, aligning internal stakeholders to deliver best-in-class customer experiences.
* Action Tracking & Follow-Up: Capture key takeaways, assign and track action items, and ensure timely follow-up and resolution.
* Executive Sponsorship & Deal Championing: Ensure strong executive sponsorship and advocacy for strategic accounts, supporting deal progression and governance.
* Meeting Optimization: Collaborate with sales teams to enhance C-suite meeting effectiveness—ensuring timely briefing materials, clear follow-ups, and accountability for commitments.
* Leadership Representation: Represent or deputize for the GVP in executive meetings as needed.
* Deal Coaching & QBR Participation: Contribute to big deal reviews and quarterly business reviews (QBRs), providing insights and coaching aligned with customer agendas.
* Presentation Development: Prepare executive briefs and presentation materials for the GVP and yourself, tailored to each customer engagement.
* Stakeholder Collaboration: Work closely with big deal leaders and country managers to align on strategic priorities and customer engagement plans.


**Qualifications**
**Key Deliverables:**
* Volume and quality of C-suite engagements.
* Impactful meeting outcomes and contribution to deal acceleration.
* Strengthened strategic relationships and customer satisfaction.


****Qualifications:****
* 15–20 years of experience in sales or customer-facing leadership roles, with a strong track record of driving strategic deals.
* Exceptional organizational and prioritization skills, with the ability to manage short- and mid-term objectives.
* Meticulous attention to detail and a passion for excellence.
* Strong leadership and influencing capabilities across diverse stakeholder groups.
* Proven ability to foster collaboration, resolve conflicts, and drive cross-functional alignment.
* Customer-centric mindset with a problem-solving orientation.
* Strategic thinker with sharp business judgment and the ability to see the big picture.
* Executive presence with outstanding verbal and written communication skills (native or professional-level English).
* Comfortable navigating ambiguity and change in a fast-paced environment.
* High energy, strong work ethic, and disciplined execution.
* Passionate about process improvement and operational efficiency.
* Travel up to 30% of the time


 Additional Information
   

  

**Work Personas**
 We approach our distributed world of work with flexibility and trust. Work personas (flexible, remote, or required in office) are categories that are assigned to ServiceNow employees depending on the nature of their work and their assigned work location. Learn more here. To determine eligibility for a work persona, ServiceNow may confirm the distance between your primary residence and the closest ServiceNow office using a third-party service.
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 ServiceNow is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status, or any other category protected by law. In addition, all qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with legal requirements.
   

  

**Accommodations**
 We strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are unable to use this online application and need an alternative method to apply, please contact globaltalentss@servicenow.com for assistance.
   

  

**Export Control Regulations**
 For positions requiring access to controlled technology subject to export control regulations, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may be required to obtain export control approval from government authorities for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by relevant export control authorities.
   

  

 From Fortune. ©2025 Fortune Media IP Limited. All rights reserved. Used under license.

title: Machine Learning Engineer - Forecasting
description:
Do you want to be part of facilitating the green transition? Do you thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment where your actions drive meaningful change? Do you enjoy solving hard problems together with ambitious people? If this sounds like you, this could be a perfect match.
 



  





**Join us to facilitate the green transition** 




 Ingrid Capacity was born out of necessity. The old energy system is broken, and we’re here to rewrite the rules. We are a pioneering energy tech company on a mission to shape the future of energy by advancing power grid flexibility and optimization. By using the latest technologies in energy infrastructure and software development, we are building an intelligent, resilient, and sustainable energy system designed for the future.
 



  





**What we do** 




 We develop, own, and optimize grid-scale battery energy storage and flexible assets across Europe. Using advanced grid analytics, we strategically position our assets where they can support the electricity grid the most. With AI and data algorithmic solutions, combined with large-scale energy storage, we enable a faster and safer integration of renewable energy while eliminating grid challenges.
 



  





 Since our founding in early 2022, we have emerged as the Nordic leader in enhancing energy system flexibility. We are currently driving an unprecedented expansion, deploying 400 MW of energy storage capacity across 20+ sites in Sweden by 2025 and building innovative software solutions that enhances grid flexibility. At the same time, we are leading our expansion across Europe, starting with Finland, Germany and other key European regions.
 



  





**About the role** 




 In this role, you will play a key part in a variety of modeling and software development projects focused on forecasting. Forecasting models are central to our trading operations, providing essential inputs for our optimization algorithms. By improving the accuracy and performance of these models, you will directly enhance trading decisions, increase flexibility for grid operators, and contribute to measurable business outcomes – making your work highly valuable to the organization.
 



  





**Key tasks and responsibilities** 



* **Model Development:** 
 Design, build, test, and deploy advanced forecasting models to predict critical variables like prices and power system conditions.
* **Collaboration** 
 : Collaborate with data engineers and domain experts to ensure reliable data pipelines and robust model performance.
* **Monitoring:** 
 Track and refine forecasting algorithms to adapt to changing market conditions and improve accuracy over time.
* **Insight** 
 Generation: Translate complex model outputs into actionable insights for trading, operations, and strategy teams.
* **System Integration:** 
 Integrate forecasting modules into larger optimization and trading systems, ensuring seamless data flow and decision support.



  





**Who you are** 



* **Theoretical Skills** 
 : Knowledge of machine learning, statistics, optimization and experience working with modeling. Experience working with advanced forecasting techniques, ideally within energy.
* **Practical Skills:** 
 Experience in software engineering, Python, machine learning libraries (e.g. PyTorch), cloud computing (GCP with Vertex AI is a bonus!), containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes), and CI/CD pipelines.
* **Results-Oriented Mindset:** 
 Takes ownership, makes sound decisions, and enjoys seeing projects through to completion.
* **Collaborative:** 
 We value individuals who thrive in a collaborative environment.
* **Learning Agility:** 
 Stays up to date with evolving ML technologies and embraces new methods and tools.



  





 A degree in applied mathematics, physics, computer science, or a related field is a plus, but not mandatory for highly experienced candidates. We are more interested in your passion, skills, and drive to make a difference!
 



  





**What we offer** 




 At Ingrid Capacity, we are not just employees; we are pioneers, visionaries, and catalysts for change. We are at the forefront of the global energy transition, dedicated to shaping the future of power generation. Our company is more than a workplace; it is a platform for innovation, where we dare to push boundaries and turn bold ideas into reality.
 



  





 We firmly believe that the foundation of any successful company lies in its culture. At Ingrid Capacity, we understand that building a thriving organization demands more than just technology and innovation; it requires a company culture firmly rooted in trust, growth, and the ability to learn from mistakes. We believe that skills can be nurtured in a variety of contexts, starting from within oneself and growing together with people we trust. We are also serious about the wellbeing of our colleagues and having fun together, and with regularly hosted social activities and group training classes, we create a workplace where we can truly thrive.
 



  





**Application** 




 Sounds like a match? Welcome to apply! We’ll make selections on an ongoing basis and finalize the recruitment as soon as we’ve found the perfect match. Having said that, please don’t wait to submit your application.
 



  





 We look forward to hearing from you!
 



 /Team Ingrid Capacity

title: Senior Enterprise Account Executive, Growth
description:
MongoDB’s mission is to empower innovators to create, transform, and disrupt industries by unleashing the power of software and data. We enable organizations of all sizes to easily build, scale, and run modern applications by helping them modernize legacy workloads, embrace innovation, and unleash AI. Our industry-leading developer data platform, MongoDB Atlas, is the only globally distributed, multi-cloud database and is available in more than 115 regions across AWS, Google Cloud, and Microsoft Azure. Atlas allows customers to build anywhere—on the edge, on premises, or across cloud providers. With offices worldwide and over 175,000 developers joining MongoDB every month, it’s no wonder that leading organizations, like Samsung and Toyota, trust MongoDB to build next-generation, AI-powered applications.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We’re looking for a hardworking, driven individual with superb energy, passion and initiative for new business acquisition. The Account Executive role focuses exclusively on formulating and executing a sales strategy within an assigned territory, resulting in revenue growth and new customer acquisition.
   

  

 We are looking to speak to candidates who are based in Stockholm for our hybrid working model.
   

  

**About The Sales Culture**
 MongoDB is always developing and innovating — not only in our technology, but also in our sales go-to-market strategy. Our sales leadership is committed to building the best salesforce in technology. This means, inspiring and enabling success for everyone on the team. We not only equip you to be successful and close deals, but we want your feedback and input on how we can continue to “Think Big and Go Far.” As a crucial part of the Sales team at MongoDB, you will have access to a lucrative market and learn how to sell from some of the most successful sales leaders in the software industry.
   

  

 What you will be doing
   

  

* Proactively, identify, qualify and close a sales pipeline
* Strategically prospect into CTOs, Engineering/IT Leaders, & technical end users
* Build strong and effective relationships, resulting in growth opportunities
* Partner with our Solution Architects and work closely with the Professional Services team to achieve customer satisfaction
* Work closely with the enterprise ecosystem partner sales and channel partner to maximize deal sizes


 What you will bring to the table
   

  

* 4+ years field experience of quota-carrying experience in a fast-paced and competitive market
* Demonstrated ability to open new accounts and run a complex sales process
* A proven track record of overachievement and hitting sales targets
* Ability to articulate the business value of complex enterprise technology
* Skilled in building business champions
* Driven and competitive. Possess a strong desire to be successful


 Things we love
   

  

* Passionate about growing your career in the largest market in software (database)
* Previous Sales Methodology training (e.g. MEDDIC, SPIN, Challenger Sales)
* Familiarity with databases, develops and open source technology a plus


 Why join now
   

  

* Accelerators up to 30%
* Best in breed Sales trainings in MEDDIC and Command of the Message, including our comprehensive Sales Bootcamps and development programs
* New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan
* Generous and competitive benefits (parental leave, fertility & wellbeing support)


 To drive the personal growth and business impact of our employees, we’re committed to developing a supportive and enriching culture for everyone. From employee affinity groups, to fertility assistance and a generous parental leave policy, we value our employees’ wellbeing and want to support them along every step of their professional and personal journeys. Learn more about what it’s like to work at MongoDB, and help us make an impact on the world!
   

  

 MongoDB is committed to providing any necessary accommodations for individuals with disabilities within our application and interview process. To request an accommodation due to a disability, please inform your recruiter.
   

  

 MongoDB is an equal opportunities employer.
   

  

 Req ID: 425108

title: Sr. Account Manager, Startups, AGS Europe North
description:
**Description**
 AWS is looking for a new team member who is passionate about enabling and developing high growth, mid to late-stage technology startups. You will be at the heart of latest technology trends like web3, artificial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML), serverless or Internet-of-Things (IoT) to help your startups grow. Your startup customers leverage AWS to innovate and become the next unicorns and future enterprises, like today’s AirBnB, Slack, TooGoodToGo, and Lyft.
   

  

 In this role, you will be responsible for driving and growing revenue across the Europe North region, focusing on Nordics, Baltics and Benelux markets. You will establish AWS as the key cloud technology provider and enable your customers to grow their business through leveraging AWS in and beyond technology. You are able to build trust, develop executive relationships and create comprehensive account plans to drive AWS adoption. You understand the importance of communicating and acting on all levels from CxOs to engineers to empower them to innovate and accelerate time-to-market. Along the way, starting from the customer, you team up with various internal and external stakeholders to meet and exceed your goals, such as the Solutions Architecture, Business Development, Partner, Training, and Support teams. You are passionate about startups, a self-starter who is prepared to work in a fast-paced, often ambiguous environment, execute against ambitious goals, and consistently embrace the Amazon Culture.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

* Drive business growth and AWS adoption with a defined set of customers
* Create and execute against comprehensive, customer-centric account plans to meet or exceed your goals
* Facilitate long-term relationships from C-level to engineers
* Accelerate your business by working with internal stakeholders and leveraging external partners
* Articulate compelling value propositions around AWS services and Amazon
* Represent AWS at conferences & marketing events
* Expect moderate travel


**Basic Qualifications**
* Proven multi-year experience in technology related sales, business development or consulting experience
* Strong sales track record in customer acquisition roles
* Good understanding of the Northern European startup ecosystem, the main stakeholders and trends
* BA/BS degree


**Preferred Qualifications**
* MBA/MA/MS degree
* Experience in driving adoption of new technologies and solutions
* Worked at/with tech startups in the past
* Previous Cloud expertise at a technology company
* Prior experience of working abroad/internationally


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)
   

  

 Job ID: A3083959

title: Senior Web Developer
description:
At Umain, we're not just creating software; we're crafting the future, one innovative project at a time. With our motto "Shape, Ship, Scale," we empower our team to not only envision the future but also play a pivotal role in building it. We're a dynamic team where you can shape the future, ship groundbreaking solutions, and scale your abilities in many different ways.
   

  

 We're on the lookout for senior developers ready to join us in this journey, bringing passion, creativity, and dedication along with them. The role is relatively broad and focused on web technologies, where we offer the opportunity to work on many interesting projects on modern web stack technologies.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* A chance to work on unique projects that explore and push the boundaries of what's possible.
* A fun and fair work environment where your you have the opportunity to expand your skills through unique challenges and fantastic colleagues.
* A personal coach, and a setting where you can grow professionally and personally.
* Being part of multidisciplinary teams, participating in agile teams, being an important player in a highly ambitious setting.


 As a Senior Web Developer at Umain, your role will involve:
   

  

* Use modern frontend frameworks such as NextJS, Svelte, or Flutter to create amazing digital experiences.
* Engaging with backend languages and frameworks like Go, Rust, or Kotlin to craft scalable integration middle layers.
* Working with contemporary SaaS headless CMS and E-commerce platforms including Centra, Shopify, and MedusaJS.
* Participating in projects & teams alongside major brands and large organizations, and contributing to emerging tech trends and innovations.


**Who You Are**
* You're a developer with a passion for innovation and a knack for problem-solving.
* You're eager to learn, grow, and take on new challenges.
* You value collaboration, diversity, and the opportunity to make a significant impact.
* You believe in the power of technology to shape the future.
* You have worked professionally as a Web Developer for at least 5 years.


 Why Umain?
   

  

* Career Framework: We believe in fairness and clarity, which is why we've established a transparent career framework to ensure equal pay and equal opportunities for all. Your growth and success are as important to us as they are to you. Together with your coach, you will build your own development plan and grow in your career.
* Work-Life Balance: At Umain, diversity is our strength. We understand that life doesn’t pause when you walk into the office. That's why we've cultivated an environment that supports an excellent work-life balance. We welcome team members from all walks of life, recognizing the richness that different backgrounds, ages, and life stages bring to our team. We're committed to supporting each other, encouraging a healthy work-life balance that respects your needs, whether it's taking care of your family, your pets, or yourself.
* Innovations and Learning: Technology is always evolving, bringing new challenges and opportunities for collaboration and learning. Our developers work closely with designers, analysts, testers and more to tackle these challenges head-on, sharing knowledge and growing together.
* Skills Over Degrees: We’re more interested in what you can do than in the diplomas you hold. Talent, drive, and creativity are what count at Umain. Here, you’ll find opportunities to grow, learn, and excel in your career, regardless of your educational background. If you have the ambition and commitment to succeed, we have the environment and resources to support your journey.


**Are you ready to SHAPE, SHIP, and SCALE with us?**
 If you're a developer who thrives on innovation, values a supportive and inclusive workplace, and is eager to make a tangible impact on the future, we’d love to hear from you. Let’s build something awesome together.
   

  

 Umain is a digital product consultancy. We shape, ship and scale digital products at speed. Founded in Stockholm in 2001, we are a growing team of 100+ experts in digital product strategy, design, and technology.
   

  

 We are a part of Eidra, a group of top-notch companies specializing in strategy, creativity, and engineering. As a collective we guide leaders in making meaningful and lasting change.

title: Data Analytics Lead, Consumer Pricing
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Consumer Pricing Analytics focuses on driving efficient top-line growth in a capital-efficient manner. We tackle affordability challenges, measure the effectiveness of incentive programs, and optimize fee and incentive structures through rigorous experimentation. Partnering closely with Product, Finance, and Strategy & Operations, we provide the analytical backbone that guides measurement, strategic bets, and day-to-day decisions.
   

  

 At Wolt’s scale, marketing and growth decisions involve complex trade-offs and exciting opportunities to influence business outcomes. Our team brings together top talent in Data Science and Analytics Engineering to solve these challenges and shape the future of pricing and incentives at Wolt. As we grow to the next level of maturity, you will help expand our analytical capabilities across different business domains and drive real business impact.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We’re looking for an awesome specialist to join Wolt as a
 **Data Analytics Lead** 
 in
 **Finland, Sweden, or Germany** 
 . As a Data Analytics Lead at Wolt, you are essential in revolutionizing our pricing and incentive strategies. Positioned at the forefront, this lead will steer pricing operations, develop comprehensive strategies, and ensure alignment with the company's overarching objectives. Acting as a critical partner to senior business and product leaders, this role will drive the Pricing & Incentives domain forward, shaping the future of our initiatives.
   

  

 Key responsibilities include defining and monitoring key performance indicators to gauge the effectiveness of incentive programs and pricing components. The role offers an exciting opportunity to brainstorm 0-to-1 growth investment opportunities and establish the foundation for our investment efficiency measurements. Additionally, this leader will take on the exciting responsibility of leading and growing a dynamic team of go-getters to achieve tangible business impact.
   

  

 Success in this role requires exceptional leadership and project management skills, along with strong communication and interpersonal abilities. Collaborating effectively with cross-functional teams will be crucial in fostering a culture of shared success and innovation. This position offers a thrilling opportunity to shape the future of growth at Wolt!
   

  

 Our offering to you
   

  

* The online delivery platform that Wolt is building will offer you interesting and complex challenges together with the opportunities to create a big impact with your skills. Lots of geolocational and temporal data in real-time combined with differences in the economics and dynamics of the cities we operate in make Wolt both a challenging and so interesting company to practice analytics!
* You would get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, we think big but stay humble, do right by people, we treat others kindly and justly, recognize that if we don’t learn, we won’t stay still but fall behind and keep in mind that Luke was Yoda’s greatest achievement.


 Our humble expectations
   

  

* 7+ years of experience in a Data Analytics or Data Science position, with 3+ years of leadership experience.
* Track record of hiring, mentoring, and growing high-performing data science teams.
* Expertise with SQL and statistical analysis using Python, R, or equivalent.
* Strong know-how on experimentation techniques (A/B testing and causal inference) and hypothesis testing.
* Clear and concise communication with strong cross-functional partnership experience.
* Relentless pursuit of new ideas and data sources, and have the ability to systematically tackle ambiguous problems with a data-driven, hypothesis-based approach.
* Ability to work and communicate effectively in English.
* Bonus: Familiarity with multi-sided marketplaces and price optimization.


 Next steps
   

  

 The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!
   

  

 The compensation will be a combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie!
   

  

 For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Talent Acquisition Partner - Zhanna Filintseva
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Dynamics 365 Solution Architect
description:
**Vill du ha en nyckelroll i att skapa lösningar på Microsofts mest kraftfulla plattformar? På Innofactor Solutions söker vi en senior Dynamics 365 Solution Architect som vill kombinera affärsförståelse med teknisk spets och driva projekt från första idé till färdig implementering.**
**Om rollen**
 Vi växer i
 **Stockholm** 
 och möter ett ökat kundbehov av avancerade Microsoft-lösningar. Nu söker vi en
 **senior Dynamics 365 Solution Architect** 
 som vill ta helhetsansvar för att designa och implementera lösningar som skapar verklig affärsnytta i regionen.
   

  

 I den här rollen leder du arbetet från första kunddialog till färdig leverans och är länken mellan affärsbehov och teknik. Du arbetar nära sälj, utvecklare och kunder och driver projekt där hela Microsoft-ekosystemet tas tillvara.
   

  

**Huvudansvar:**
* Designa och implementera lösningar i Dynamics 365 Sales och Customer Service, gärna även Field Service eller Business Central.
* Skapa integrationslösningar med API:er, Azure Service Bus och Logic Apps samt modellera processer och anpassa Dynamics efter verksamhetens behov.
* Delta i pre-sale, ta fram lösningsförslag, demo och presentationsmaterial.


 Tjänsten är placerad i
 **Stockholm** 
 . Du kan självklart arbeta både hemifrån och från vårt centrala kontor, men vi ser gärna att du bor i Stockholmsområdet och kan komma in regelbundet.
   

  

**Det vi letar efter**
 ✅ Djup erfarenhet av Dynamics 365 och Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, gärna Power Virtual Agents/AI Builder)
   

  

 ✅ Stark kompetens inom integrationslösningar (API, Azure Service Bus, Logic Apps)
   

  

 Vi tror att du trivs här om du är nyfiken, självgående och gillar att samarbeta nära kund. Vårt team arbetar agilt med stor frihet under ansvar.
   

  

**Saker som kan vara till hjälp, men som du inte behöver kunna från början**
 ➕ Power BI – diskutera arkitektur och skapa enklare dashboards för demo/PoC
   

  

 ➕ Förståelse om hur AI kan användas för kundinsikter och prediktiv analys
   

  

 ➕ Certifiering Power Platform Solution Architect Expert (meriterande om du redan har Dynamics 365 Solution Architect Expert)
   

  

**Vad du får hos oss**
 Du blir en nyckelspelare i strategiska projekt för några av Nordens mest spännande kunder. Här får du frihet att forma lösningar som gör skillnad och en kultur som värdesätter innovation, kompetensdelning och balans i livet.
   

  

**Förmåner**
 Utöver lönen får du flera förmåner som gör vardagen smidigare och roligare:
   

  

* Kompetensutveckling
* Flexibelt arbete
* Kollegor som stöttar och delar med sig
* Aktiviteter och nätverk


**Innofactor** 
 är den ledande drivkraften bakom den moderna digitala organisationen i Norden. Vi jobbar med över 1 000 kunder inom både privat och offentlig sektor, har det bredaste lösningsutbudet och den starkaste Microsoft-kompetensen i regionen. Vi är cirka 550 specialister i Finland, Sverige, Danmark och Norge.
   

  

 👉 www.innofactor.com
   

  

 #PeopleFirst #AIDriven #BeTheRealYou

title: Domänarkitekt nätverk
description:
**Har du erfarenhet av att designa och vidareutveckla säkra och stabila nätverkslösningar? Är du den nyfikna personen som gillar utmaningar? Har du viljan och förmågan att ständigt lära nytt och vara med att utveckla oss och dig själv? Vill du arbeta med en avancerad nätverksinfrastruktur i en organisation som är i stor tillväxt och med syfte att bidra till att göra Sverige och världen säkrare? Då kan du vara den vi söker.**
**Om tjänsten**
 Som domänarkitekt nätverk hos oss får du en central roll i att säkerställa att våra system och nätverk är säkra, robusta och ändamålsenliga. Du kommer att arbeta i en miljö där höga krav på tillgänglighet, säkerhet och regelefterlevnad är en självklarhet. Din roll innebär domänarkitekt inom nätverk, där du analyserar verksamhetens behov och tar fram målarkitekturer och färdplaner för nätverksområdet.
   

  

 I denna roll arbetar du nära tjänsteområdet nätverk- och datakommunikation, IT-specialister och andra IT-arkitekter för att utveckla en modern och framtidssäkrad IT-infrastruktur. Vid behov stödjer du även andra projekt inom Infrastrukturstaben och verksamheten.
   

  

 Tjänsten är placerad i Stockholm. Resor och beredskap kan förekomma.
   

  

**Om dig**
 Vi söker dig som har högskoleutbildning inom relevant område eller har förvärvat motsvarande kompetens som FMV bedömer värdefull för tjänsten på annat sätt. Vi ser att du har flerårig aktuell och relevant erfarenhet av IT-arkitektur inom nätverksområdet inklusive erfarenhet av att arbeta med målarkitekturer och att utveckla långsiktiga planer. Vi förutsätter att du har kunskap om på marknaden vanligt förekommande produkter och lösningar. Du har även god förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på både svenska och engelska samt innehar körkort B. Vi ser det som meriterande om du har kunskap och erfarenhet om ITIL och förvaltningsstyrning.
   

  

 Personliga egenskaper är av stor vikt för oss. Vi välkomnar sökande med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter och söker dig som har en vilja och förmåga att lära och utvecklas. Det innebär att du i grunden är stabil, strukturerad och kvalitetsmedveten samtidigt som du är flexibel och kreativ när du ställs inför ändrade omständigheter. Du ser möjligheter i förändringar och är orädd att presentera nya mera effektiva lösningar och arbetssätt. Du är en utpräglad lagspelare och relaterar till andra på ett lyhört och smidigt sätt.
   

  

 Hos oss har du möjlighet att nyttja din kunskap och kompetens. Vill du dessutom förkovra dig så finns det bra möjligheter till kompetensutveckling. Vi som arbetar här idag tycker om att bidra till att göra skillnad.
   

  

**FMV – Försvarets materielverk**
 På FMV är du med och bidrar till att göra Sverige och världen säkrare. Vi har i uppdrag att förse det svenska försvaret med den senaste tekniken och kunskapen så att de kan försvara vårt land och våra allierade. Tillsammans med kompetenta och engagerade kollegor får du vara med och utveckla och upphandla det som ibland inte existerar än. Du driver utvecklingen, hela vägen från behov till leverans. Från idé till verklighet.
   

  

 Infrastrukturstaben ansvarar för utveckling, förvaltning och drift och av informationssystem. Infrastrukturstaben arbetar för att styra myndigheten inom IT-området genom att planera, genomföra och följa upp IT-verksamheten inom FMV.
   

  

 I tjänsten som Domänarkitekt nätverk tillhör du avdelningen för IT Drift och Infrastruktur.
   

  

 Hos FMV erbjuds du en trygg anställning med bra förmåner:
   

  

* Kompetensutveckling och karriärmöjligheter
* Flexibel arbetstid och möjlighet till distansarbete i den mån arbetet tillåter
* Tjänstepension och friskvårdsbidrag


 Läs mer om FMV som arbetsgivare och om de förmåner vi erbjuder på vår hemsida: Arbeta på FMV.
   

  

 Vill du vara med och utveckla framtidens försvar? Välkommen med din ansökan senast den 30 oktober.
   

  

**Bra att veta**
* Du ansöker genom att bifoga ditt CV, betyg och intyg på svenska. I ditt CV beskriver du tydligt på vilket sätt du uppfyller efterfrågade kvalifikationer och meriter. För en mer inkluderande rekryteringsprocess tar vi inte emot några personliga brev.
* Vi rekryterar kompetensbaserat och bedömer kandidater utifrån rollens krav på erfarenhet, kompetens och personliga egenskaper.
* Våra fackliga företrädare är SACO-S Elisabeth From, OFR/S Lena Sköld Gunnarsson, OFR/O Lars Mörrby och SEKO Peter Andersson. Alla nås via FMV:s växel: 08-782 4000.
* Vid frågor om tjänsten kan du kontakta Niclas Holmkvist på 072 995 66 26 eller via FMV:s växel: 08-782 4000. Kontakta Anki Snis på 0703-775969 vid frågor om rekryteringsprocessen.


 För att jobba hos oss behöver du vara svensk medborgare och genomgå en säkerhetsprövning i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen. Vi tillämpar provanställning och som anställd kommer du att krigsplaceras utifrån totalförsvarets behov. Ansökningar till befattningen tas endast emot via FMV:s webbplats eller registratur. Vi har gjort vårt medieval och undanber oss därför försäljning av annons- och rekryteringstjänster.

title: Fullstack AI Engineer
description:
Fullstack Engineer
 
 📍 Stockholm, Sweden
 



 💼 Full time
 


 About the Role
 
 We’re looking for a Fullstack Engineer to join our Stockholm team. You’ll be part of a small, ambitious group working on applications end-to-end, from frontend, backend, pipelines and model development to deployment in cloud environments.
 



 Most of what we build integrates AI technologies in some way, whether that’s embedding machine learning models, leveraging large language models, or building systems around state-of-the-art AI tools.
 



 This is a great role if you want to grow your skills across the stack while working hands-on with modern tech in real production environments.
 



  




 Responsibilities
 
 Your work would include:
 


* Frontend: Develop frontends with TypeScript/React (or similar frameworks)
* Backend: Build backends in Python (or similar languages)
* Cloud: Deploy applications in GCP, AWS, or Azure
* AI Integration: Work on applications that integrate AI models and services
* Full Lifecycle: Contribute to the full lifecycle: design, coding, testing, deployment, monitoring
* Collaboration: Collaborate closely with clients and internal teams to ensure project success



  




 Background and Skills
 
 We’re open to a wide range of backgrounds but here’s what we’re looking for in an ideal candidate:
 


* Some experience with frontend development (React, TypeScript, or similar)
* Some experience with backend development (Python or similar)
* Comfortable working in cloud environments (e.g., GCP, AWS, Azure)
* Practical experience in software engineering, including version control, testing, and CI/CD
* Strong interest in AI powered applications and learning more about them
* Have a collaborative mindset and willingness to take ownership of your work
* Motivated, curious, and passionate about technology, with strong communication skills
* Professional proficiency in Swedish and English



  





*Please note that you must have permission to work in Sweden, we will not sponsor any work visas at this time*




  




 About Us
 
 We are a modern AI consultancy firm originally founded in Malmö, Sweden. Recently, we’ve expanded to Stockholm, where we’re building a small but ambitious team of machine learning and software engineers.
 


* At our Stockholm office, you’ll find a high degree of autonomy, flexibility, and influence. We want your voice not only in code reviews and architecture discussions, but in shaping what our company becomes, from the types of clients we work with to how we grow our local presence.

title: CDN Product Development Area Lead
description:
**Are you passionate about building the future of streaming technology? 🎬🍎** 




 Do you thrive in fast-paced environments, love leading talented teams, and want to make a real impact on how millions of people experience content? If so,
 **Edgeware, part of Agile Content** 
 has the perfect opportunity for you.
 



 We’re looking for an experienced and visionary
 **Area Lead** 
 to take ownership of our
 **Content Delivery Network (CDN)** 
 product development. This is a pivotal leadership role where you’ll oversee the
 **strategic direction, technical execution, and operational excellence** 
 of our CDN offerings, reporting directly to the VP of Engineering.
 



 🔧
 **Your Mission** 




 You’ll lead
 **three distinct Chapters** 
 — CDN Classic, New CDN Generation, and CDN Innovation — guiding a team of
 **14 highly skilled engineers** 
 working across remote and hybrid setups. Your role will be central to shaping the future of our CDN products, with a strong focus on innovation, scalability, and performance.
 



 Key Responsibilities:
 


* **Strategic Leadership:**
* Define and execute the technical strategy and roadmap for all CDN product lines, ensuring alignment with company objectives and market demands.
* **Team Management & Development:**
* Lead, mentor, and empower three Chapter Leads. Foster a culture of high performance, continuous learning, and collaboration. Oversee resource allocation, performance reviews, and career development.
* **Product Development Oversight:**
* *CDN Classic:* 
 Provide strategic oversight for our Vietnam-based team, ensuring quality delivery and effective collaboration.
* *New CDN Generation:* 
 Drive development of our CDN control plane, multi-CDN orchestration, anti-piracy features, and advanced request routing.
* *CDN Innovation:* 
 Explore emerging technologies and pioneer new CDN concepts to maintain a competitive edge.
* **Technical Direction:**
* Guide architectural decisions for C++ systems. Promote best practices in cloud environments (AWS, GCP, Azure), Kubernetes deployments, and on-premises infrastructure.
* **Cross-Functional Collaboration:**
* Work closely with Product Management, Operations, Sales, and other engineering areas to gather requirements, prioritize features, and ensure seamless product delivery.
* **Operational Excellence:**
* Establish and monitor KPIs for team performance, product quality, and operational efficiency. Drive continuous improvement initiatives.



 ✅
 **We’re Looking Forward to Hearing from You If You Have:** 




 👑 Leadership skills and experience managing multiple development teams
 



 📚 Business knowledge and strategic thinking
 



 🔍 Ability to see the big picture while delivering on short-term objectives
 



 💬 Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills
 



 💪 Self-motivation and ownership mindset
 



 🚀 Willingness to take on challenges
 



 💡 Entrepreneurial spirit and a passion for learning
 



 🛠️ Hands-on, action-oriented approach
 



 🎯 A desire to win in a highly competitive environment
 



 📌
 **Required Qualifications:** 



* 12+ years in software development, with 4–6 years in engineering leadership
* Proven experience mentoring technical leads or managers
* Solid understanding of SDLC and agile methodologies
* Proficiency in C++ development environments
* Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) and Kubernetes
* SaaS development experience
* Strong architectural skills in distributed systems and high-performance computing
* Deep understanding of IP networking and HTTP protocol
* Excellent communication and leadership skills



 🌟
 **Desired Qualifications:** 



* Experience with CDN, video streaming, or large-scale distributed systems
* Familiarity with anti-piracy technologies or advanced routing algorithms
* Experience managing outsourced development teams
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field



 💡
 **Why Join Agile Content?** 




 At Agile Content, we don’t just build technology — we build the future of streaming. Here’s what makes us different:
 


* **🎯 Thrilling Projects** 
 – Work on exciting, high-impact products with real technological challenges.
* **🌍 Global Reach** 
 – Collaborate with some of the world’s leading brands and diverse, international teams.
* **💡 Innovation That Matters** 
 – Your work will be seen and used by millions — including your friends and family!
* **🧘 Work-Life Flexibility** 
 – Enjoy flexible hours, remote-friendly policies, and a culture that values balance.
* **🌈 Cultural Diversity** 
 – Join a multicultural team where different perspectives are celebrated.
* **📚 Continuous Learning** 
 – Stay sharp with access to industry events, summits, and learning resources.



 🎁
 **Perks & Benefits** 




 💸 Flexible Compensation Program with Cobee
 



 ⌚ Schedule Flexibility
 



 🏠 Hybrid/remote friendly
 



 🎉 Birthday Off
 



 ☀️ 4 Fridays Off per Year
 



 🌴 Extra Days Off
 



 🤝 Referral Bonus Program
 



 🗣️ Free English Lessons with Twenix
 



 At
 **Agile Content** 
 , we’re committed to building a diverse, inclusive, and empowering workplace. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and identities. 🌈

title: Backend Engineer (Markets)
description:
**Description**
*Position at LeoVegas Group*
**About The Role**
 Are you an experienced software engineer looking for a meaningful role in a dynamic environment? Join our Markets Platform Team at LeoVegas Group, where you will play a crucial role in enhancing our global customer onboarding process and developing responsible gaming features. Your work will ensure a seamless, secure, and enjoyable experience for our customers across all our brands.
   

  

 In this position, you will focus on refining the onboarding journey and promoting responsible gaming. Our mission is to create a safe gaming environment where players can set healthy limits on their gambling habits. We leverage data-driven insights and a robust CI/CD process, following the Kanban methodology to deliver high-quality solutions. You will work alongside expert back-end developers specialising in Java and Kotlin, as well as dedicated Quality Assurance Engineers.
   

  

 YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:
   

  

* Developing a multi-brand gaming platform called Rhino, built on 230+ microservices.
* Driving continuous improvement in the player onboarding process and responsible gaming solutions through innovative solutions.
* Testing (unit tests) and updating documentation.
* Participating in architectural discussions and suggesting ideas for technical improvements.
* Collaborate with Product Managers and other stakeholders to deliver innovative solutions that enhance customer onboarding and promote responsible gaming.
* Working closely with Backend Engineers, QA Engineers and TA Engineers.


 OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE THE FOLLOWING:
   

  

**Essential Skills**
* Min. 3 years of experience in using Java + Spring Boot framework
* You have experience with MySQL
* You are familiar with microservice architectures


 NICE TO HAVES
   

  

* Experience with Kotlin, Git, Kafka, Jenkins, Pekko or Akka Hazelcast, Elasticsearch.
* Familiarity with Google Cloud Platform and BigQuery.
* Strong understanding of API testing methodologies and hands-on experience with tools like Postman.
* Knowledge of Automated Testing.


**Who We Are**
 At the core of LeoVegas Group is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We’re a team of over 1400 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 11 offices worldwide.
   

  

**Benefits**
* Hybrid work policy
* 4 weeks of Workation (T&C apply)
* 30 annual vacation days
* Occupational Pension
* 5,000 SEK wellness contribution annually
* Parental Leave Top-Up
* Possibility to enroll in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner
* 1,500 SEK equipment allowance
* Benify - benefits portal with many offers and discounts
* We offer a relocation package with accommodation and flights.


 JOIN US!
   

  

 In our pride, we empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait for things to happen; we pounce and make it happen!
   

  

 Would you be a good fit for the Leo Pride - give us a roar!
   

  

 \*\*As our company working language is English, we’d like to see your CV in English, please\*\*

title: Principal Product Architect, 2 Hour Learning (Remote) - $400,000/year USD
description:
Are you a visionary tech leader eager to revolutionize education with AI? Join 2 Hour Learning as a Principal Product Architect and lead the transformation of our AI-driven learning ecosystem. This role requires the technical prowess akin to a CTO, combined with a product visionary mindset to drive groundbreaking change, all while empowering students to achieve unparalleled success.
   

  

 Unlike others who simply add AI to existing models, we at 2 Hour Learning have reimagined the educational landscape, leveraging AI and learning science to break free from traditional classroom limitations. Our students excel, achieving top scores on AP exams, experiencing years of academic growth in just one, and consistently surpassing their own expectations. With AI as the core of our learning system, student success skyrockets.
   

  

 This isn't your standard product management role focused on incremental feature updates. As a technical product owner at the executive level, you'll shape the architecture, technical strategy, and AI integration of our learning system. Your task is to make strategic technical decisions that ensure our products are streamlined, scalable, and laser-focused on enhancing student outcomes. Think like a CTO, act like a product entrepreneur, and merge engineering excellence with learning science insights to drive continuous breakthroughs.
   

  

 If you're prepared to lead the technical revolution in education and have the determination to match your ambition, we invite you to apply. Seize this opportunity to shape the future of learning.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Exhibit profound expertise in education products to influence strategic choices
* Create technical specifications that prioritize simplicity, efficiency, and sustainability through key technical decisions
* Implement generative AI technologies to automate and enhance engineering processes, aligning with our vision to minimize manual labor


**What You Won’t Be Doing**
* Engaging in pure people management; your role relies on both business and technical expertise
* Spending time in meetings, committees, or handling administrative duties; we have automated these tasks to let you focus on delivering business value through direct involvement
* Developing high-level strategies without actionable implementation plans; your insights must be grounded in product-level understanding


**Principal Product Architect Key Responsibilities**
* Serve as the CTO for one or more educational products, mastering core competencies and driving business value through strategic execution and decision-making


**Basic Requirements**
* Profound experience and enthusiasm for data-driven learning science
* Over 7 years of experience in making pivotal architecture and design decisions on software projects, including the use of architectural design patterns or significant open-source technologies
* At least 2 years of experience in making design decisions involving cloud computing services, mainly AWS
* More than 4 years in roles with full technical and delivery responsibility for a revenue-generating product
* Experience in developing product features that leverage Generative AI
* Proficiency in using Generative AI to optimize work processes


**About 2 Hour Learning**
 Education is broken, but 2 Hour Learning is proving it doesn’t have to be. They’re tearing down the outdated one-size-fits-all model and replacing it with AI-driven personalized learning that helps kids master academics in just two hours a day.
   

  

**With students consistently ranking in the top 1-2% nationally and the top 20% achieving an astonishing 6.5x growth, they’re proving that smarter learning is possible. At 2 Hour Learning, it’s talent and performance that matter.**
 They offer a dynamic, on-campus and remote-friendly environment where innovators, educators, and AI specialists can be a part of fixing a broken school system.
   

  

**2 Hour Learning is reprogramming learning for the AI era.**
**Here’s How They’re Fixing It.**
 There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!
   

  

**Working with us**
 This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover as a Contractor of Record. The compensation level for this role is $200 USD/hour, which equates to $400,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.
   

  

 Crossover Job Code: LJ-5590-SE-Stockhol-PrincipalProdu

title: Measurement Solutions Field Application Engineer
description:
**Intro Text**
--------------

**Are you an experienced engineer with deep technical understanding of communication and data collection in the automotive industry? Do you want to work with the latest technology in measurement systems while being part of a global company with a strong local culture? Then you are welcome to apply for this position.**

  

As a **Measurement Solutions Engineer** at **Vector**, you will work closely with our customers in the Nordics and our international colleagues using the latest technology. You will be a technical expert in the measurement and analysis of embedded systems.


Our platform for advanced measurement and analysis is called **CANape**, which can also run on specially developed hardware. **VX1000** is our interface for embedded systems. See https://www.vector.com/canape

  

You will have the opportunity to influence the future of mobility in an industry currently undergoing a technological revolution. We are looking for someone who wants to help drive that development forward. Real-time measurement and analysis on Linux-based systems is one example. Travel is primarily within Sweden, but occasionally within the Nordics and to our headquarters in Germany.

 **Vector** is a global technology company with over 4,500 employees at more than 30 locations worldwide. We develop tools, software, and services to simplify the development of embedded systems. In Sweden, we have offices in Gothenburg (Lindholmen Science Park) and Linköping, where we combine the closeness of a small company with the resources of a large one.

**Your Tasks**
--------------

* Consulting on measurement solutions and data mining / advanced analysis for embedded systems in automotive (light and heavy vehicles)
* Assisting our customers as an expert with advanced troubleshooting, analysis, and data mining
* Collaborating with international teams and participating in global projects at Vector
* Contributing to technical presentations, seminars, and knowledge sharing
**Your Profile**
----------------

* Several years of industry experience, high service level, and self-drive with a “go the extra mile” attitude
* Programming experience, as we often assist our customers with customized scripts for our products
* Solid understanding of communication buses in automotive such as CAN, Ethernet, and XCP, among others
* Strong understanding of embedded systems and real-time systems from both a hardware and software perspective
* Fluent in Swedish and English, both spoken and written
**Techstack**
-------------

*C & C++*
company_description: Vector ist der kompetente Partner für die Entwicklung von Elektronik im Automobil – und das seit über 35 Jahren, mit mehr als 4.500 Mitarbeitenden an über 30 Standorten weltweit.

--------------

**Are you an experienced engineer with deep technical understanding of test environments in the automotive industry? Do you want to work with the latest technology in safety-critical systems while being part of a global company with a strong local culture? Then you are welcome to apply for this position.**

  

As a **Test Solutions Engineer** at **Vector**, you will work closely with our customers and international colleagues using the latest technology. You will be a technical expert in test environments and tools such as **CANoe**, **VT System**, and **virtualization**.


You will have the opportunity to influence the future of mobility in an industry currently undergoing a technological revolution. We are looking for someone who wants to help drive that development forward — *“From Software Factory to HIL Farms.”*

title: Systems Engineer – ALTEN Sweden in Stockholm
description:
Are you passionate about designing and integrating complex systems that combine electronics, software, and mechanical components? Do you thrive in dynamic, cross-disciplinary projects and want to make a real impact on next-generation technology? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you!



We’re looking for someone who has:

* A **Bachelor’s or Master’s degree** in Systems Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
* Minimum 5 years of experience with **SysML/UML modeling tools** such as Cameo Systems Modeler, Enterprise Architect, IBM Rational Rhapsody, or Capella.
* Minimum 5 years of experience with **MATLAB/Simulink modeling environments** (System Composer) and/or Python.
* Strong communication skills and the ability to work **independently or collaboratively** in project teams.


It’s also a plus if you have experience with:

* **Requirements management tools** like DOORS Next Generation, JIRA/Confluence, or similar platforms for traceability.


As a Systems Engineer, you will have an opportunity to contribute to diverse and exciting assignments, including:

* Designing and integrating systems across electrical, electronic, and software domains.
* Modeling system behavior and architecture using SysML/UML.
* Developing simulation models and control algorithms in MATLAB/Simulink or Python.
* Working on prototype and proof-of-concept projects for innovative technology solutions.
* Collaborating with cross-functional teams to develop, verify, and test systems end-to-end.
* Exploring emerging technologies, from battery-electric vehicles and autonomous systems to industrial machinery and aerospace applications.
* Supporting process improvements, automating workflows, and introducing new tools and methodologies.

**About ALTEN**


ALTEN is one of Europe’s largest technology and IT consulting companies with over 57,000 employees in nearly 30 countries. Our engineers carry out complex and highly technical projects throughout the value chain of the most prestigious companies in all sectors,such as Automotive, Defense, Energy & Environment, Industry, Public services & Government and Life Sciences. In Sweden, we are about 1300 committed employees with 9offices in 9 cities – from Lund in the south to Skellefteå in the north.


For the fifthyear in a row, ALTEN has been named one of Sweden’s most attractive employers by Karriärföretagen, an award for employers that offer unique career and development opportunities.

  

Welcome to read more about us at alten.se

title: 3D CAD Engineer – ALTEN Sweden in Stockholm
description:
Are you passionate about turning ideas into precise 3D models and detailed designs? We are looking for a talented 3D CAD Engineer to join our team in Stockholm, working on innovative projects across a variety of industries.



We are looking for someone who brings:

* A **Bachelor’s or Master’s degree** in Mechanical Engineering, Industrial Engineering, Aeronautical Engineering, or a related technical field.
* Around **3 years of experience** in at least one major 3D CAD system, such as **CATIA, PTC Creo, Siemens NX, or SolidWorks**.
* Good communication skills and the ability to **work independently or within teams**.


It’s a plus if you have:

* Experience with **Finite Element Analysis (FEA)** for structural or thermal simulations (e.g., ANSYS, Abaqus).
* Familiarity with **scripting or programming** for automation (e.g., Python or MATLAB).
* Experience within **heavy industry, automotive, aerospace, telecom, or industrial machinery** sectors.

**What You’ll Do:**

* Design and develop **3D models of parts** using professional CAD software.
* Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to ensure designs meet functional, manufacturing, and integration requirements.
* Participate in **design reviews**, contributing ideas to improve efficiency, performance, and manufacturability.
* Support prototype development and testing when needed.
* Work independently or as part of **project teams** on exciting, challenging assignments.

ALTEN is one of Europe’s largest technology and IT consulting companies with over 57,000 employees in nearly 30 countries. title: VIP Support Engineer
description:
**Role definition** 

**Job Description**

* **The Band 2 – Desktop Technician will provide day to day local\remote desktop support, receive inbound calls, answer questions, troubleshoot and document steps performed to resolve challenges with hardware, software and application issues in a ticketing system. The candidate will also need to facilitate customer resolution for calls and engage their supervisors and managers to ensure operational consistency across all shifts within the IT Support Center. Desktop Support Engineer provides Break Fix, fault diagnosis and resolution. Providing fault analysis to customer’s various core operating systems and platforms, as well be able to provide support and apply desktop fault resolution for the approved application suite. Ideal candidate should have 2-3 Years’ experience in Windows Desktop support.**

**Position Responsibilities and Functions**

* **Provide first/second level contact and problem resolution for customer issues.**
* **Handling VIP Users**
* **Work with vendors to remediate complex AV issues as needed.**
* **Provide timely communication on issue status and resolution.**
* **Maintain ticket updates for all reported incidents.**
* **Install, upgrade, support and troubleshoot XP, Windows 7, Windows 8.1, Windows 10 and Microsoft Office 2010, Cisco Jabber, another authorized desktop application.**
* **Should have basic knowledge of Mac operating system, to support Apple pc users.**
* **Install, upgrade, support and troubleshoot for printers, computer hardware.**
* **Performs general preventative maintenance tasks on computers, laptops, printers.**
* **Performs remedial repairs on Desktops, laptops, printers and any other authorized peripheral equipment.**
* **Use diagnostic tools to troubleshoot problems associated with network connectivity, and workstation hardware/software.**
* **Broad experience of IT with basic understanding of Networks, Servers, Audio/Visual, Smart Devices and Telecoms.**
* **This position requires the ability to work in a project-based environment requiring flexibility and teamwork. Performs other duties as assigned.**
* **VIP User Support**

**Candidate Required Minimum Qualifications and Skills**

* **Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent in Computer Science or related field.**
* **CompTIA A+, Microsoft Certified Professional (MCP) or better.**
* **Minimum of 18 months years of IT experience.**
* **Windows 7-10, Microsoft Active Directory, utilization of GPOs, MS Office 365, PC hardware installation and troubleshooting, Enterprise anti-virus solutions, Helpdesk ticketing systems.**
* **Mobile device management including IOS and Android devices, Enterprise encryption solutions, Windows PC/laptop management via Active Directory.**
* **Proven analytical, troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.**
* **Proven ability to multi-task, effectively determine priorities and meet SLA’s.**
* **Excellent communication relationship-building and internal customer service skills.**
* **Adaptable and flexible in a fast-changing industry and work environment.**
* **Willing to work off-hours and weekends when required for projects or emergency support.**

**In addition, the Band 2 Technician will mentor and assist Band 1 technicians in their work and provide support to Band 3 Engineers in resolving tickets.** 

Job Type: Contract  
Contract length: 6 months

Pay: 1 600,00kr - 2 000,00kr per day

Language:

* Swedish (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Procurement Business Partner / Category Manager - Indirect Material & Services, ABB Robotics
description:
At ABB, we help industries outrun - leaner and cleaner. Here, progress is an expectation - for you, your team, and the world. As a global market leader, we’ll give you what you need to make it happen. It won’t always be easy, growing takes grit. But at ABB, you’ll never run alone. Run what runs the world.


This Position reports to:


Global Procurement Manager  

We are looking for a Procurement Business Partner / Category Manager responsible for categories within indirect material and services procurement. You will be part of a small team responsible for indirect material and service procurement within ABB Robotics. Our primary focus is Sweden but we are working in a global team. Our responsibility covers everything from defining the sourcing strategy, performing supplier qualifications, running sourcing events and negotiations, developing the relationship and processes with the suppliers to working with internal stakeholders to capture their demand and develop processes to make it easy to buy indirect material and services.


The role reports to Region Manager Indirect Material & Service Procurement, ABB Robotics.


Your responsibilities:

* Develop, plan and implement sourcing strategy, and drive sourcing initiatives in order to deliver savings to target within defined categories.
* Manage a wide supplier base and develop it to fit to requirements of cost reduction, efficiency, quality, delivery and sustainability in accordance with company guidelines.
* Negotiate agreements based on corporate contractual framework with suppliers, periodically renew price lists, terms and conditions.
* Work with process improvements and system implementations, utilizing digital tools to make it easy to buy and always ensure transparency and compliance.
* Live ABB’s core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business.

**Your background**

* University degree in Engineering or Economics (minimum Bachelor´s degree) and at least 3-5 years of working experience within procurement. Experience from working with indirect procurement is beneficial.
* Strong background from sourcing and being an experienced negotiator.
* Ability to develop sourcing strategies, the skill and motivation to do the hands-on sourcing, run negotiations and manage contracting.
* Analytical and result-oriented and have a structured approach solving problems and delivering to target.
* Curious and quick to learn new things enabling you to handle a broad range of indirect material and service categories throughout the company and capture demand and requirements from many stakeholders.
* Strong communication skills (written and spoken) and the ability to create commitment with stakeholders in all levels of the organization.
* Fluent in Swedish and English, written and spoken.

**More about us**


ABB Robotics & Discrete Automation Business area provides robotics, and machine and factory automation including products, software, solutions and services. Revenues are generated both from direct sales to end users as well as from indirect sales mainly through system integrators and machine builders.


www.abb.com/robotics


Recruiting Manager (Annika Stigeberg, +46 (0)70-303 1892) will answer your questions about the position. Union representatives – Sveriges Ingenjörer: Pia Sandström, +4672 525 90 30; Ledarna: Lenny Larsson, +46 706 32 85 47; Unionen: Roger L. Gustavsson, +46 730 30 30 36. All other questions can be directed to Talent Partner Johannes Westermark Hester.


Apply today and help us change together the course of an entire industry. Please note that interviews will be held on an ongoing basis. **Last day to apply is however 2025-10-31**.


We look forward to receiving your application. If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website www.abb.com.

**Exciting Career Opportunity in Robotics**


This role sits within ABB’s Robotics business, a leading global robotics company. We’re entering an exciting new chapter as we’ve announced the plan for SoftBank Group to acquire ABB Robotics. SoftBank is a globally recognized technology group and investor/operator focused on AI, robotics, and next-generation computing. By joining us now, you’ll be part of a pioneering team shaping the future of robotics—working alongside world-class experts in a fast-moving, innovation-driven environment.


Please note that to be eligible for employment at ABB Sweden, you will need to pass our pre-employment screening steps. This includes a reference check, a drug test, and could also include an extended background check.


We value people from different backgrounds. Could this be your story? Apply today or visit www.abb.com to read more about us and learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe.

title: System Verification Engineer
description:
**Location:**

Ludvika, Dalarna County, Sweden
**Job ID:**

R0100808
**Date Posted:**

2025-10-15
**Company Name:**

HITACHI ENERGY SWEDEN AB
**Profession (Job Category):**

Engineering & Science
**Job Schedule:**

Full time
**Remote:**

No
**Job Description:**

**The opportunity**

Join our expert team at Hitachi Energy and help shape the future of energy transmission. As a System Verification Engineer, you’ll work with cutting-edge embedded systems and contribute to the development of our MACH™ control system — the heart of HVDC stations that power long-distance electricity transmission with minimal loss.


Over 60 years ago, Hitachi Energy revolutionized long-distance electricity transmission with **High Voltage Direct Current (HVDC)** technology. Today, HVDC systems can deliver up to **12 gigawatts of power** at voltages reaching **1,100 kV** , spanning distances of over **3,000 kilometers** — making it one of the most efficient solutions for global energy transfer.


At the core of every HVDC station lies the **Modular Advanced Control for HVDC (MACH™)** system — a highly sophisticated control and protection platform. MACH™ offers exceptional computational power and seamless integration of all control functions. It features advanced fault registration, remote control capabilities, and is engineered to operate **24/7 for over 30 years** , ensuring unmatched reliability throughout the system’s lifetime.


As a System Verification Engineer, you’ll play a key role in the continued success of MACH™, contributing to its evolution and helping maintain its position as a global benchmark in HVDC control systems.


**How you’ll make an impact**

* Work with embedded real-time systems: prepare test environments, test code, and applications based on system requirements and international standards
* Build test environments using MACH™ Control System components, computers, servers, I/O boards, and simulation tools in the test lab
* Write and execute test cases to verify control system functionalities such as communication, analog, and digital acquisitions
* Map test cases to system requirements and support various software and hardware releases
* Develop and document test frameworks and tools for automated lab testing
* Design, develop, and document new or improved test automation functions (e.g., instrument control, software loading, data evaluation)
* Automate tests using our framework and maintain automation tools
* Support integration team tasks such as lab maintenance, license management, and customer support

**Your background**

* You hold a Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, Electrical engineering, Electronics engineering, or another related field, or have equivalent experience
* An ISTQB certification, SSDLC certification, knowledge of software and/or hardware testing as well as 3 or more years of experience from embedded system development or testing will be to your advantage
* Knowledge of graphical programming tools such as LabVIEW, MATLAB Simulink, LT spice, Hidraw, MACH platform
* Working with Agile framework and Git is considered a plus
* You are an experienced software developer programming in Python and C#
* Competent in object-oriented design, especially experience of SOLID object-oriented design principles will be to your advantage
* Proficiency in English is a must while Swedish is an added advantage

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks

**More About Us**

If you are passionate about people and how groups work together, we encourage you to apply! Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis.


Talent Acquisition Partner: Agnieszka Borkowska, +41 76 317 40 67, agnieszka.borkowska@hitachienergy.com will answer your questions about the position.


Union representatives – Sveriges Ingenjörer: Mikael Hjort, +46 107-38 25 73; Ledarna: Frank Hollstedt, +46 10 7387048; Unionen: Fredrik Holmgren, +46 107-38 21 85.


**Qualified individuals with a disability may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Hitachi Energy career site as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by completing a** **general inquiry form** **on our website. Please include your contact information and specific details about your required accommodation to support you during the job application process.**
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**This is solely for job seekers with disabilities requiring accessibility assistance or an accommodation in the job application process. Messages left for other purposes will not receive a response.**
